.hairline-button-text:not([class^="x_"]) {
color: #8ab4f8 !important;
}
.primary-button:not([class^="x_"]) {
background-color: #8ab4f8 !important;
}
.primary-button-text:not([class^="x_"]) {
color: #202124 !important;
}
}
.encryption-icon:not([class^="x_"]) {
background-image: url('https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/i/googlematerialiconsfilled/encrypted/v3/gm_grey200-24dp/2x/gm_filled_encrypted_gm_grey200_24dp.png') !important;
}
}
.prevent-link a {
color: inherit !important;
text-decoration: none !important;
font-size: inherit !important;
font-family: inherit !important;
font-weight: inherit !important;
line-height: inherit !important;
}

Sam & Dan,
Hi! We are noticing a long series of site outages. After attempting to fix the issue, we have confirmed there was a mistake in deleting and inputting the new IP. The old IP was not removed, just the new IP was added as a secondary IP. This means every single web request chooses effectively randomly between the correct new IP address and old disconnected IP address. This is causing the outages.
Dan, if you could please:
* Keep the 162.159.134.42 A record for powerhousearts.org
* Delete the 64.98.135.124 A record for powerhousearts.org
And the problem should be fixed.
Thank you for your patience!

From: Robert Nieves <rnieves@omegasystemscorp.com>
To: Erika Ellis <eellis@omegasystemscorp.com>, Leon Tchekmedyian
	<leon@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-11-18 17:48:48
Subject: RE: Re:

Hello Leon,
We reviewed this with our Service Desk Manager.
The request for Phoenix’s offboarding was sent in on 6/4/2024. This was completed the same day by Dan.
Our process for offboarding is to have a ticket submitted via an offboarding template.
Part of that offboarding is to remove licenses from the offboarded user however we do not delete accounts unless specifically noted.
In the case of Phoenix, this was completed.
Within Adobe there is no license assigned. Same for slack. ( See screenshots below)
The tickets you are reviewing have been automatically closed because they are being submitted from an automated system on your side.
I am not sure what triggers your system to determine if users have a license or not. Doing a physical check shows no license is assigned.
In regards to Ben, We do not manage the Momentus application. That was never in our application list.
As noted in past conversations, there have been some changes on what applications are supported internally vs what we have historically supported. We can revisit the application list again on our next call if you like.
Screenshots of Phoenix accounts in Adobe and Slack

Hello Leon,
We reviewed this with our Service Desk Manager.
The request for Phoenix’s offboarding was sent in on 6/4/2024. This was completed the same day by Dan.
Our process for offboarding is to have a ticket submitted via an offboarding template.
Part of that offboarding is to remove licenses from the offboarded user however we do not delete accounts unless specifically noted.
In the case of Phoenix, this was completed.
Within Adobe there is no license assigned. Same for slack. ( See screenshots below)
The tickets you are reviewing have been automatically closed because they are being submitted from an automated system on your side.
I am not sure what triggers your system to determine if users have a license or not. Doing a physical check shows no license is assigned.

Subject: Review DNS records

I'd like to review and clean up our DNS records; to verify that all the
TXT and CNAME records are necessary and being used.
;;
;; Domain: powerhousearts.org.
;; Exported: 2024-12-02 13:36:36
;;
;; This file is intended for use for informational and archival
;; purposes ONLY and MUST be edited before use on a production
;; DNS server. In particular, you must:
;; -- update the SOA record with the correct authoritative name server
;; -- update the SOA record with the contact e-mail address information
;; -- update the NS record(s) with the authoritative name servers for
this domain.
;;
;; For further information, please consult the BIND documentation
;; located on the following website:
;;

;;

;;

;;

The authorized billing contact for your organization can set up ACH to allow TNS to automatically process payment for open invoices and keep your account current. For more information on authorizing TNS to process ACH payments, please contact the TNS Finance Department.
If you would prefer to submit payments to TNS by ACH manually, please contact your Account Manager or the TNS Finance Department for assistance.

Hi, David. The PC I use for the embroidery machine is nearly dead. It’s no longer charging properly, and yesterday I couldn’t get it to turn on… this morning it at least is updating and on.It hasn’t been maintained. It’s still trying to sign into dropbox, and I can’t remember when we made the switch to box, but before 2022…It’s severely under capacity for what I need it to do… it’s basically a microsoft touchscreen ipad—it can’t crunch the numbers it has to do do a lot of automated functions in the embroidery program. But it’s still useful for drawing things out manually. It would be great to have a dedicated computer. I’m really not sure what hard drive capacity I need, but I can reach out to the software developer to ask. Our software should be updated as well to really get the machine running... It would be great if it can run photoshop and illustrator.

PH-GATEHOUSE-1 f8:9e:28:c5:87:78 06:04 PM EST on Nov 26

The troubleshooting tool available here: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Cross-Platform_Content/Alerts_and_Notifications/Dashboard_Alerts_-_Connectivity_Issues#Unreachable_Device(s)
helps cover the most common steps to check. If you need assistance, reach out to Meraki Support at any time.

*Updated Adobe Value Incentive Plan (VIP) Terms and Conditions*
Hi David,
You are receiving this email because you are a system administrator for an
organization with one or more active Adobe Value Incentive Plan (VIP)
Memberships. We want to let you know that some updates have been made to
the VIP Terms and Conditions
.
Until a system administrator accepts the updated terms, new users may
continue to be assigned Products, but cannot access them.
*Any system administrator can accept the updated VIP Terms and Conditions.
To do so:*
• Login to your organization’s Admin Console.
• Follow the prompts to review and accept the updated VIP Terms and
Conditions.
• Select the checkbox and click the “Accept Terms & Conditions” button.
Or simply click on the following button to get started.
*Go to Admin Console*
If you are not prompted to accept updated terms in the Admin Console, no
pending actions are required.
Sincerely,
The Adobe Team
If you have questions or need assistance, contact Adobe Customer Support
.

=== EMAIL START ===
From: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
To: "The TNS Group, Support Team" <support@thetnsgroup.com>
Date: 2024-02-06 15:00:15
Subject: PoE on elevator cameras

Dan when you're onsite:
As you know, Eugene at PoM requested that the cat6 going to the 4 elevator
cameras should have PoE DISABLED.
Please trace and label the relevant cat6 cables (4 of them?) in the IT
closets, and label the ports that should be PoE disabled.
Prior to changing anything, please advise whether PoE is currently on for
the elevator cameras that are working.
And, if possible, can Mitch or someone from the team can visually inspect
the 2-wire device on the working elevators to see if it shows a PoE
indicator light and if it is plugged in to a transformer.
=== EMAIL END ===

=== EMAIL START ===
From: Robert Nieves <rnieves@omegasystemscorp.com>
To: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-09-27 12:55:53
Subject: Powerhouse Network issues review

Hello David,
Please see our findings and timeline below concerning the recent network disruption that occurred.
Issue:
On Tuesday September 24th it was reported to Dan Lucas via email from Mitch about some concerning network issues.
Meraki portal showed switches on the 4th floor IDF closet with unstable connections.
Upon deeper review it was found that a reboot on certain switches had occurred on September 24th at 0125 from a firmware update.
Dan, working with the Meraki Support, was advised to rollback any firmware upgrades made.
Rollback of firmware was successful and helped stabilize network.
Further Investigation:
Due to past issues with firmware upgrades, further investigation was conducted by Rob Nieves to understand why the Firmware occurred, and why there were no alerts triggered.
Review of configuration confirmed Firmware Upgrade are not to be conducted unless scheduled.
Review of Logs shows there were no Firmware upgrades performed during outage window of September 24th.
Because of these inconsistencies, another case was opened with Merkai to understand how this could have happened.
Meraki support confirmed there was no official firmware upgrade on any of the switches, instead there was software update performed on their systems that would allow for "easier" stack configuration on switches.
As a result of this update, new settings were performed on select switches which caused them to reboot.
These changes were not reflected on any logs.
Current alerting procedures would send an email to support indicating devices being down for a period longer than 5 minutes.
Since this update only impacted a select few switches, and the reboot was brief, no alerts were triggered.
See images for configurations and alerts.
Figure1: Reboot of Switch
Figure2: Change log showing no Firmware updates performed reboot time
Firgure3: Meraki Support response
Remediation:
We are currently reviewing extra monitoring options within our RMM software on all Network equipment. ( Note: extra equipment may be needed to have a local probe installed within the network)
Opt in options for new settings have been disabled.
Added support@thetnsgroup.com to any Meraki update notices for quicker review.
Attempted to changed alerting period however 5 minutes is the lowest option.
Robert Nieves Senior Technical Architect
Office 212-967-5757 | Email rnieves@omegasystemscorp.com
Hello David,
Please see our findings and timeline below concerning the recent network disruption that occurred.
Issue:
On Tuesday September 24 th it was reported to Dan Lucas via email from Mitch about some concerning network issues.
Meraki portal showed switches on the 4th floor IDF closet with unstable connections.
Upon deeper review it was found that a reboot on certain switches had occurred on September 24 th at 0125 from a firmware update.
Dan, working with the Meraki Support, was advised to rollback any firmware upgrades made.
Rollback of firmware was successful and helped stabilize network.
Further Investigation:
Due to past issues with firmware upgrades, further investigation was conducted by Rob Nieves to understand why the Firmware occurred, and why there were no alerts triggered.
Review of configuration confirmed Firmware Upgrade are not to be conducted unless scheduled.
Review of Logs shows there were no Firmware upgrades performed during outage window of September 24 th .
Because of these inconsistencies, another case was opened with Merkai to understand how this could have happened.
Meraki support confirmed there was no official firmware upgrade on any of the switches, instead there was software update performed on their systems that would allow for “easier” stack configuration on switches.
As a result of this update, new settings were performed on select switches which caused them to reboot.
These changes were not reflected on any logs.
Current alerting procedures would send an email to support indicating devices being down for a period longer than 5 minutes.
Since this update only impacted a select few switches, and the reboot was brief, no alerts were triggered.
See images for configurations and alerts.
Figure1: Reboot of Switch
Figure2: Change log showing no Firmware updates performed reboot time
Firgure3: Meraki Support response
Remediation:
We are currently reviewing extra monitoring options within our RMM software on all Network equipment. ( Note: extra equipment may be needed to have a local probe installed within the network)
Opt in options for new settings have been disabled.
Added support@thetnsgroup.com to any Meraki update notices for quicker review.
Attempted to changed alerting period however 5 minutes is the lowest option.
Robert ​ ​ ​ ​ Nieves Senior Technical Architect Office 212‑967‑5757 | Email rnieves@omegasystemscorp.com

orange-and-blue-logo-for-OS-e-sig (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VVqV098Hg-nPW51pPJ15l7V8pW3S9mTt5gPp56N179mq63l5QzW6N1vHY6lZ3lZW8mbH5N2B19cjW36wcz14CGxs3W25SC0C7tk41DW1fc_xz3-m3SbVft2zy7YNf4SW8cB62P5-dCdhW1H8xJP1W293nV6Rk625vVGGWW3vh3VR6Nl8pnW5tzftz3lgTmHVXC40X2zqBKtW6jtlsc7H8mv1W855jz42RnWPTW2-8YYh1X63fsW1Bx4xW1zNrRQW91C4Kw7vj0P7W9f1lgN5l08TTVCgg3W68BWZ7W7v2FvC8P7wfJW4TXMst4b7JvnW6_rXs24C37nHW4Hvr834WSj5kf54y-fv04 )
TNS-Omega Integration Update: New Billing Portal, Live 7/1/24
David,
As part of our continued integration efforts between TNS and Omega Systems, we want to share an important change to our billing process, which will help enable a more efficient and effective billing experience for customers.
Beginning on Monday, July 1, legacy TNS customers should process payments to Omega Systems using our new billing portal, powered by ConnectBooster. This replaces our previous portal on bill.com.
The following payment methods are accepted via our new payment portal:
- ACH Pull – Omega initiates payments (preferred)
- ACH Push – Customer initiates payment
- Credit Card payments (subject to a processing fee)
Customers can access the new billing portal at any time here: https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VVqV098Hg-nPW51pPJ15l7V8pW3S9mTt5gPp56N179mqq3l5QzW7lCdLW6lZ3lTW8zxFlh23RFYDW9cThMd3MpQl-W5mQH3C47cTSrW3cfMXJ2tpMPnW7Hyc6K5pv7bZV8KxnL2F5FkzW6H1F9K6YGk35W5wxm7d1ddd6JW6RztdB9kBp75W30MDsH3vRH3BW8HcN5Q61Gd5nW6XfhWm1dVhwnW5zKBz21nh9xSW59gCwP632Pz1W6C8-501f-9SlW2z1-kL3VyP_lN5sXh4v_ffyDW10sX867tl-06W3Gc8G_1GtKW-W4W6zmL3D-ptRN3kdf9b7j59ZW4h37X77fLdd3VbCCPR7jhncHW84bpQh2PFpcdf6v8FQ604
We have also updated all invoice templates with the above link.
If you have ACH-related questions or have any trouble accessing the portal after 7/1, please feel free to contact our team at accounting@omegasystemscorp.com.
Thank you,
Erika

TNS-Omega Integration Update: New Billing Portal, Live 7/1/24
David,
As part of our continued integration efforts between TNS and Omega Systems, we want to share an important change to our billing process, which will help enable a more efficient and effective billing experience for customers.

From: The TNS Group, Support Team
Sent: Wednesday, January 10, 2024 4:40 PM

Cc: Erika Ellis
Subject: Ticket#5351136/Powerhouse/Fwd: Zoom plan -- has been updated
--REPLY above this line to respond--
This ticket has been updated by Dan Lucas
Dan Lucas
1/10/2024 4:00 PM
Hello all
Attached are the zoom pro users and then Zoomus_users1 is the basic users:
The difference between each license basic has meeting limit for 40 minutes
Which looks like it is being applied to Sam's account and then the interns accounts.
Then the pro features are listed below
Zoom One Pro
All the benefits of Basic, plus:
Host up to 100 participants
No 40-minute limit
Team chat for collaboration, file sharing, and more3 editable
Whiteboards with 25MB of cloud storage
5GB of cloud recording storage (per license)
Automated captions
Access to game changing add-ons
The basic accounts were created for users who don't zoom that much from my understanding.
Thanks
Daniel Lucas

Sent from my iPhone
﻿
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Hi Erika!
Can you please give me an accounting of our Zoom licensing from the perspective of meeting length limits, and options to provide people with longer meeting times?
If that's out of scope, can you tell me the name and contact info for the Zoom account rep?
Someone ran into a 40-minute meeting limit with Zoom yesterday. I was surprised and asked Dan to take a look and tell me the license terms. It's true. At least some of our licenses are limited to 40 minute meetings, which is just short enough to be unacceptable.
I know Zoom changed terms back in July. Perhaps we have new or expiring accounts that are starting to run into the new limits?
Thank you!
--

From: Pamela Rapp
Sent: Friday, February 2, 2024 3:16 PM
To: Robert Nieves ; Erika Ellis
Cc: David Koosis ; Daniel Lucas ; Pradeesh Padmasenan ; Iris Garcia
Subject: Fashion show Feb. 10 &11 same live streaming needs as September 10 & 11 2023
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Hi Erika, Rob, Daniel,
I am reaching out because we have another large Fashion show with the same group / client as last September coming up.
The requirements for the internet service provided by the venue are the same and are in detail the following:
The internet connection must be provided through an ethernet cable positioned near the video control room.
The connection must be at least 30 Mbps in upload and download, guaranteed and dedicated to the streaming service.
Wi-Fi connections cannot be used.
To this network will be connected a router from which all the streaming equipment will be connected to.
The IP that will be assigned to the router must be able to make outgoing connections to the following ports / ip:
- TCP ports from 1195 to 1199 to IP 213.137.32.108
- UDP ports from 10001 to 10004 towards IP 213.137.32.108
- UDP ports from 10001 to 10004 towards IP 178.20.73.121
We are again planning on using the ports (marked by blue painters tape) on the recessed east wall of the Grand Hall mezzanine.
TNS, I wanted to check with you the following:
1. Are all these port settings still in place and if not could they please be restored?
2. Would it be possible for Daniel when he is at Powerhouse this coming Wednesday (Feb. 7) to connect with Deesh and go up to the mezzanine and do a streaming test?
3. Erika, I am very sorry this ask comes in again so late, but we are also hoping to be able to have a TNS technician onsite 8am-11am on February 11.
Let us know if this is all doable.
Thank you so much.
Pamela

EMAIL!!!
Hi
Erika, Rob, Daniel,
I
am reaching out because we have another large Fashion show with the same group / client as last September coming up.
The
requirements for the internet service provided by the venue are the same and are in detail the following:
The
internet connection must be provided through an ethernet cable positioned near the video control room.
The connection must be at least 30 Mbps in upload and download, guaranteed and dedicated to the streaming service.
Wi-Fi connections cannot be used.
To this network will be connected a router from which all the streaming equipment will be connected to.
The IP that will be assigned to the router must be able to make outgoing connections to the following ports / ip:
- TCP ports from 1195 to 1199 to IP 213.137.32.108
- UDP ports from 10001 to 10004 towards IP 213.137.32.108
- UDP ports from 10001 to 10004 towards IP 178.20.73.121
We
are again planning on using the ports (marked by blue painters tape) on the recessed east wall of the Grand Hall mezzanine.
TNS,
I wanted to check with you the following:
1.
Are all these port settings still in place and if not could they please be restored?
2.
Would it be possible for Daniel when he is at Powerhouse this coming Wednesday (Feb. 7) to connect with Deesh and go up to the mezzanine and do a streaming test?
3.
Erika, I am very sorry this ask comes in again so late, but we are also hoping to be able to have a TNS technician onsite 8am-11am on February 11.
Let
us know if this is all doable.
Thank
you so much.
Pamela

From: Pamela Rapp >
Sent: Friday, February 2, 2024 3:16 PM
To: Robert Nieves >; Erika Ellis >

Subject: Fashion show Feb. 10 &11 same live streaming needs as September 10 & 11 2023
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Hi Erika, Rob, Daniel,
I am reaching out because we have another large Fashion show with the same group / client as last September coming up.
The requirements for the internet service provided by the venue are the same and are in detail the following:
The internet connection must be provided through an ethernet cable positioned near the video control room.
The connection must be at least 30 Mbps in upload and download, guaranteed and dedicated to the streaming service.
Wi-Fi connections cannot be used.
To this network will be connected a router from which all the streaming equipment will be connected to.
The IP that will be assigned to the router must be able to make outgoing connections to the following ports / ip:
- TCP ports from 1195 to 1199 to IP 213.137.32.108
- UDP ports from 10001 to 10004 towards IP 213.137.32.108
- UDP ports from 10001 to 10004 towards IP 178.20.73.121
We are again planning on using the ports (marked by blue painters tape) on the recessed east wall of the Grand Hall mezzanine.
TNS, I wanted to check with you the following:
1. Are all these port settings still in place and if not could they please be restored?
2. Would it be possible for Daniel when he is at Powerhouse this coming Wednesday (Feb. 7) to connect with Deesh and go up to the mezzanine and do a streaming test?
3. Erika, I am very sorry this ask comes in again so late, but we are also hoping to be able to have a TNS technician onsite 8am-11am on February 11.
Let us know if this is all doable.
Thank you so much.
Pamela
--

Subject: RE: Powerhouse integration of Manahattan Graphics Center

Hi David,
Thank you for sending this - see our answers in RED
Erika Ellis | Technical Account Manager
Office 203-316-0112 | Direct 203-316-0112
Mobile 203-981-8902 | Email eellis@omegasystemscorp.com
From: David Koosis
Sent: Thursday, May 30, 2024 1:03 PM
To: Erika Ellis
Cc: Daniel Lucas ; Robert Nieves
Subject: Powerhouse integration of Manahattan Graphics Center
CAUTION: This email originated from outside your organization. Exercise caution when opening attachments or clicking links, especially from unknown senders.
As we discussed a few months ago, MGC is moving in to Powerhouse over the next few weeks. It's a small organization, with 2 computers and 4 printers, and from a technology perspective this should be handled like a merger.
Can you please assist? This is my checklist; add/correct/comment as needed:
1. Tee up procurement approvals for 2 Macbook Pro 14" computers, standard Powerhouse spec. (I sent it separately to Erika)
* I submitted a request for the 2 MacBooks. I will need you to complete 2 forms but we are amid changing this process – you will receive a notification this week. I will reach out to you as soon as I know the process is in place.
1. Daniel and I walked through the 5th floor space about a month ago to confirm WiFi is operational, please confirm. Dan will confirm this and will circle back to you.
2. Initiate port of an existing MGC phone number from VZ over to Zoom (if Omega can't do this, let me know and dk will handle) Daniel will reach out to you directly and Most of it will be on Zoom and we will need the phone numbers to Zoom so we can port it over. Please provide Dan the phone umbers
3. Assess MGC telecom needs: a handset for existing MGC number? zoom auto attendant? Dan will handle and will reach out to you next Wednesday onsite – he just needs to know what extension you want us to assign it to it and the Mac address on the 5th floor
4. Recommend how to handle manhattangraphicscenter.org domain. MGC needs to retain their domain for now, including website and email addresses for about a half dozen people. They will be on the powerhousearts HR system and need access to the usual PHA systems like zoom, box, asana, etc. Dan will talk to you directly. We have to take in their domain – are we allowing them into the Google Admin Console or just creating PH accounts?
Dan will focus on these items next Wednesday when he is onsite.
Thank you for the update on this. Many thanks, Erika

Request
Configure Arternal with Third-Part App access on Powerhouse Google Workspace.
These are the directions from Arternal:
https://intercom.help/arternal/en/articles/5812133-linking-google-email-accounts
This is time sensitive, due by Tue Nov 14 -- earlier would be terrific. If that's not possible, please alert me. Thank you!
Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.
Additional Points of Contact
Powerhouse customer and point-of-contact for Arternal is: Megan Skidmore ( megan@powerhousearts.org )
Arternal point-of-contact (non-technical): Georgieanna Richer ( georgeianna@arternal.com )
Notes
Follow your standard protocol for these kinds of admin changes to Google Workspace, as far as any logging or permissions.
When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you

Let me know if you need more information.

11/9/2023 10:46 AM-
Request
Configure Arternal with Third-Part App access on Powerhouse Google Workspace.
These are the directions from Arternal:
https://intercom.help/arternal/en/articles/5812133-linking-google-email-accounts
This is time sensitive, due by Tue Nov 14 -- earlier would be terrific. If that's not possible, please alert me. Thank you!
Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.
Additional Points of Contact
Powerhouse customer and point-of-contact for Arternal is: Megan Skidmore ( megan@powerhousearts.org )
Arternal point-of-contact (non-technical): Georgieanna Richer ( georgeianna@arternal.com )
Notes
Follow your standard protocol for these kinds of admin changes to Google Workspace, as far as any logging or permissions.
When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you

Register for Our June 4th MDR Security Webinar
Security Unlocked: Emerging Threats, Business Risks & the Case for MDR
Today's security threats are burdening more than IT departments — they are disrupting operations, exacerbating compliance needs and creating significant business risks.
In this virtual roundtable, we'll pull back the curtain on which cyber threats to keep a close eye on and explain how to align your security priorities with your most pressing business risks.
Key discussion topics include:
- The known & emerging security risks keeping our experts up at night
- Where business & IT challenges collide on increasing compliance, decreasing budgets & operational resiliency
- Why MDR is the security solution you've been missing

FAQs: Microsoft Copilot Data Security
For all of their purported benefits, there’s a lot we can still learn about generative AI solutions like Microsoft Copilot, particularly as it relates to data security and privacy. We’re answering some of your most frequently asked questions about Copilot (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VVX19l3PnvM8W7LFkpk2fbvDmW4nNzqf5fMg9KN3Bm-8K3prCCW95jsWP6lZ3nZVgngQt4ZKhDyW3DHN2v1G7l7CW4pgvpk2hjC4fW5WPz0F6LlxJFW5KKj0g3x-51yW8nrSng87G-rPVQkWb-45VfFwW3xDxGs2Dv9hHW4y_dLV2Q8vhkW94mdjK3VYyqjVsmcZt1SvD3_W1Sry7c6MYCNTW2d7Rg67GbNJXW1pky1_6MRvwJN74CtzlDGx1BW4nLgk01jdJHSW4TXDm58c0fsNN2yYs31lVc7dW5rYGl28Z4MpjVTMWvQ505MtDW2M_DbF5j3YpzMVBdvVpV3VYW8m8Rtx7Y_bx2MhNY5gy8gMbW1DNkl54-Gkh1W1-k-yL25__5MVqSF132fcPx5W958dFt2XXdfBW7hQCg35DvpR1N7hMZMZXHdQtdqSc5g04 ) , including:
- Does it matter which 365 license I use with Copilot?
- How does Copilot work with sensitivity labels?
- How can companies start readying their data prior to Copilot adoption?
Trend Watch: Benefits of a Virtual CISO
The presence of a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is a must-have to ensure continued resilience against growing threats as well as proper alignment of IT priorities with business needs and regulatory requirements. But for many companies, hiring a full-time CISO is not feasible and can be hindered by limited finances or expertise.
Enter the virtual CISO (vCISO) – someone who offers the expertise and guidance of a seasoned security professional, delivered by a trusted IT partner who acts as an extension of your internal executive team.
Check out these 7 benefits of a virtual CISO (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VVX19l3PnvM8W7LFkpk2fbvDmW4nNzqf5fMg9KN3Bm-8K3prCCW95jsWP6lZ3lLW4QC1j55cf2Q9W175QF-8Vt35KW2sszRC1kCc78W5pJ3cd5Mwy3bW5pVjC62pwmFHW16_QnD4RX0XTN8qx7XzNy87mVBWBvK2yQZR0W2Ksn6V2wWv14W8J7n-C7MTDXlW5j-jt48V9GflW8JfswD83xW3_N6djxKvwTMwLW3zBQPQ34-v6DW8BPHY26XWlkmW5bmMFv1K_cmrW40xrcF48H3k9W6Y53cj1j6jr9W2lPPb73xXLJFW6ncZC38XBxhXW3QZlDg6SdX1nVYQXpN1F6Q5WW84bQlC2fW6lLW18N0sw6VfKF4W8dD-_C3pMhnjW7ypmR2801vTlW5nnP__1y6CJ7W4xXcgs2ND2stW4qdYq42nvgkfW3YWJMX89xVWJf6HbJsd04 ) .
Regulatory Update: SEC Will Require Incident Response Plans for RIAs
On May 15, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission adopted amendments under Regulation S-P that mandate new requirements for registered investment advisers (RIAs) regarding incident response and cybersecurity incident disclosure.
New requirements under Regulation S-P include:
- A formal incident response program, including written policies and procedures;
- Notification of cybersecurity incidents to affected individuals within 30 days;
- Oversight and due diligence of third party service providers; and
- Recordkeeping of all compliance related to Regulation S-P requirements.
Get more details on these new requirements for RIAs here (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VVX19l3PnvM8W7LFkpk2fbvDmW4nNzqf5fMg9KN3Bm-7d5m_5PW69t95C6lZ3nLN79Sz8dm0FnrW7LbTwB8bJWFtW41DsJF6wFBcYW8KlYPF6sSYsYW1wVrCl51L2pnMbxF1DmkQLTW7bSnck2H0_wqW3JDtzg6mR8vqW6Tg4LD3kMg9-W3CSFwh3jcKhcW6FYXp98JN7GNN84ljcP3rJvGW2bF7M07bpnlKN20kPSVd-LZ5W9gvL5H4Fg3y1V2Nb8S4q24J2W2XM9K294mg1kW5yfkyj8SWyfFW1ySF3t71v2vbW5-pwVm6C4jsQW2rdGPx65zmnvW7yBqpv6XYSqjW99FGr51TW5-gV20bSV692yX7W3H5dbY5QWYsPW5gLVfQ10S_ZmW89Q7yy4Sb0YHN1VqpHDQcQ3RW5mNRvC5x9mcsW29xDMt1JZGLmW1tbQ0n6TTq6NN4YlTGb1wgdnW4N16Ff4JNtJbVXn15n6Ptcn3N3BWqGl790MDVPVYZ72QSlNtf8vdRs004 ) .

| MAY 2024
New & Noteworthy From Omega Systems
David,
Please take a few moments to review some of the content we’ve included in this month’s Omega Systems customer newsletter. As always, don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns.
In this issue:
Don’t Forget to Register: June 4 th Security Webinar
FAQs: Microsoft Copilot Data Security
Trend Watch: Benefits of a vCISO
Regulatory Update: SEC to Require Incident Response Plans for RIAs
Thanks,
Erika
Register for Our June 4th MDR Security Webinar
Security Unlocked: Emerging Threats, Business Risks & the Case for MDR
Today's security threats are burdening more than IT departments — they are disrupting operations, exacerbating compliance needs and creating significant business risks.
In this virtual roundtable, we'll pull back the curtain on which cyber threats to keep a close eye on and explain how to align your security priorities with your most pressing business risks.
Key discussion topics include:
The known & emerging security risks keeping our experts up at night
Where business & IT challenges collide on increasing compliance, decreasing budgets & operational resiliency
Why MDR is the security solution you've been missing
Save Your Spot
FAQs: Microsoft Copilot Data Security
For all of their purported benefits, there’s a lot we can still learn about generative AI solutions like Microsoft Copilot, particularly as it relates to data security and privacy. We’re answering some of your most frequently asked questions about Copilot , including:
Does it matter which 365 license I use with Copilot?
How does Copilot work with sensitivity labels?
How can companies start readying their data prior to Copilot adoption?
Trend Watch: Benefits of a Virtual CISO
The presence of a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is a must-have to ensure continued resilience against growing threats as well as proper alignment of IT priorities with business needs and regulatory requirements. But for many companies, hiring a full-time CISO is not feasible and can be hindered by limited finances or expertise.
Enter the virtual CISO (vCISO) – someone who offers the expertise and guidance of a seasoned security professional, delivered by a trusted IT partner who acts as an extension of your internal executive team.
Check out these 7 benefits of a virtual CISO .
Regulatory Update: SEC Will Require Incident Response Plans for RIAs
On May 15, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission adopted amendments under Regulation S-P that mandate new requirements for registered investment advisers (RIAs) regarding incident response and cybersecurity incident disclosure.
New requirements under Regulation S-P include:
A formal incident response program, including written policies and procedures;
Notification of cybersecurity incidents to affected individuals within 30 days;
Oversight and due diligence of third party service providers; and
Recordkeeping of all compliance related to Regulation S-P requirements.
Get more details on these new requirements for RIAs here .
Omega Recognized on CRN Solution Provider 500
We are pleased to share that Omega Systems has been recognized as an IT leader on CRN’s Solution Provider 500 list for the third consecutive year!

=== EMAIL START ===
From: Sam Polcer <sam@powerhousearts.org>
To: Pamela Rapp <pamela@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-02-28 10:15:38
Subject: Re: I Pad library - relatively urgent need for capturing device for
 speaker series

Hi folks,
Deesh connected with Xavier and I separately about this to gauge our
interest in local vs cloud storage. Perhaps we should have a meeting (gasp)
about all this so everyone can be on the same page? Designing a content
management system specific to AV needs is no small thing.
FWIW:
- I see local storage of raw footage and Cloud based storage for final
files being a good solution.
- I don't think social media should be a determining factor for how we
store files, as the files we post there are so small and end up going to
our computers before we do so anyway.
- Similarly, captioning is handled differently by different platforms
and we wouldn't want to caption anything raw or burn anything in anyway...
it's easy enough to take a final cut of a video file and send it out for an
.srt file.
All that said, I think we should meet to talk about how any approach we
come up with might be scaled, considering all the different use cases for
recording, editing, and distributing, so we can future-proof it while being
mindful about nimbleness, flexibility, cost, etc.
David, can you set up a time for folks to meet that works with your
schedule and take the lead on an agenda, etc. so you get the answers you
need?
Thanks,
Sam
On Wed, Feb 28, 2024 at 9:58 AM Pamela Rapp
wrote:
=== EMAIL END ===

=== EMAIL START ===
From: Pamela Rapp <pamela@powerhousearts.org>
To: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-02-28 09:58:45
Subject: Re: I Pad library - relatively urgent need for capturing device for
 speaker series

Hi David,
here are some of my thoughts:below your questions in caps. Getting this out
ahead of slack channel because of my (at least perceived) backlog of things
to do.
- For iPhones, certainly, cloud storage is fully integrated and very
convenient. Do we use any other kinds of cameras?
- NOT AT THIS POINT
- iCloud may also be integrated with video editing, captioning, etc
tools you use? True?
- I AM HOPING MARKETING WILL TAKE THE LEAD ON EDITING
- iCloud may be well integrated with a workflow that involves posting
things to social media. Do we use any tools for social media management?
- I AM HOPING MARKETING WILL TAKE THE LEAD ON THIS AS WELL
- If the data volume gets very high, it can get slow and expensive to
move and keep data in the cloud, and local storage can make more sense; the
Genetec surveillance cameras, for instance, have a few racks of disk
storage in the Powerhouse IT room.
- SO FAR, I HAD BEEN USED TO THE OPPOSITE ROUTINE. THE PERSON WHO EDITED
MOVED BOTH RAW FOOTAGE AND THE EDITED VERSION ONTO THE CLOUD FOR MORE
PERSONS TO ACCESS IT AND TO MAKE ROOM ON THE LOCAL STORAGE OF THE DEVICE.
BUT I DEFINITELY KNOW LESS THAN YOU (DAVID) ABOUT THESE THINGS.
- Do we have a desire/need for some level of on-site studio space, with
lighting, fixed cam, possibly a teleprompter?
- NO. WE WANT TO HAVE THE SET UP BE MOBILE AND USABLE IN ALL OF OUR
SPACES. IN OUR CONCEPT SO FAR, WE ALSO CONSIDERED THE SYSTEM TO BE MOBILE
ENOUGH FOR CEP TO TAKE IT OUR OUT ON THE STREET TO CONDUCT FIELD INTERVIEWS
ETC.
- A hybrid solution might be to keep network attached storage on premise
(fast), and migrate it to "long term" cloud storage in the background
(slow). We (Daniel from TNS and I) are experimenting with local network
storage connecting to Box, to help Print Shop deal with large files more
easily.
- DEFERRING TO YOU AND TNS FOR BEST SOLUTION
- At the same time we're thinking about video storage, we should be
thinking about a system we can all use for naming and organizing and/or
adding metadata (like location, people names) to video. This is really
valuable. And it needs to be something easy enough that people will
actually use it consistently.
- SOMETHING LIKE: "DEPARTMENT / DATE AND YEAR / NAME OF EVENT" FOR
EXAMPLE?
All my best,
Pam
Hi David, here are some of my thoughts:below your questions in caps. Getting this out ahead of slack channel because of my (at least perceived) backlog of things to do. For iPhones, certainly, cloud storage is fully integrated and very convenient. Do we use any other kinds of cameras? NOT AT THIS POINT iCloud may also be integrated with video editing, captioning, etc tools you use? True? I AM HOPING MARKETING WILL TAKE THE LEAD ON EDITING iCloud may be well integrated with a workflow that involves posting things to social media. Do we use any tools for social media management? I AM HOPING MARKETING WILL TAKE THE LEAD ON THIS AS WELL If the data volume gets very high, it can get slow and expensive to move and keep data in the cloud, and local storage can make more sense; the Genetec surveillance cameras, for instance, have a few racks of disk storage in the Powerhouse IT room. SO FAR, I HAD BEEN USED TO THE OPPOSITE ROUTINE. THE PERSON WHO EDITED MOVED BOTH RAW FOOTAGE AND THE EDITED VERSION ONTO THE CLOUD FOR MORE PERSONS TO ACCESS IT AND TO MAKE ROOM ON THE LOCAL STORAGE OF THE DEVICE. BUT I DEFINITELY KNOW LESS THAN YOU (DAVID) ABOUT THESE THINGS. Do we have a desire/need for some level of on-site studio space, with lighting, fixed cam, possibly a teleprompter? NO. WE WANT TO HAVE THE SET UP BE MOBILE AND USABLE IN ALL OF OUR SPACES. IN OUR CONCEPT SO FAR, WE ALSO CONSIDERED THE SYSTEM TO BE MOBILE ENOUGH FOR CEP TO TAKE IT OUR OUT ON THE STREET TO CONDUCT FIELD INTERVIEWS ETC. A hybrid solution might be to keep network attached storage on premise (fast), and migrate it to "long term" cloud storage in the background (slow). We (Daniel from TNS and I) are experimenting with local network storage connecting to Box, to help Print Shop deal with large files more easily. DEFERRING TO YOU AND TNS FOR BEST SOLUTION At the same time we're thinking about video storage, we should be thinking about a system we can all use for naming and organizing and/or adding metadata (like location, people names) to video. This is really valuable. And it needs to be something easy enough that people will actually use it consistently. SOMETHING LIKE: "DEPARTMENT / DATE AND YEAR / NAME OF EVENT" FOR EXAMPLE? All my best, Pam On Tue, Feb 27, 2024, 5:39 PM David Koosis wrote: +Sam Polcer Hi Pamela! >> Would you consider to potentially make an I phone 15 part of this device library? Yes. I initiated the procurement and will follow up regarding timing. >> plan for any cloud storage of the raw materials will be. Will that be solved via box? That's an excellent question. We have a few approaches. I'd like to do a little back-of-the-envelope brainstorming with you all. These are the kinds of considerations I'm thinking of: For iPhones, certainly, cloud storage is fully integrated and very convenient. Do we use any other kinds of cameras? iCloud may also be integrated with video editing, captioning, etc tools you use? True? iCloud may be well integrated with a workflow that involves posting things to social media. Do we use any tools for social media management? If the data volume gets very high, it can get slow and expensive to move and keep data in the cloud, and local storage can make more sense; the Genetec surveillance cameras, for instance, have a few racks of disk storage in the Powerhouse IT room. Do we have a desire/need for some level of on-site studio space, with lighting, fixed cam, possibly a teleprompter? A hybrid solution might be to keep network attached storage on premise (fast), and migrate it to "long term" cloud storage in the background (slow). We (Daniel from TNS and I) are experimenting with local network storage connecting to Box, to help Print Shop deal with large files more easily. At the same time we're thinking about video storage, we should be thinking about a system we can all use for naming and organizing and/or adding metadata (like location, people names) to video. This is really valuable. And it needs to be something easy enough that people will actually use it consistently. Let's pick up this discussion on slack. I'll invite y'all into a channel. Cheers, /dk On Mon, Feb 26, 2024 at 2:52 PM Pamela Rapp wrote: Hi Steven and David, we just had a meeting with Jenn and Jackie from CEP. === EMAIL START ===
From: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
To: Pamela Rapp <pamela@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-02-27 17:39:19
Subject: Re: I Pad library - relatively urgent need for capturing device for
 speaker series

+Sam Polcer
Hi Pamela!
library?
*Yes. I initiated the procurement and will follow up regarding timing. *
solved via box?
That's an excellent question.
We have a few approaches. I'd like to do a little back-of-the-envelope
brainstorming with you all. These are the kinds of considerations I'm
thinking of:
- For iPhones, certainly, cloud storage is fully integrated and very
convenient. Do we use any other kinds of cameras?
- iCloud may also be integrated with video editing, captioning, etc
tools you use? True?
- iCloud may be well integrated with a workflow that involves posting
things to social media. Do we use any tools for social media management?
- If the data volume gets very high, it can get slow and expensive to
move and keep data in the cloud, and local storage can make more sense; the
Genetec surveillance cameras, for instance, have a few racks of disk
storage in the Powerhouse IT room.
- Do we have a desire/need for some level of on-site studio space, with
lighting, fixed cam, possibly a teleprompter?
- A hybrid solution might be to keep network attached storage on premise
(fast), and migrate it to "long term" cloud storage in the background
(slow). We (Daniel from TNS and I) are experimenting with local network
storage connecting to Box, to help Print Shop deal with large files more
easily.
- At the same time we're thinking about video storage, we should be
thinking about a system we can all use for naming and organizing and/or
adding metadata (like location, people names) to video. This is really
valuable. And it needs to be something easy enough that people will
actually use it consistently.
Let's pick up this discussion on slack. I'll invite y'all into a channel.
Cheers,
/dk
=== EMAIL END ===

From: servicedesk@omegasystemscorp.com
Sent: May-2nd, 2024 2:46
To: invoices@powerhousearts.org
subject: [invoices] Invoice #206989 from The TNS Group
Dear Accounts:
Attached, please find your invoice referenced above. Please let us know if you have any questions.
Please make note
of the amount due for this invoice: $16,590.22.
If TNS already has your payment information on file, you may reply to this email to authorize payment.
TNS encourages clients to consider using Automated Clearing House (ACH) to submit payments rather than company checks. The authorized billing contact for your organization can set up ACH to allow TNS to automatically process payment for open invoices and keep your account current. For more information on authorizing TNS to process ACH payments, please contact the TNS Finance Department.
If you would prefer to submit payments to TNS by ACH manually, please contact your Account Manager or the TNS Finance Department for assistance.
Thank you for choosing The TNS Group for your technology needs.
Secure Payment
Portal
The TNS Group, Finance Team
email: billing@thetnsgroup.com
To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to invoices+unsubscribe@powerhousearts.org.

=== EMAIL START ===
From: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
To: "Jonas St. Juste" <Jonas@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-06-27 07:35:00
Subject: Re: PHA Front desk phone not working

Colleagues
I'd like to chime in on this with some ideas that may help.
The topic deserves more discussion, but for now I'll highlight the most
relevant points from a tech support perspective. Please help me by
understanding these points, suggesting improvements (always), and becoming
ambassadors to model and share these concepts with the rest of the team.
All of you are 100% right that we should identify and fix important issues
quickly.
Sometimes it's hard to know which issues deserve to be escalated. Here are
some guidelines:
-
High Priority:
-
disrupts programs or events
-
affects our work with artists, public, donors, partners
-
keeps key staff (president, board, team leads) from performing their
duties, which in turn can impact their teams
-
Normal Priority:
-
affects a small number of individuals
-
creates delays or inefficiencies in workflows
-
causes inconvenience or frustration but can be worked around
The front desk phone being out of service is a high priority issue. You
handle calls from the public, visitors, event attendees, and team leads.
How to report a tech issue: There are a few ways:
-
Send an email to helpdesk@powerhousearts.org
-
This forwards to Omega Systems (formerly known as TNS)
-
If the issue is high priority, start your email subject with “HIGH
PRIORITY”
-
I wrote (but have not tested) a slack workflow which is even better;
please try it out:
-
Open slack
-
On the left hand sidebar, select the ellipsis symbol (...) labeled
More
-
Select Automations from the menu
-
Hopefully, you will see this automation
-
-
Select it.
-
The first time you use it, you will be prompted to give it permission
to use your Gmail account (to send the help desk ticket). Go ahead and do
that.
-
When you’re in a slack message window, at the very start of your
message, before you type anything else, type /help and you should be
prompted to run the automation.
-
(If the above does not work, contact: wait for it...
helpdesk@powerhousearts.org. Say you need help installing the
helpdesk automation in slack. Dan knows about it.)
-
The automation asks you to name the ticket, describe it, and indicate
if it is High Priority and if it has a due date. This creates a
well-structured helpdesk request that gets mailed to Omega Systems. You
will receive a ticket receipt in your email.
Cheers,
/dk
On Thu, Jun 20, 2024 at 4:49 PM Jonas St. Juste
wrote:
=== EMAIL END ===

=== EMAIL START ===
From: "Jonas St. Juste" <Jonas@powerhousearts.org>
To: Veena Bobba <veena@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-06-20 16:48:55
Subject: Re: PHA Front desk phone not working

Hi All,
I’m glad the phone issue has finally been resolved. This was an important
matter that I had communicated through Slack and included in our daily
reports multiple times over the past few days since Community Day. In
which, in hindsight, there seems to have been other clues prior to our
event that there was an issue that went unnoticed or proactively looked
into. However, it seems that my previous communications on this issue were
not acknowledged or addressed until my team member, Veena, sent an email,
which resulted in a swift resolution.
I am all for suggesting solutions, being a team player, and understanding
that things may occasionally fall through the cracks. However, I feel that
communications such as the Daily Reports, especially when they raise other
operational concerns—such as more falling debris in the lobby during
Community Day (one of which was a screw) and an increase in staff
forgetting their ID cards leading to moments when there are no temporary
cards to give out—should be read and responded to in a timely manner.
Without this improvement, I will have no reason to believe contributing to
solutions would be taken any more seriously.
- Jonas
On Thu, Jun 20, 2024 at 2:36 PM Veena Bobba
wrote:

I am all for suggesting solutions, being a team player, and understanding that things may occasionally fall through the cracks. However, I feel that communications such as the Daily Reports, especially when they raise other operational concerns—such as more falling debris in the lobby during Community Day (one of which was a screw) and an increase in staff forgetting their ID cards leading to moments when there are no temporary cards to give out—should be read and responded to in a timely manner. Without this improvement, I will have no reason to believe contributing to solutions would be taken any more seriously.

From: Pamela Rapp >
Sent: Friday, February 2, 2024 3:16 PM
To: Robert Nieves >; Erika Ellis >
Cc: David Koosis >; Daniel Lucas >; Pradeesh Padmasenan >; Iris Garcia >
Subject: Fashion show Feb. 10 &11 same live streaming needs as September 10 & 11 2023
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Hi Erika, Rob, Daniel,
I am reaching out because we have another large Fashion show with the same group / client as last September coming up.
The requirements for the internet service provided by the venue are the same and are in detail the following:
The internet connection must be provided through an ethernet cable positioned near the video control room.
The connection must be at least 30 Mbps in upload and download, guaranteed and dedicated to the streaming service.
Wi-Fi connections cannot be used.
To this network will be connected a router from which all the streaming equipment will be connected to.
The IP that will be assigned to the router must be able to make outgoing connections to the following ports / ip:
- TCP ports from 1195 to 1199 to IP 213.137.32.108
- UDP ports from 10001 to 10004 towards IP 213.137.32.108
- UDP ports from 10001 to 10004 towards IP 178.20.73.121
We are again planning on using the ports (marked by blue painters tape) on the recessed east wall of the Grand Hall mezzanine.
TNS, I wanted to check with you the following:
1. Are all these port settings still in place and if not could they please be restored?
2. Would it be possible for Daniel when he is at Powerhouse this coming Wednesday (Feb. 7) to connect with Deesh and go up to the mezzanine and do a streaming test?
3. Erika, I am very sorry this ask comes in again so late, but we are also hoping to be able to have a TNS technician onsite 8am-11am on February 11.
Let us know if this is all doable.
Thank you so much.
Pamela
--
Pamela Rapp (she / her / hers)
Director of Event Production and Operations, Powerhouse Arts
Featured in the press: "Brooklyn’s Batcave Reborn as Gotham’s Art Factory" by Hilarie Sheets for The New York Times
main 718.522.1400, direct 929.207.6244
E: pamela@powerhousearts.org

}

}

}

}

David,=20
We are pleased to let you kn=
ow that we will commence with anti-virus (AV) solution migration during the=
month of May. Customers will be migrated to Omega=E2=80=99s endpoint detec=
tion and response (EDR) solution, powered by SentinelOne, during a two-day =
installation window, during which workstations and laptops should remain pl=
ugged in and powered on; laptop screens should also remain open. =20
Please note: [COMPAN=
Y]=E2=80=99s installation window is scheduled for [AV MIGRATION WINDOW].=20
To complete the installation=
, there is a planned reboot window expected from 8:00-11:00pm ET both eveni=
ngs. We encourage you to save your work before signing off during each day =
of the installation window.=20
Omega Systems=E2=80=99 Secur=
ity Operations Center (SOC) will be activated during the migration process =
and monitoring systems to work through adjusting exceptions and responding =
to false positives.=20
These changes will occur in =
the background, and users should not experience any impact during the migra=
tion window.=20
As always, if you have any q=
uestions, please reach out to your account manager.=20

From: David Koosis
Sent: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 1:09 PM
To: Erika Ellis
Cc: Robert Nieves
Subject: Re: meeting with kode labs
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Thanks -
I can make myself available for this most times today/wed/thu excepting a few important meetings.
The gist of it is that kode labs wants to install a (widely used 3rd party) listener on a (existing?) server inside PHA alongside the building management system, which can ingest building management messages emitted by (mostly) HVAC gear using an industry standard messaging protocol. That listener will transport the same data to kode labs (a cloudflare agent) so they can perform magical analytics and recommendations to the facilities team regarding efficient energy management.
There's exec support to move forward, because the promised benefit is high value.
I have more detailed notes and can fill you in.
Hi David,
Happy New Year!!! Looking forward to working together more in the new year.
Rob is more than happy to jump on a call, but he would like more information if you have it available. Please let me know the dates/times that work best, and I will review with Rob and get back to you if that works.
I copied Rob here as well so you can provide more details if available.
Thank you, Erika

From: David Koosis
Sent: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 1:09 PM
To: Erika Ellis
Cc: Robert Nieves
Subject: Re: meeting with kode labs
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Thanks -
I can make myself available for this most times today/wed/thu excepting a few important meetings.
The gist of it is that kode labs wants to install a (widely used 3rd party) listener on a (existing?) server inside PHA alongside the building management system, which can ingest
building management messages emitted by (mostly) HVAC gear using an industry standard messaging protocol. That listener will transport the same data to kode labs (a cloudflare agent) so they can perform magical analytics and recommendations to the facilities
team regarding efficient energy management.
There's exec support to move forward, because the promised benefit is high value.
I have more detailed notes and can fill you in.

News: Omega Continues Growth & Innovation
+ Adds Multi-Cloud Connectivity Capabilities
In case you missed the announcement earlier this month, (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWJWcQXtscZW6ZXyBS40Q9rqW7gFL9V5gRfbXN9k7M9C5m_5PW6N1X8z6lZ3nGW1T05526gsPyhW6r-VQ0200zCjW8Z2Zpp6DD8d3W7TRWPW5jKq8BW58PTNW92sBq7N8058RLZhqd0W5d8yCM4Ff2v2W7PH_vV5YnX6fW7mC0d885c7_ZW1ZsCr76XY4QLW1QgZnV3lj7HmW8HYf4m4V3XJZW1S-TSH2tYrXnVs6VHK51l3W2W5nlCn17X3PJcW5_t12x3Q09_nN7TbfznBGTy-W6fqQxk3MxB90W22SXkq5fS5DKW1RS04F5TxgMtW3DZhjz7psbXPW7HDr8h34F6zpW5x5F103079jGW719jH53Kv64cW1wDQzX5YTmmMVl2x6w2H6_ryW1vW_Hk8Svt--W7R3nKz5SDwXBW97dKR17MysvKW9gBTm78Vmpt2W3cKR9-8zdpsPW35nVYX2cS8XhW5thr_N8mvMPZW3tCQ9F6lPpYDVpQJQ54V9fptN9kLFjqzGjMyN89G0jmJXslfN8Q4PZvdxTztf62Wr5q04 ) we’re excited to share that we are growing the Omega Systems family and have acquired Amnet Technology Solutions – a Stamford-based IT MSP. In addition to Amnet’s core managed services business, Omega has invested in Cloudpath’s multi-cloud connectivity platform, which provides customers with a reliable and secure connection to multiple public cloud and SaaS providers including Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure and hundreds more.
We live in an increasingly hybrid world, and secure connectivity to multiple sites and cloud applications is necessary to ensure operational stability and effectiveness. Through Cloudpath, we have a unique and innovative way to help our customers evolve along with their modern workforces.
We’re incredibly excited to tell you more about Cloudpath in the coming months. If you’re curious to learn more now, please reach out directly to your account manager to schedule a conversation.
EDR vs. MDR: What’s the Difference?
EDR and MDR are two powerful threat detection and response tools that can significantly enhance your organization's cybersecurity posture. And while often used interchangeably, they serve different purposes for your security protection.
Learn more about EDR and MDR (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWJWcQXtscZW6ZXyBS40Q9rqW7gFL9V5gRfbXN9k7MbP3prCCW95jsWP6lZ3lHVthXRV3ZZPtSW9ljtCp5QjTGcW6-DJ2-5nrP6vVHgzDP3yQgk-W2mfpCS9fdmL8W77vpHn4xdntLVFW6zL3D3kF2W53ssRm20L0dmV89ckH3533DxW97f0y84zjpRPW457M6C749Cs1W4LbpQQ3rWJ0KW5HFD6P56TQZ5W60Ldw36Ym3DhW5w1rCs3zW-9RW6rGbbq4c7nkGW4nsSyK3L5sb5W12HVmZ4vVw38VzWHm-3rx_3PW3JLrL726ky8gW3TXWB530nplqW2Wv1VK2QDBdHN3bcYP-8fqBmW1B9w9J4PhLNKW46f5Rs4Zyrh3Vz5FwS22G4z7W3P9BK33YJKhHVSFF9K22KzFjW986Ww15h78_qW5P3HYq4-2Yb-f8vTJH404 ) , including:
- How EDR & MDR protect different layers of your IT infrastructure
- How they differ in scale, visibility, management & more
- Why you need both to enable a robust security program
And don’t forget to ask about our EDR+ and Smart Guard (MDR) services to see if they’re a good fit.
Webinar Recap & Replay: Takeaways from ‘Security Unlocked’
Did you miss our recent virtual fireside chat? Hear from security experts from N-able, Adlumin, and Omega Systems who shed light on the latest security threats keeping them up at night as well as how to make the case that cyber risk management is a business problem – not just an IT problem.

Register: Top 10 Risk Assessment Gaps
(Live Webinar, July 17th)
In this 30-minute webinar (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWJWcQXtscZW6ZXyBS40Q9rqW7gFL9V5gRfbXN9k7M8K5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3lbW7fG_p45pGWSsW1L9x7c2gHWsLN7gTj_8mkcCMW92_X1X6bSkM-W1n8yXG1yQ_0gW5362yM5QY1w7W6xmcwF86Jq6hW4HcnT03wVcrtTb0xx3vDvqKW1xz9z16D3WYFW60dRWx9dK8T5Vg76-g6wg_DfW7tXknL2MnMv4W61Bg-H3qQRTCW72VH3r53Rl0ZW5sQm0074rTfPW1ljKxX3zsHJFW33q4bh3X5plTN2d3yCcYPr9tVWL9Zc37VSS5W7hLLpb6M8jSPW8L09QJ3NLSl7W4DSmzH6h4-NdW1KW58548Kv69W1SV2x_6CwpMFW4sGhhj4906WSW3CxlcC7RN6kKW5JWr7R1hy159N3jdV3BXxxPJW3f5zld5nBlLHVCLVWJ5PpGQgW4p4xZJ7ScxwwdjbYz-04 ) , members of Omega’s SOC team will explore some of the most common gaps identified during the risk assessment process and offer actionable steps for fortifying your security posture.
Key discussion topics include:
- The most common IT and security gaps discovered during risk assessments
- The clear benefits of conducting a periodic IT risk assessment
- Tips to proactively strengthen your organization’s security posture and mitigate future risk
Register Here
(https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWJWcQXtscZW6ZXyBS40Q9rqW7gFL9V5gRfbXN9k7M8K5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3lbW7fG_p45pGWSsW1L9x7c2gHWsLN7gTj_8mkcCMW92_X1X6bSkM-W1n8yXG1yQ_0gW5362yM5QY1w7W6xmcwF86Jq6hW4HcnT03wVcrtTb0xx3vDvqKW1xz9z16D3WYFW60dRWx9dK8T5Vg76-g6wg_DfW7tXknL2MnMv4W61Bg-H3qQRTCW72VH3r53Rl0ZW5sQm0074rTfPW1ljKxX3zsHJFW33q4bh3X5plTN2d3yCcYPr9tVWL9Zc37VSS5W7hLLpb6M8jSPW8L09QJ3NLSl7W4DSmzH6h4-NdW1KW58548Kv69W1SV2x_6CwpMFW4sGhhj4906WSW3CxlcC7RN6kKW5JWr7R1hy159N3jdV3BXxxPJW3f5zld5nBlLHVCLVWJ5PpGQgW4p4xZJ7ScxwwdjbYz-04 )
Omega Earns SOC 2 Type II Certification for 12th Straight Year
We’re pleased to share that Omega Systems has earned its 2024 SOC 2 Type II compliance certification (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWJWcQXtscZW6ZXyBS40Q9rqW7gFL9V5gRfbXN9k7M8K5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3lDW7RpQbY5L4HK4W6GNhFr656hFfW4BB-Ps8kTTJkW6-rx_S1RLWDkW2TY0_L92vbY7W72j0Lg1QXp_pW4yCjgd2TQfhRN8qcBbgch1zNW2lf9j99d4D1CW1BVbjm67qnb9W3pdzM55ztn4PW8B_-4G9dkDycW6s1gb-2jMBX2N7sHW0_TdJfNVqGFWC1_Gl14W6c_RX65Zm6_qN19fgtSKqH8yW57BKQg4vHdw4W1VZK103WfkhsW26kbtd12_bqNW42jfYV1-rPQpW4tjYdt8cXbdvVJdXnQ3kFtMrW2ZPQ-y7mBvSdN7_-2vnS4sdWW3nT31H6NgK7rW3JlJ712LbTHhW35ynCh1mLVYlN7RxdLNq4pr2W6VPsbp2j-LtSW4RW9wF364QWnW3L8KH63303j_f4jMw0-04 ) for the 12th consecutive year. After an extensive audit process, an independent third party, KirkpatrickPrice, has validated that Omega’s internal security controls meet the industry’s highest standards for data privacy and integrity.
“Our dedication to our customers’ security is unwavering, which is why we proactively pursue an independent SOC audit year after year,” said Omega Systems’ COO Ben Tercha. “We want our customers to know that as Omega’s services and capabilities evolve over time, so too do our security standards; giving them that peace of mind is something we take great pride in.”
How to Get in Touch
Service Needs & IT Strategy
Contact your dedicated account manager with day-to-day questions, to discuss current IT needs or to review future technology strategy.
Billing & Invoicing
For the most efficient response,
send an email to billing@omegasystemscorp.com (mailto:billing@omegasystemscorp.com)
with any invoicing needs or questions.

See what's new and noteworthy with Omega Systems this month.

| JUNE 2024
New & Noteworthy From Omega Systems
David,
Please take a few moments to review some of the content we’ve included in this month’s customer newsletter, and don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions or feedback.
In this issue:
News: Omega Continues Growth & Innovation + Adds Multi-Cloud Connectivity Capabilities
EDR vs. MDR: What’s the Difference?
Key Takeaways: Security Unlocked/MDR Webinar
Register for Our Next Webinar : Top 10 Risk Assessment Gaps (Wednesday, July 17th)
Finally, as a reminder, Omega Systems’ corporate offices will be closed on Thursday, July 4th and Friday, July 5th. As always, our Service Desk remains available for customers requiring IT support services during the holiday break.
Thanks,
Erika
News: Omega Continues Growth & Innovation + Adds Multi-Cloud Connectivity Capabilities
In case you missed the announcement earlier this month, we’re excited to share that we are growing the Omega Systems family and have acquired Amnet Technology Solutions – a Stamford-based IT MSP. In addition to Amnet’s core managed services business, Omega has invested in Cloudpath’s multi-cloud connectivity platform, which provides customers with a reliable and secure connection to multiple public cloud and SaaS providers including Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure and hundreds more.
We live in an increasingly hybrid world, and secure connectivity to multiple sites and cloud applications is necessary to ensure operational stability and effectiveness. Through Cloudpath, we have a unique and innovative way to help our customers evolve along with their modern workforces.
We’re incredibly excited to tell you more about Cloudpath in the coming months. If you’re curious to learn more now, please reach out directly to your account manager to schedule a conversation.
EDR vs. MDR: What’s the Difference?
EDR and MDR are two powerful threat detection and response tools that can significantly enhance your organization's cybersecurity posture. And while often used interchangeably, they serve different purposes for your security protection.
Learn more about EDR and MDR , including:
How EDR & MDR protect different layers of your IT infrastructure
How they differ in scale, visibility, management & more
Why you need both to enable a robust security program
And don’t forget to ask about our EDR+ and Smart Guard (MDR) services to see if they’re a good fit.
Webinar Recap & Replay: Takeaways from ‘Security Unlocked’
Did you miss our recent virtual fireside chat? Hear from security experts from N-able, Adlumin, and Omega Systems who shed light on the latest security threats keeping them up at night as well as how to make the case that cyber risk management is a business problem – not just an IT problem.
Read Key Takeaways
Watch On-Demand Replay
Register: Top 10 Risk Assessment Gaps
(Live Webinar, July 17th)
In this 30-minute webinar , members of Omega’s SOC team will explore some of the most common gaps identified during the risk assessment process and offer actionable steps for fortifying your security posture.
Key discussion topics include:
The most common IT and security gaps discovered during risk assessments
The clear benefits of conducting a periodic IT risk assessment
Tips to proactively strengthen your organization’s security posture and mitigate future risk
Register Here
Omega Earns SOC 2 Type II Certification for 12th Straight Year
We’re pleased to share that Omega Systems has earned its 2024 SOC 2 Type II compliance certification for the 12 th consecutive year. After an extensive audit process, an independent third party, KirkpatrickPrice, has validated that Omega’s internal security controls meet the industry’s highest standards for data privacy and integrity.
“Our dedication to our customers’ security is unwavering, which is why we proactively pursue an independent SOC audit year after year,” said Omega Systems’ COO Ben Tercha . “We want our customers to know that as Omega’s services and capabilities evolve over time, so too do our security standards; giving them that peace of mind is something we take great pride in.”
How to Get in Touch

Contact your dedicated account manager with day-to-day questions, to discuss current IT needs or to review future technology strategy.

send an email to billing@omegasystemscorp.com
with any invoicing needs or questions.

Frequently Asked Questions
What if I will not be available to receive my shipment?
Most of our shipments contain valuable items, so our carriers are required to obtain a signature upon delivery. However, orders delivered by Postal Service do not require a signature. If you are unable to sign for delivery, the carrier will leave a calling card. You can then contact the carrier directly to schedule a new delivery appointment or alternatively amend your delivery address.
For more information about Apple's delivery options, visit online Help.
How do I track my shipment?
Visit online Order Status to view the most up-to-date status of your order. If you ordered multiple items, you may receive separate shipments with no additional shipping charges. For more information about shipping or returns, please visit online Help.
You can also contact your Business Team with any questions.
Copyright © 2023 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

Could you please provide the XML metadata file from the IdP? This will allow us to configure the connection on our side.
To answer your question, this will not affect user's ability to log in to O365.
Thanks,
Ben
Technical Support Engineer I

2023 report.

AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM THE TNS GROUP, AN OMEGA SYSTEMS COMPANY
[image]
AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM THE TNS GROUP, AN OMEGA SYSTEMS COMPANY
Steven,
We are contacting you regarding your existing Microsoft 365 monthly subscription licenses that fall under Microsoft’s CSP legacy commerce platform. Microsoft has notified its partners that effective January 1, 2024, Microsoft will be retiring its CSP legacy commerce platform and will begin migrating all legacy subscription licenses to Microsoft’s new commerce experience (NCE) platform.
Under NCE, Microsoft defaults to an annual (committed) subscription and offers an optional monthly (non-committed) subscription, with the month-to-month option incurring up to a 20% premium. Please see the details below.
[image]
* Please respond to this email as soon as possible if you would like to change your month-to-month subscription term to an annual one-year commitment subscription term.
* If your organization requires the flexibility to reduce the user count monthly, please contact me immediately to explore the monthly non-committed option.
* If we do not hear from you prior to December 8, 2023, your existing subscription licenses will automatically be migrated over to the NCE platform on a month-to-month subscription term with up to a 20% premium starting January 1, 2024.
If you have any questions regarding this transition, please do not hesitate to reach out. We are here to support and guide you through the transition process.
[Profile Image]
Erika Ellis
Marketing and Account Manager
The TNS Group
eellis@thetnsgroup.com
(203) 316-0112 Ext. 111 - Work
www.thetnsgroup.com
[Facebook][Twitter][LinkedIn]
Unsubscribe
The TNS Group 9 West Broad Street Suite 250 Stamford, Connecticut 06902 United States (203) 316-0112

Date: 2024-02-09 00:16:28
Subject: 2/8/24:  Powerhouse Weekly Meeting Notes and Action Items

2/8/24: Powerhouse Weekly Meeting Notes
In attendance: David, Rob, Dan, and Erika
1. Events Planning
* TNS is asking for 2-3 weeks in advance to ensure we have a resource on weekends, when needed
* Initiative of Stamford coordinate the events by using the event management system, Ungerboeck
* David is focusing on this cutover to happen
* Handoff will start to occur on 2/26 - 2/28 and will bring inn their technical liaison, Tony
* Tony will be onsite, and they want to structure this as a dress rehearsal for different teams to input information in the system and determine how the handoffs will work
* Big enterprise going into place where event related work will happen
* David wants to fold TNS in the process (TNS agrees) so when they lock down dates, we can figure out timing to alert TNS so we can lock down dates for resources
Action:
* David to incorporate TNS as part of the process and he will get back to us
1. Help Desk Structure
* David wants to TNS to join Powerhouse for a lead meeting to remind the team who their IT partners are
* David wants to put in place multiple ways that that uses can submit tickets and communicate
* In example, when you have an issue, these are the ways to contact TNS
* New Ways to Contact TNS Support Desk
* There is a help desk at Powerhouse that reroutes to the TNS - TNS@powerhousearts.org is no longer valid
* David tested this to ensure that the TNS ticket goes back to the user submitting
* David setup a Slack Bot to send a ticket via TNS and he needs to look at that as a channel and send it in this way
* Users can submit an email via support@thetnsgroup.com or call support at 212-967-5757 Option 2
Actions:
* TNS and David work together to create a leave behind card or put it into new MacBook builds so users know how to submit tickets to the support desk and Dan suggested rolling out this information on the desktop - TBD
* TNS is going through the acquisition so our branding will change over the next couple of weeks - we are onboard for this
* Erika added David on all correspondence going out of TNS' database (this system will change once we move under Omega) - completed
1. TNS Ticketing System
* Ticketing system is going to be integrated with Omega - our Remote Monitoring Management (RMM) tool will change
* TNS is using CW Automate and we will move to N-central enable and this may change the Brightgauge reports - TBD
1. Finder Setup
* Action: Dan to share the work done on the Finder setup, per Steven's request, to ensure this task is completed
Communication to Powerhouse Team
* This is a work in progress
* David to set the date for our onsite or zoom and present an overview about how people communicate with TNS
* End of this month TNS is moving to O365 Omega domain, and we will have a different email (current one will still work)
* Omega/TNS will send out correspondence on the changes - David and Steven will both receive it
Action
* David to provide dates for the lead team meeting and confirm if this is onsite or via Zoom (next Quarterly meeting is 4/10)
1. SAML
* David is going to generate emails to the Manager of people who have accounts on various systems, but are not marked as employees in the HR system
* David has some scripts that are running -he will generate a form or email that will send a directive to the TNS Desk (Automated process)
* David to enable the manager of an employee to separate and submit a ticket to TNS - Manager will need to weigh in and give TNS the tasks to do this
* This will prompt managers if accounts are dangling
* Dan is working on cleaning OUs - David looked at the forms and he wants to replicate and smooth it out and review with HR
* The customized onboarding/offboarding forms goes into our system when completed
1. PTRG
* Discussed TNS keeping an eye on ISP differently
* TNS is always monitoring it - PTRG
* Rob pushed down to have 2 different DNS providers
* DNS configuration changed
Action
* David requested for Red Flag items via PTRG should go into a Slack Channel for awareness internally - Dan is testing this - loop in Rob as needed
ADFS
* ADFS for the O365 environment
* Box, Office, Google - we can make the decision how they want the RDP to be and stick to it
* Everything else is with Google
* If we are using Office 365 lightly, does the overhead make sense - don't need to answer this now
Actions:
* Steven's initiative to ensure that users are using Box - Rob to determine if they need ADFS for this
* David to obtain an O365 usage report

IMPORTANT REMINDERS: TNS Website Decommissioning & New Billing Portal
David,
In the event that you may have missed prior updates, we wanted to share two important reminders.
TNS Website Decommissioning - Wed, July 31
Please be aware that TNS’ external website (thetnsgroup.com (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VXfG904jQRj-W314Tg93YhZrsW3X6sTS5hW2XbN8tN9C23l5QzW69sMD-6lZ3nRW2C-7l19dHrRgW2JZSBp2SRH0TW6LjJ2B2SBxftW7Ztd1v55D7H0W6v03gS1j-pGVW8kstSP3vyCz7N6GKV61nmvnzW4Jghwb3s7T_5W1VBljc7-WFHtW2XjVFH33z_8CW1kf5wR5l_xJyN46j6DT4-ZlxW8dHsj51FmFHmW2lm4xy1kCVfHN6PY6JX2B2_-W1F_fRr8z1VL1W7QZypM1qNs2jV34BgP2mK4DmW6gwnmg5fwz8-W8qkxqN8GNyhXdN8tlC04 ) ) will be formally decommissioned on July 31, 2024. If you have not already, we encourage you to spend some time browsing through Omega's website, which includes a wealth of thought leadership content, service overviews, leadership bios & more.
New Billing Portal - Now Live
Effective immediately, legacy TNS customers should process payments against Omega Systems invoices using our new billing portal, powered by ConnectBooster: https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VXfG904jQRj-W314Tg93YhZrsW3X6sTS5hW2XbN8tN9CF3l5QzW7lCdLW6lZ3lVN6Tq33ZCcDHLW4bHc4D6FWRVcW4q6dQn3N69D9W7TkGBR97PNRQW9574sK1xJ4sxW2cqVBq363mV7W6xYHql3J9RQHW1_QKgR60S-KdMJNV-jqQvJXW6X5rCQ1cL1f7W8JCFZ74zwFcYW1pb2CL3_-F6gW6LC5z06sHMrpW3DMvGl3y4n3RW8nnwD33J7-1BV27R1Y7PPtPRN35J_xv9s1jKW7G6-Bl4csJ_8W5tnPkc7DgJ0GW85CGG55X8dx8W7mNb1s8cm6wnW3BNlND6Jg1k_W5ZhM3s4ysrS6W1gX8tc3vh1cndfp4vR04 (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VXfG904jQRj-W314Tg93YhZrsW3X6sTS5hW2XbN8tN9CF3l5QzW7lCdLW6lZ3lVN6Tq33ZCcDHLW4bHc4D6FWRVcW4q6dQn3N69D9W7TkGBR97PNRQW9574sK1xJ4sxW2cqVBq363mV7W6xYHql3J9RQHW1_QKgR60S-KdMJNV-jqQvJXW6X5rCQ1cL1f7W8JCFZ74zwFcYW1pb2CL3_-F6gW6LC5z06sHMrpW3DMvGl3y4n3RW8nnwD33J7-1BV27R1Y7PPtPRN35J_xv9s1jKW7G6-Bl4csJ_8W5tnPkc7DgJ0GW85CGG55X8dx8W7mNb1s8cm6wnW3BNlND6Jg1k_W5ZhM3s4ysrS6W1gX8tc3vh1cndfp4vR04 )
The following payment methods are accepted via our new payment portal:
- ACH Pull – Omega initiates payments (preferred)
- ACH Push – Customer initiates payment
- Credit Card payments (subject to a processing fee)
As always, thank you for your continued support of the Omega team as we navigate this integration. If you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to reach out.

Erika

TNS Integration Reminders: New Billing Portal & Website Decommissioning

This email contains important reminders about transition to Omega Systems' new billing portals and external website.
IMPORTANT REMINDERS: TNS Website Decommissioning & New Billing Portal
David,
In the event that you may have missed prior updates, we wanted to share two important reminders.
TNS Website Decommissioning - Wed, July 31
Please be aware that TNS’ external website ( thetnsgroup.com ) will be formally decommissioned on July 31, 2024. If you have not already, we encourage you to spend some time browsing through Omega's website, which includes a wealth of thought leadership content, service overviews, leadership bios & more.
New Billing Portal - Now Live
Effective immediately, legacy TNS customers should process payments against Omega Systems invoices using our new billing portal, powered by ConnectBooster: https://thetnsgroup.connectboosterportal.com/platform/paynow
The following payment methods are accepted via our new payment portal:
ACH Pull – Omega initiates payments (preferred)
ACH Push – Customer initiates payment
Credit Card payments (subject to a processing fee)
As always, thank you for your continued support of the Omega team as we navigate this integration. I f you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to reach out.
Best,
Erika
Erika Ellis
Omega Systems
New Links to Bookmark
** Billing Portal: https://thetnsgroup.connectboosterportal.com/platform/paynow
** Omega Website (links to relevant portals & contact info available): https://omegasystemscorp.com/company/the-tns-group-has-a-new-home/
For 24x7 Customer Support:
Connecticut
(203) 316-0112
New York
(212) 967-5757
Massachusetts/RI
(508) 992-2541
Omega Systems
Headquarters: 1121 Snyder Road, Reading, PA, 19609
PA | NJ | NY | CT | MA
www.omegasystemscorp.com
Manage Preferences
