---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Robert Nieves
Date: Wed, Nov 22, 2023 at 11:49 AM
Subject: Powerhouse Generator Test Result
To: Erika Ellis , David Koosis , Steven Battaglia
Cc: Daniel Lucas
Hello Team,
I just wanted provide an update on yesterday’s generator test.
At 4:30PM. Myself and fellow TNS Engineer Aaron Goldring arrived onsite.
Aaron was brought along so that he may be aware and familiar with the site
as well.
A walk through was conducted on IT closets throughout the building to
ensure all devices were connected directly to PDU or Battery backup and not
to any Normal receptacles.
Was also advised AV support was on site and all their equipment located in
AV closet on 3rd floor was manually shutdown by AV techs.
Upon walk through it was discovered the Guardhouse was on battery backup
but the UPS was plugged into normal power. An outlet nearby maybe on
generator power but will need to be verified by In House engineering before
swapping over.
The Primary ISP line in the MDF is on their own battery backup however
that UPS is plugged into a Normal receptacle.
All security servers have the option of redundant power supplies but only
one power supply was used.
TNS added extra power supplies that were brought over to ensure power
redundancy on all servers and network equipment that allow for that.
At 5:15 coned power was shut down and generator power kicked in. All
equipment in MDF remained on line. As to be expected Primary ISP circuit
went on to dedicated battery back up.
Walk through was performed and confirmed all IT closets remained on line
and all Wireless APs were up and functioning.
Internet was still accessible throughout power shutdown.
Guardhouse equipment also stayed up while on battery backup.
At 6:15 coned power was restored to building and all equipment remained on
line during switch. No network outages through out process.
All devices that utilized battery backup showed about 20% availability
after 1 hour of battery backup. At current rate uptime will be for a little
less than an hour and half.
*Final remediation objectives:*
Primary ISP Backup:
ISP UPS should be either added to generator outlet via power cord adapter
or via extension cord to rack PDU
Guard House battery:
Internal Engineers need to determine if receptacle not labeled as normal is
indeed on generator backup and if so will need to move over UPS connection.
=== EMAIL END ===

=== EMAIL START ===
From: Robert Nieves <rnieves@thetnsgroup.com>
To: Erika Ellis <EEllis@thetnsgroup.com>, David Koosis
	<vcto@powerhousearts.org>, Steven Battaglia <steven@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2023-11-22 16:48:54
Subject: Powerhouse Generator Test Result

Hello Team,
I just wanted provide an update on yesterday's generator test.
At 4:30PM. Myself and fellow TNS Engineer Aaron Goldring arrived onsite.
Aaron was brought along so that he may be aware and familiar with the site as well.
A walk through was conducted on IT closets throughout the building to ensure all devices were connected directly to PDU or Battery backup and not to any Normal receptacles.
Was also advised AV support was on site and all their equipment located in AV closet on 3rd floor was manually shutdown by AV techs.
Upon walk through it was discovered the Guardhouse was on battery backup but the UPS was plugged into normal power. An outlet nearby maybe on generator power but will need to be verified by In House engineering before swapping over.
The Primary ISP line in the MDF is on their own battery backup however that UPS is plugged into a Normal receptacle.
All security servers have the option of redundant power supplies but only one power supply was used.
TNS added extra power supplies that were brought over to ensure power redundancy on all servers and network equipment that allow for that.
At 5:15 coned power was shut down and generator power kicked in. All equipment in MDF remained on line. As to be expected Primary ISP circuit went on to dedicated battery back up.
Walk through was performed and confirmed all IT closets remained on line and all Wireless APs were up and functioning.
Internet was still accessible throughout power shutdown.
Guardhouse equipment also stayed up while on battery backup.
At 6:15 coned power was restored to building and all equipment remained on line during switch. No network outages through out process.
All devices that utilized battery backup showed about 20% availability after 1 hour of battery backup. At current rate uptime will be for a little less than an hour and half.
Final remediation objectives:
Primary ISP Backup:
ISP UPS should be either added to generator outlet via power cord adapter or via extension cord to rack PDU
Guard House battery:
Internal Engineers need to determine if receptacle not labeled as normal is indeed on generator backup and if so will need to move over UPS connection.
Hello Team,
I just wanted provide an update on yesterday’s generator test.
At 4:30PM. Myself and fellow TNS Engineer Aaron Goldring arrived onsite.

Upon walk through it was discovered the Guardhouse was on battery backup but the UPS was plugged into normal power. An outlet nearby maybe on generator power but will need to be verified by In House engineering before swapping over.
The Primary ISP line in the MDF is on their own battery backup however that UPS is plugged into a Normal receptacle.
All security servers have the option of redundant power supplies but only one power supply was used.
TNS added extra power supplies that were brought over to ensure power redundancy on all servers and network equipment that allow for that.
At 5:15 coned power was shut down and generator power kicked in. All equipment in MDF remained on line. As to be expected Primary ISP circuit went on to dedicated battery back up.
Walk through was performed and confirmed all IT closets remained on line and all Wireless APs were up and functioning.
Internet was still accessible throughout power shutdown.
Guardhouse equipment also stayed up while on battery backup.
At 6:15 coned power was restored to building and all equipment remained on line during switch. No network outages through out process.
All devices that utilized battery backup showed about 20% availability after 1 hour of battery backup. At current rate uptime will be for a little less than an hour and half.

ISP UPS should be either added to generator outlet via power cord adapter or via extension cord to rack PDU
Guard House battery:
Internal Engineers need to determine if receptacle not labeled as normal is indeed on generator backup and if so will need to move over UPS connection.

NEW & NOTEWORTHY FROM OMEGA SYSTEMS
David,
Please take a few moments to review some of the content we’ve included in this month’s Omega Systems customer newsletter, and don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions or feedback.
In this issue:
- Why Aren’t More Companies Adopting Generative AI?
- Service Spotlight: Cloudpath
- [PRODUCT WEBINAR] Cloudpath 101 – Exclusive to Omega Customers
- Guide to Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) Security
Finally, as a reminder, Omega Systems’ corporate offices will be closed on Monday, Sept 2nd to celebrate the upcoming Labor Day holiday. As always, our Service Desk will continue to operate with normal after-hours and holiday support coverage for customers requiring these services.
Thank you,
Erika
Why Aren’t More Companies Adopting Generative AI?
Omega COO Ben Tercha publishes first article on Forbes.com
We’re pleased to share that Omega’s Chief Operating Officer, Ben Tercha, is now a member of Forbes Technology Council – an exclusive community for CIOs, CTOs, and technology executives. Following is a brief excerpt from his first article (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWRgv_5jBtyW40xr5y75wlsTW7jDgJ35kkd82N3fD2Cg5m_5PW5BWr2F6lZ3pYW3zp4Mt6FZzG_W42HwJb2xn_nKW1mMc4b8Rpn9FN3MTWqHX0P2ZW1SF2tK77SpYGW7yw_dD96BSL1W7K2B9d8HbPv4N45sm9_8zHmQN4z4g-7V28MXW23tRbL6FP0GDVYrK6v7ylj4bVl7spG7pCChrW9cgC5P6TSWWpW4gNP4S4BZPPDVcbThl8CzxTjVVRbg0652LxkW2lMRxh2vwz4sW4GMqv55sy6MDW3N2b-27YlWMWW22k6v469Q9wpW1_WJR41lWM9-V86WHy3wjXWGN6TyQf584-SbW33gjCs83M1MFW4D4rzC8SBLTpW10nsl552KfLHVzDQSQ19vdMbVjV0LF4qh18PW3tfVg35dKyt8W1sLD9c8XppBqW86D5Sz62vHqWW2N7wDN6csFzYN5HhZ-wSMvGKW7D_vRJ2Y4wQyf2DwV1q04 ) in which Ben speculates about some of the reasons businesses are slow to adopt generative AI solutions like Microsoft Copilot.
“Seemingly, everywhere you turn, the dominant conversation topic is generative AI. Discussion groups, webinars, conferences, email newsletters—it’s the subject everyone wants to talk about. While the excitement and hype seem to be glaringly present in these virtual forums, it’s a sharp contrast to the level of interest and utilization we’re seeing in the real world...
Admittedly, we’ve been encouraging our customers to pace themselves with AI adoption, primarily to ensure they focus on reviewing and implementing security and data privacy measures before giving generative AI unrestricted access to their environment. But if our customer base is in any way a representation of the broader marketplace, then perhaps we should be thinking about why. There are a few obvious reasons that come to mind.”
Read the full article on Forbes.com
(https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWRgv_5jBtyW40xr5y75wlsTW7jDgJ35kkd82N3fD2Cg5m_5PW5BWr2F6lZ3pYW3zp4Mt6FZzG_W42HwJb2xn_nKW1mMc4b8Rpn9FN3MTWqHX0P2ZW1SF2tK77SpYGW7yw_dD96BSL1W7K2B9d8HbPv4N45sm9_8zHmQN4z4g-7V28MXW23tRbL6FP0GDVYrK6v7ylj4bVl7spG7pCChrW9cgC5P6TSWWpW4gNP4S4BZPPDVcbThl8CzxTjVVRbg0652LxkW2lMRxh2vwz4sW4GMqv55sy6MDW3N2b-27YlWMWW22k6v469Q9wpW1_WJR41lWM9-V86WHy3wjXWGN6TyQf584-SbW33gjCs83M1MFW4D4rzC8SBLTpW10nsl552KfLHVzDQSQ19vdMbVjV0LF4qh18PW3tfVg35dKyt8W1sLD9c8XppBqW86D5Sz62vHqWW2N7wDN6csFzYN5HhZ-wSMvGKW7D_vRJ2Y4wQyf2DwV1q04 )
Service Spotlight: CLOUDPATH
One of the most exciting opportunities born from our recent acquisition of Amnet Technology Systems is Cloudpath – a next-generation, secure network connectivity solution that integrates high-speed Internet, site-to-site LAN, and direct cloud access to more than 200+ service providers (including AWS, Azure/Entra ID, Google Cloud, and more).
Among Cloudpath’s core benefits include:
Cloudpath brochure_front_page (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWRgv_5jBtyW40xr5y75wlsTW7jDgJ35kkd82N3fD2F23prCCW95jsWP6lZ3mPW5T0vDD7wq8SxVJkzM35Cr9f5W82m0mN1c9s7rVPQ5Ql8VMGwfN2L65JkwTcv1VsxkDS6tRF6DW3z9XVR29bcKSVXYZ3d64lMysW4SYhDk4Yz98JN7kfYHSg40fzW7_cdbG62Kq08W1WsvLb6h-ScdW1XQtMn1P0SRQW1dy8rf8tXZ-2W6bNf694FGNRXW5p2wbW4DKSvRW8n14RJ1k-v1yW975BqG3pWlXJW1388-Z8q6Np0W5N64-j94mkmhW1TL3gW2K-MwnV_M36N3mhG8PW1xVKnV6xwb6vW6n0Hvh11P1zZW9hR6Pf2sbXzPW5lXbNz704cttW8T7X1T63pcsSW26TRqq15KRrCW3fdnK47B8-m6W8nsWf68Ljxkyf303yhv04 )
- Flexibility: Secure network connections with the ability to add Internet, direct cloud connections and site-to-site on demand.
- Reliability: All services backed by an industry leading business-grade SLA (Service Level Agreement).
- Speed: Cloudpath optimizes to auto-detect the most efficient paths to your destination.
- Trust: 24x7 expert support from the Omega Systems family of companies.
Exclusive Offer for Omega Customers:
Cloudpath is pleased to offer complimentary network spend assessments to Omega Systems customers. This includes detailed executive summary reports designed to uncover potential savings and obtain more value vs. existing network spend.
If you’re interested in learning more about how your business could benefit from Cloudpath, we encourage you to:

Guide to EDR Security
Regardless of your business’ size or industry, cybersecurity remains a pressing concern, particularly as threats and tactics grow in sophistication. To combat these evolving risks, one of the most effective tools in your security stack is endpoint detection and response (EDR). In our latest blog article, we provide a comprehensive overview of EDR security, its importance for your business, and actionable steps you can take to enhance your EDR implementation and thus, your overall security posture.
Read the full article here (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWRgv_5jBtyW40xr5y75wlsTW7jDgJ35kkd82N3fD2B-5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3mWVzBh7c7sSWy1V72cDg2dcV1zVzMvHY1wv_8VVtsDMm1rQnCmW7DnXTK93vBJHN6YnJNMJDw3GW3x5P_f3TWxKMW4DrCmd86T0XFW8pl39_8hh3DyW8nwsJj3DjGN2W4F25wS2w8yhwW8kVHrC6MNdy4W3ktxTL7K0vRYW11kP4V8fJn5GV8vJYS788jLjW3QXlTt3s9c75N7QMZDwHhBN5W68YcRy2KslzzW5L2sHp6KDYNMVljS3x1Z1p-XW2CLJY26rSY7ZW8s_H2c8qDWZHW1kxkWw3S9DjvW3ldpL01r-MSWW6nhKcC3w6JjDW6MVMy69hYkptW8jMVx53s4dnPW6vMF9w1qHKXmW6B4RD22-50TQW6QBnqp6-s7dgN2y4r7qP7Nt-W5GlM3y7SDXzFf6K_8yP04 ) .
Omega Wins Two Prestigious Fast-Growth Awards
We are proud to share that Omega Systems was recently recognized among the U.S.’s fastest-growing companies with not one, but two prestigious awards (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWRgv_5jBtyW40xr5y75wlsTW7jDgJ35kkd82N3fD2Cg5m_5PW5BWr2F6lZ3n-W95NK0573GNMvW1GM4jP4zndPnW7M9z8Z59gnvpW3q30tF8Nsn1dW3MBcQw6K9TtZN8f7Yj455qxxW7PZRCj8t1PKCW7m1Mfz3gW7gNW7Rq1-k5bH8R4W8ddLpc2hzDgkW7PWLdz5RwpQ9W7pB7bP8XWMgKVhLpzZ58dBKjW7-z0DK77B3_WW1YTzVt1bTgkZW2KRZBk3nP6xDVMhC_m3_hHkDW1Lbfbd5bMFV3W5kkhGs2CDdQgW4mK23q43FPjGV-2hNt2tvgv5W9cn7hL2x9--7W1wcVqH44MJMWW2LL_tc1r4wXvW26JYJG6PbvkZW4d0C5T4NSCxCW3ff_838Vbd_9W7lll5n5m7C-NW3pgqq8810XyyW3_K3Qg5tVHFKW7Kt3Xb2JddDWW12kpYJ24D9lfW3pMhWf2gDGn0N1c-hf45bgvLdNhPds04 ) – Inc. 5000 and CRN Fast Growth 150.
Inc. 5000 Color Medallion Logo-1 (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/MWRgv_5jBtyW40xr5y75wlsTW7jDgJ35kkd82N3fD2Cg5m_5PW5BWr2F6lZ3n-W95NK0573GNMvW1GM4jP4zndPnW7M9z8Z59gnvpW3q30tF8Nsn1dW3MBcQw6K9TtZN8f7Yj455qxxW7PZRCj8t1PKCW7m1Mfz3gW7gNW7Rq1-k5bH8R4W8ddLpc2hzDgkW7PWLdz5RwpQ9W7pB7bP8XWMgKVhLpzZ58dBKjW7-z0DK77B3_WW1YTzVt1bTgkZW2KRZBk3nP6xDVMhC_m3_hHkDW1Lbfbd5bMFV3W5kkhGs2CDdQgW4mK23q43FPjGV-2hNt2tvgv5W9cn7hL2x9--7W1wcVqH44MJMWW2LL_tc1r4wXvW26JYJG6PbvkZW4d0C5T4NSCxCW3ff_838Vbd_9W7lll5n5m7C-NW3pgqq8810XyyW3_K3Qg5tVHFKW7Kt3Xb2JddDWW12kpYJ24D9lfW3pMhWf2gDGn0N1c-hf45bgvLdNhPds04 )

| AUGUST 2024
NEW & NOTEWORTHY FROM OMEGA SYSTEMS
David,
Please take a few moments to review some of the content we’ve included in this month’s Omega Systems customer newsletter, and don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions or feedback.
In this issue:
Why Aren’t More Companies Adopting Generative AI?
Service Spotlight: Cloudpath
[PRODUCT WEBINAR] Cloudpath 101 – Exclusive to Omega Customers
Guide to Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) Security
Finally, as a reminder, Omega Systems’ corporate offices will be closed on Monday, Sept 2nd to celebrate the upcoming Labor Day holiday. As always, our Service Desk will continue to operate with normal after-hours and holiday support coverage for customers requiring these services.
Thank you,
Erika
Why Aren’t More Companies Adopting Generative AI?
Omega COO Ben Tercha publishes first article on Forbes.com
We’re pleased to share that Omega’s Chief Operating Officer , Ben Tercha , is now a member of Forbes Technology Council – an exclusive community for CIOs, CTOs, and technology executives. Following is a brief excerpt from his first article in which Ben speculates about some of the reasons businesses are slow to adopt generative AI solutions like Microsoft Copilot.
“Seemingly, everywhere you turn, the dominant conversation topic is generative AI. Discussion groups, webinars, conferences, email newsletters—it’s the subject everyone wants to talk about. While the excitement and hype seem to be glaringly present in these virtual forums, it’s a sharp contrast to the level of interest and utilization we’re seeing in the real world...
Admittedly, we’ve been encouraging our customers to pace themselves with AI adoption, primarily to ensure they focus on reviewing and implementing security and data privacy measures before giving generative AI unrestricted access to their environment. But if our customer base is in any way a representation of the broader marketplace, then perhaps we should be thinking about why. There are a few obvious reasons that come to mind.”
Read the full article on Forbes.com
Service Spotlight: CLOUDPATH
One of the most exciting opportunities born from our recent acquisition of Amnet Technology Systems is Cloudpath – a next-generation, secure network connectivity solution that integrates high-speed Internet, site-to-site LAN, and direct cloud access to more than 200+ service providers (including AWS, Azure/Entra ID, Google Cloud, and more).
Among Cloudpath’s core benefits include:
Flexibility: Secure network connections with the ability to add Internet, direct cloud connections and site-to-site on demand.
Reliability: All services backed by an industry leading business-grade SLA (Service Level Agreement).
Speed: Cloudpath optimizes to auto-detect the most efficient paths to your destination.
Trust: 24x7 expert support from the Omega Systems family of companies.
Exclusive Offer for Omega Customers:
Cloudpath is pleased to offer complimentary network spend assessments to Omega Systems customers. This includes detailed executive summary reports designed to uncover potential savings and obtain more value vs. existing network spend.
If you’re interested in learning more about how your business could benefit from Cloudpath, we encourage you to:
Review the attached brochure for more information
Reach out to your Account Manager to request a network spend assessment
Register for our customer product webinar on Tues, Sept 17 th (details below)
[WEBINAR 9/17]: Cloudpath 101 for Omega Customers
In this exclusive product webinar for Omega Systems customers , learn more about Cloudpath – a secure, next-gen connectivity solution designed to give you faster and more reliable access to the Internet services, cloud applications and data centers that power your daily operations.
In this virtual presentation alongside Cloudpath’s founders and architects, we’ll explore:
How Cloudpath works & its three primary “connect functions” (Internet, Cloud & Site-to-Site)
Cloudpath features, benefits and frequently asked questions
How does Cloudpath differ from traditional ISPs, MPLS, etc.?
We have multiple office locations; how will Cloudpath accelerate our connectivity?
Will Cloudpath enhance my security and/or disaster recovery?
Examples and case studies of real-world customers
Open Q&A with Cloudpath leaders
Register Here
Guide to EDR Security
Regardless of your business’ size or industry, cybersecurity remains a pressing concern, particularly as threats and tactics grow in sophistication. To combat these evolving risks, one of the most effective tools in your security stack is endpoint detection and response (EDR). In our latest blog article, we provide a comprehensive overview of EDR security, its importance for your business, and actionable steps you can take to enhance your EDR implementation and thus, your overall security posture.
Read the full article here .
Omega Wins Two Prestigious Fast-Growth Awards
We are proud to share that Omega Systems was recently recognized among the U.S.’s fastest-growing companies with not one, but two prestigious awards – Inc. 5000 and CRN Fast Growth 150.
“Being recognized as ‘fast-growth’ means we are not only evolving with rapidly changing times but, more importantly, leading the way in delivering the solutions, scalability and service excellence that our customers deserve,” said Omega Systems CEO Mike Fuhrman . “These awards underscore that enduring commitment, and we’re honored and excited to continue building on that promise as we drive future growth across the U.S.”

11/29/23: Powerhouse (PH) Monthly Meeting and Immediate Action Items
In attendance: David, Rob, Dan, and Erika
1. S/W, H/W Reporting status
* Hardware that TNS manages was provided in the shared hardware document (David reviewed on the call - no further action at this time)
* Software stats - Rob is actively working on this and will provide everything that we have access to
* Purpose: David wants to turn this into a catalogue for users, so they have insight into the approved applications
* PH has specific applications that TNS only has access for onboarding and will have to grow and learn with users as we are not "application specialists" across all platforms
* There were application champions in the past (Ben, Paul)
* Purpose of Hardware reporting
* Determine what TNS is managing and what other players are managing systems (AV, security, etc.)
* Need to know who is managing Genentech, and if machines are being updated
* Once David has a tighter picture, we can determine where TNS gets involved - full life cycle or simply putting an image on laptops - TBD
* David needs TNS with fact findings and we are more than happy to support those initiatives
1. Contact Information
* TNS is willing to do another onboarding for TNS and Powerhouse
* Concern that users are not sending to the correct addresses:
* Mitch has my address in his address book as support@thetnsgroup.com instead of eellis@thetnsgroup.com (I am not getting his emails)
* Finance sent a request to TNS@powerhousearts.org - it should go to support@thetnsgroup.com
1. Onboarding
* Per David and TNS, we have a process in place that works well from a process standpoint
* TNS build lead timelines (see attached)
* Onboarding forms must be complete and confirm if the user is getting a new machine
* Dan reaches out to Yarisbeth to clarify the form submission when needed
* Dan meets with users on Wednesdays when he is onsite to do a deep dive into the onboarding; he calls them on their first day to make sure the user can get into their software and machine
* David to build parameters into the process to makes sure that communication on both sides is clear
1. Brightgauge Ticket and Inventory (Addigy) Reporting
* Rob walked David through how to access and use Brightgauge (post our call), which will provide him ticketing information and the Mac inventory (pulled via Addigy) and other data.
* Rob resent the invitation for the platform
1. POM status for Door APs/other
* David has a contact at POM via Mitch so he can get clarity on the POM side
* This will help clarify what is out there, who is managing it and will develop an overall map of devices on the network for security and management purposes
1. OS Upgrades - Print Shop
* Dan setup the two new iMacs and deployed them
* Machines comply, but need to determine what to do with the old machines (most TNS clients use https://www.4thbin.com/ for recycling purposes
Action:
* Dan to determine if there are any further print shop devices that need OS upgrades/or PH in general and alert David for next steps
1. Tickets
* Wi-Fi at Gatehouse - #5232506 - Wyze Camera and Access Point (resolved during a separate meeting today)
* Mitch with Kode Labs - Service Ticket #5226123 -
* Erika reached out to Mitch and copied David to determine next steps - TNS is not authorized to implement a new SaaS for the Building Management System without approval from David or Steven
* Salesforce Login - #5201123
* Resolved; Megan asked David (Admin for Salesforce) to give access to Julia T and it was provided
1. Ticket Process
* Escalation via Account Manager (AM - Erika)
* Submit tickets prior to Dan going onsite so we can prioritize
* David can do a quick spot check on Tuesdays, so Dan is aware of priorities and that is the first in queue
* We do not want staff waiting for a resolution until Dan gets onsite - he is pulled in many directions
* Few steps needed to tighten this up; David will support this initiative as he understands the ticketing process overall over time
* David to work with TNS as needed and provide protocol to users over time
1. Network Questions
* Overall Wi-Fi coverage -
* Handled through POM
* David wants to know how the Wi-Fi coverage looks
* Rob noted 2 Meraki's side by side that can be separated
* The Access Points are smart APs and if they are close to teach other, one will reduce its power so there is no overlapping
* Not too much overlapping
* Most APs are auto sensors
* Need to get cameras on separate SSID and start analyzing the rest of items so they are not taking over bandwidth
* EnGenius APs for the doors
* EnGenius is on Zigbee or Z-Wave
* Davd needs some clarity from POM, i.e., respond time on the Schlage door locks that are controlled and connected to the gear, but not to TNS network
Action:
* David to get clarity from POM on Access Points

Onboarding forms must be complete and confirm if the user is getting a new machine
Dan reaches out to Yarisbeth to clarify the form submission when needed
Dan meets with users on Wednesdays when he is onsite to do a deep dive into the onboarding; he calls them on their first day to make sure the user can get into their software and machine
David to build parameters into the process to makes sure that communication on both sides is clear
Brightgauge Ticket and Inventory (Addigy) Reporting
Rob walked David through how to access and use Brightgauge (post our call), which will provide him ticketing information and the Mac inventory (pulled via Addigy) and other data.
Rob resent the invitation for the platform
POM status for Door APs/other
David has a contact at POM via Mitch so he can get clarity on the POM side
This will help clarify what is out there, who is managing it and will develop an overall map of devices on the network for security and management purposes
OS Upgrades – Print Shop
Dan setup the two new iMacs and deployed them
Machines comply, but need to determine what to do with the old machines (most TNS clients use
https://www.4thbin.com/ for recycling purposes
Action:
Dan to determine if there are any further print shop devices that need OS upgrades/or PH in general and alert David for next steps

Wi-Fi at Gatehouse - #5232506 - Wyze Camera and Access Point (resolved during a separate meeting today)

Erika reached out to Mitch and copied David to determine next steps – TNS is not authorized to implement a new SaaS for the Building Management System without approval from David or Steven
Salesforce Login - #5201123
Resolved; Megan asked David (Admin for Salesforce) to give access to Julia T and it was provided
Ticket Process
Escalation via Account Manager (AM – Erika)
Submit tickets prior to Dan going onsite so we can prioritize
David can do a quick spot check on Tuesdays, so Dan is aware of priorities and that is the first in queue
We do not want staff waiting for a resolution until Dan gets onsite – he is pulled in many directions
Few steps needed to tighten this up; David will support this initiative as he understands the ticketing process overall over time
David to work with TNS as needed and provide protocol to users over time
Network Questions
Overall Wi-Fi coverage –
Handled through POM
David wants to know how the Wi-Fi coverage looks
Rob noted 2 Meraki’s side by side that can be separated
The Access Points are smart APs and if they are close to teach other, one will reduce its power so there is no overlapping
Not too much overlapping
Most APs are auto sensors
Need to get cameras on separate SSID and start analyzing the rest of items so they are not taking over bandwidth
EnGenius APs for the doors
EnGenius is on Zigbee or Z-Wave
Davd needs some clarity from POM, i.e., respond time on the Schlage door locks that are controlled and connected to the gear, but not to TNS network

Subject: Re: Ticket#5441551/Powerhouse/PoE on elevator cameras -- has been updated

Hi TNS Group,
Thank you for letting me know this !
Last week I bought new ethernet adapters for the 2 elevators that the
cameras weren't working in and hooked them up in the elevator lobby X1
elevator and the other one in the Y2 elevator. Only the X1 elevator camera
started working again. I checked the IT closet on the 5th floor and see
that both Y! and Y2 blue cat 5 cables are plugged in. Additionally I
swapped out the cameras in the Y1 and Y2 elevators and the cameras are
working ok. Can you please verify that the cat 5 cables are plugged into
the correct ports ? I have already contacted my security vendor and they
don't know whats wrong at this point and asked that I contact you. On the
ethernet adapter the TWP light that is supposed to be on is not on. I
unplugged the transformer and then plugged it back on and this TWP light
goes on and then goes back off. I believe this light should be on since the
adjacent elevator that is working has this TWP light on.
Thanks for your help,
Mitch

Hi TNS Group, Thank you for letting me know this ! Last week I bought new ethernet adapters for the 2 elevators that the cameras weren't working in and hooked them up in the elevator lobby X1 elevator and the other one in the Y2 elevator. Only the X1 elevator camera started working again. I checked the IT closet on the 5th floor and see that both Y! and Y2 blue cat 5 cables are plugged in. Additionally I swapped out the cameras in the Y1 and Y2 elevators and the cameras are working ok. Can you please verify that the cat 5 cables are plugged into the correct ports ? Subject: Fwd: Action Required - Zoom Phone License Notification

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Zoom
Date: Sat, May 18, 2024 at 9:02 AM
Subject: Action Required - Zoom Phone License Notification
To:
Dear Valued Customer,
As an admin or owner of an account utilizing Zoom Phone, we are reaching
out to notify you that we have acknowledged the changes you have made to
the Phone licenses on your subscription. Our engineering team has
identified that some of your users may still be on your old calling plan.
In an effort to ensure you do not lose important user profile information,
we are allowing you 13 calendar days from the date of change, to make any
updates and ensure all your users are on an active plan. If you do not make
the changes within this period, the user profiles associated with your
originally assigned licenses will be lost. Please take advantage of this 13
days grace period. *At the end of the 13 days, the user profiles for the
new licenses on your account in your Admin portal will have to be
reconfigured in your Admin portal.*
If you do not make these updates, 13 calendar days from the date of change,
your users may lose some of their Zoom Phone privileges and key
functionalities.
If you need additional information, please reference our Support
page.
=== EMAIL END ===

Robert Nieves
1/11/2024 7:48 PM-
Hello David,
We have several methods of monitoring your ISP and Network equipment.
PRTG is our monitoring software for your ISP.
We have probes that will continuously ping the ISP IP’s. Should an ISP go down, a ticket is automatically generated and handle by our team. These come in as code red and are handled promptly. POC’s are always notified in these scenarios.
As you will see from the Graphs below, there were no packet loss on 1/9 and 1/10, thus no alert was sent to us.
[[A screenshot of a computer Description automatically generated]]
[[A screenshot of a computer Description automatically generated]]
For the internal network, we also have alerts generated from the Meraki systems should internal wifi or switches go offline.
This also showed to be stable during the outage indicated. Also with your two ISPs you would have failover, should the primary ISP go down the secondary would kick in.
[[image]]
We can try to do some more in depth analysis to try and pinpoint the issues with you devices at the time of the network delay.
Would you be able to provide the mac address or IP of the devices in question. I can try to see which APs those were connected to and see if there were any issues with the APs as well.
[[image]]
Rob Nieves
rnieves@thetnsgroup.com
[[image]][[image]] [[image]] [[image]] [[image]] [[image]]

Adding some data points:
Jan 9
- 2:24PM Luther reported being unable to get to Box
- 2:35PM Megan reported "the wifi is out"
- 2:39PM Jenn Choi reported problems getting online
In this time frame Steve came to me and reported that he and others in a meeting in the main conference room lost WiFi.
When I checked, I saw WiFi signal but no internet access, and within a minute it came back online.
It felt like an ISP outage / power outage on a key device / DNS issue.

Hi Steven,
I hope you had a great weekend!
I was able to meet with my boss regarding the uplift. To go from 30 users to 60 users, the increase would be $3000 per month. As you know, we do NOT price per person. We encompass the entire environment, etc., and I was able to keep the pricing down. This comes out to $100/user/month – although again, that is not how we price things.
Again, I did not want to incur any increases until our partnership was stable and moving forward, which I believe we are in that direction.
I will take your lead on this, and I am more than happy to jump on a call at any time.

AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM THE TNS GROUP, AN OMEGA SYSTEMS COMPANY
Steven,
We are pleased to let you know that we will commence with anti-virus (AV) solution migration during the month of May. Customers will be migrated to Omega’s endpoint detection and response (EDR) solution, powered by SentinelOne, during a two-day installation window, during which workstations and laptops should remain plugged in and powered on; laptop screens should also remain open.
Please note: [COMPANY]’s installation window is scheduled for [AV MIGRATION WINDOW].
To complete the installation, there is a planned reboot window expected from 8:00-11:00pm ET both evenings. We encourage you to save your work before signing off during each day of the installation window.
Omega Systems’ Security Operations Center (SOC) will be activated during the migration process and monitoring systems to work through adjusting exceptions and responding to false positives.
These changes will occur in the background, and users should not experience any impact during the migration window.
As always, if you have any questions, please reach out to your account manager.
Thank you,

I feel your pain! To be fair, I think his response is basically on target,
even if it wasn't timely or especially useful.
There's something about the file that's making it difficult to open for
other-than-the-official AutoCAD reader. Or something. Maybe it's unusually
complex -- the online reader took a solid 3 minutes to load the file.
If you have to handle a lot of these, may want to look into getting you a
higher power reader.
Or, it may be the sender could save it in a less complex format -- flatten
the layers?
I feel your pain! To be fair, I think his response is basically on target, even if it wasn't timely or especially useful. There's something about the file that's making it difficult to open for other-than-the-official AutoCAD reader. Or something. Senior Vice President, Powerhouse Arts
direct 718.303.2448
Upcoming PTO 11/2 - 11/6
Thanks, Steve. Looping in Jenn as we feel there's certainly crossover need for usage that we can share for the time being between Devo and CEP. It looks like the iPad Air or iPad 10th Generation (10.9") would work well.
DEVO Needs:
Primarily event check-in & use off-site: presentation sharing, at art fairs for sharing artwork details, processing sales, general browser/ email usage.
App usage anticipated:
zkipster - Check-In (or other platform TBD)
Arternal - art sales
Gmail
Salesforce
Jenn please feel free to chime in with what app needs you would anticipate beyond using for event check-in.
Thanks so much!
Megan
Hey Megan,
Yes, we've used TS for years - we used to license Office 365 and Asana through them, prior to working directly with the providers for steeper discounts at volume rates, and also having direct access to account management, etc. In terms of Apple hardware products, they typically only sell refurbished devices (see below screenshot). To be honest, I don't know if it's worth the discount for a slightly out-of-date tablet, versus buying what we need brand new from Apple, which will also allow us to buy an AppleCare warranty, which is our standard process. We have a direct relationship with Apple Business, and TNS procures on our behalf. This also enables devices to be automatically enrolled in our mobile device management system that TNS uses for monitoring and troubleshooting. Here's how we should move forward:
* Browse the lower portion of this page to compare ipad models side by side, and let us know what dimension screen you think will work best for your event check-in purposes (and @Amy Babcock what your needs are for site visits - I imagine you'll need a bigger screen, with greater resolution).
* Let David K and I know what screen size you each need, and on a typical basis what you'll need to run on the tablet. (What apps, how many apps will you have open at the same time, etc.). From here, we'll suggest a processing, memory, and storage spec.
* We'll submit a ticket to TNS for procurement for the devices - procurement takes a few weeks.
Thanks,
S
--
Steven Battaglia (he/him)
Senior Vice President, Powerhouse Arts
direct 718.303.2448
Upcoming PTO 11/2 - 11/6
Hi David and Steve,
Have you heard of TechSoup? We used it regularly at RxART to purchase new tech equipment for a fraction of the cost; organizations need to join as a member - not sure what the annual fee is.
I would like to plan for purchasing an iPad for development's use for internal and external cultivation/patron events, future fundraisers, etc. It seems like it could make sense for an iPad to be shared between Development & Events or AEC, do you agree?
Thanks,
Megan
Megan Skidmore (she/her)

Hey Megan,
Yes, we've used TS for years - we used to license Office 365 and Asana through them, prior to working directly with the providers for steeper discounts at volume rates, and also having direct access to account management, etc. In terms of Apple hardware products, they typically only sell refurbished devices (see below screenshot). To be honest, I don't know if it's worth the discount for a slightly out-of-date tablet, versus buying what we need brand new from Apple, which will also allow us to buy an AppleCare warranty, which is our standard process. We have a direct relationship with Apple Business, and TNS procures on our behalf. This also enables devices to be automatically enrolled in our mobile device management system that TNS uses for monitoring and troubleshooting. Here's how we should move forward:
* Browse the lower portion of this page to compare ipad models side by side, and let us know what dimension screen you think will work best for your event check-in purposes (and @Amy Babcock what your needs are for site visits - I imagine you'll need a bigger screen, with greater resolution).
* Let David K and I know what screen size you each need, and on a typical basis what you'll need to run on the tablet. (What apps, how many apps will you have open at the same time, etc.). From here, we'll suggest a processing, memory, and storage spec.
* We'll submit a ticket to TNS for procurement for the devices - procurement takes a few weeks.
Thanks,
S
--

Megan On Tue, Oct 31, 2023 at 3:17 PM Steven Battaglia wrote: Hey Megan, Yes, we've used TS for years - we used to license Office 365 and Asana through them, prior to working directly with the providers for steeper discounts at volume rates, and also having direct access to account management, etc. In terms of Apple hardware products, they typically only sell refurbished devices (see below screenshot). To be honest, I don't know if it's worth the discount for a slightly out-of-date tablet, versus buying what we need brand new from Apple, which will also allow us to buy an AppleCare warranty, which is our standard process. We have a direct relationship with Apple Business, and TNS procures on our behalf. This also enables devices to be automatically enrolled in our mobile device management system that TNS uses for monitoring and troubleshooting. Here's how we should move forward: Browse the lower portion of this page to compare ipad models side by side , and let us know what dimension screen you think will work best for your event check-in purposes (and @Amy Babcock what your needs are for site visits - I imagine you'll need a bigger screen, with greater resolution). Let David K and I know what screen size you each need, and on a typical basis what you'll need to run on the tablet. (What apps, how many apps will you have open at the same time, etc.). From here, we'll suggest a processing, memory, and storage spec. We'll submit a ticket to TNS for procurement for the devices - procurement takes a few weeks. Thanks, S -- Steven Battaglia (he/him) Senior Vice President , Powerhouse Arts direct 718.303.2448 Upcoming PTO 11/2 - 11/6 On Tue, Oct 31, 2023 at 12:43 PM Megan Skidmore wrote: Hi David and Steve, Have you heard of TechSoup ? We used it regularly at RxART to purchase new tech equipment for a fraction of the cost; organizations need to join as a member - not sure what the annual fee is. I would like to plan for purchasing an iPad for development's use for internal and external cultivation/patron events, future fundraisers, etc. It seems like it could make sense for an iPad to be shared between Development & Events or AEC, do you agree?  been updated

Hi All,
We simply need to be able to check email and view security cameras on the
desktop computer. The wifi supports a camera that the security site
supervisor can see to ensure that the guards are at their post and not
sleeping.
I prefer not to reach out to the previous security vendor as they were
already terminated. Is there another way to gain access to that desktop
computer?
A larger question is, can we add TNS support to the technology in the
gatehouse? I am not sure why it's not already included in TNS's scope.
Best,
Phoenix

From: Erika Ellis <EEllis@thetnsgroup.com>
To: Steven Battaglia <steven@powerhousearts.org>, "vcio@powerhousearts.org"
	<vcio@powerhousearts.org>, David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>, Daniel
 Lucas <DLucas@thetnsgroup.com>, Robert Nieves <rnieves@thetnsgroup.com>
Date: 2023-10-26 21:48:36
Subject: 10/25/23:  Powerhouse Monthly Meeting Notes and Action Items 

Hi all, thank you for your time yesterday. Below are the notes and action items from our meeting. Please let me know if you have any questions, changes, or updates. Enjoy your evening, Erika
10/25/23: Powerhouse Monthly Meeting Notes and Action Items
In attendance: Steven, David K. David G., Rob, Dan, and Erika
1. General Discussion:
* One of David's charges is to look at the relationship to see what we can do to strengthen it, amid Powerhouse's growth to date and projected growth
* It is important to streamline IT across the organization
* They want to take a closer look at their needs to keep the growth and organization strong
* There may be gaps in IT that still need to be identified
* Need an understanding of what Powerhouse needs to be successful and where TNS fits in
* Sense is that what worked in the past will not work going forward - need to determine what that looks like and what the implications are for our engagement, and how to change it
* Overall goal: Work together to make Powerhouse successful and provide clarity on their needs
* David will collaborate with TNS to determine what adjustments may need to take place going forward
1. Wi-Fi Project
* Quote was sent for visibility purposes; TNS wanted to clarify the request and to ensure the cabling is in place should we move forward, prior to approval
* It was agreed to delete this quote - we are not going forward at this time
* When walking around, physical access points that unlock the doors are on Wi-Fi and some are responding slowly
* there may be a desire to add access points
* TNS was asked for additional coverage - 2 access points in the parking lot - they are not directly attached to the access system
* Concern that Dan is getting pulled in different directions and we need to do some realignment
* Any quote requests, TNS to walk away and alert to Steven or David so they can investigate further
Action:
* David to speak to Mitch to clarify his askes for the 2 Access Points in the parking lot
1. Doors - Access Points
* POM manages the doors
EnGenius access points are the square ones with the antenna and the one close to the doors was rebooted
* Dan asked Mitch and Dean to get POM on the phone to discuss the Wi-fi
* TNS does not have visibility into the doors, and we don't support it, POM does
* The doors go through POM
* It is on an EnGenius access point and there is a switch in the server room, and it connects to three (3) security servers
* No one knows how to access the Access Points and how to get into the security device
* Dan has reached out to POM multiple times, and they never get back to him
Action:
* David to facilitate the discussion with POM so we have a proper handoff of the Aps, server, etc.
* David to follow-up on this slowness with the doors
1. Inventory Access
* TNS shipped some machines directly to Powerhouse for testing purposes
* Those machines need asset tags
* Dan is going through all machines to ensure they are all tagged, and the asset tag number is implemented in Addigy
Action:
* David to work with TNS to learn about Addigy and how it works
1. Inventory Status/New Hires
* Per our discussion, TNS sent out a quote for 2 MacBooks and 2 Airs today and the quote was approved
* We have one basic machine available onsite (13 inch)
* Powerhouse is looking to replace Paul's position
* Two new hires:
* Lee Newton - setup by 10/30
* Karyn Williams - 11/6
1. Print Shop Machines
* There are some older Macs that do not work with peripherals due to age
* Those machines need an upgrade - Dan works collaboratively with Luther and at times, they do not want to do the upgrades
* Some of the machines are old and don't function
* Because they have unusual peripherals - it is dependent on a several drivers and Luther thought some of the older Macs were not working with some of the gear
* It might be fixed of they go to newer Macs
* Print shop computer hard drives are full - they should move data to Box
* Dan had a call with Luther - CPU was at 99% when trying to render a picture
* Multiple things are happening on those Macs, and they are becoming bogged down
Action:
* Daivd to look at this with Dan and write up a recommendation to Steven for print shop
1. OS upgrades
* Several of the print shop are not upgraded - Dan is trying to facilitate this; those on the 12.63 is most likely an artist device
* Dan is trying to get users to Ventura
1. Software Updates
* Just deployed the new versions of Slack and Chrome - Dan is still at Powerhouse and going through to make sure all were detected for all machines online
* He created the intern policy within Addigy and will put all the MacBook Airs in Addigy for each intern
1. Security Measures
* Patching and security updates mandated by Apple is managed by TNS through Addigy
* The older OS are out of security and not compliant - might have to take them and update
* Dan can share in greater detail what scripts we are targeting, how they ran/run through a repository
* Cybersecurity is in our portfolio - reviewed during our Technical Business Review (TBR)
* David worked at another organization and experienced a Cyberattack and this shifted his thinking of the level of security an organization should have
* TNS has a strong security stack, and it is enhanced through our parent company, Omega Systems, with additional solutions and security experts
Action:
* David to help TNS upgrade all machines out of compliance from a security standpoint
*
1. Brightgauge
* Integrates our tools and ticketing into a dashboard that is easy to view and consumable
* Quick snapshot of what we have
* Warranties on the machines, Tickets for the last 30 days, who is submitting tickets, sub-types, etc. - all in real time
* Rob built this for Powerhouse, so they have one dashboard to look at
Hi all, thank you for your time yesterday. Below are the notes and action items from our meeting. Please let me know if you have any questions, changes, or updates. Enjoy your evening, Erika

Hi David,

This is not automated; it is manually so it may not be perfect each time.

Hi, David. The PC I use for the embroidery machine is nearly dead. It’s no longer charging properly, and yesterday I couldn’t get it to turn on… this morning it at least is updating and on.
It hasn’t been maintained. It’s still trying to sign into dropbox, and I can’t remember when we made the switch to box, but before 2022…
It’s severely under capacity for what I need it to do… it’s basically a microsoft touchscreen ipad—it can’t crunch the numbers it has to do a lot of automated functions in the embroidery program. But it’s still useful for drawing things out manually.
It would be great to have a dedicated computer. I’m really not sure what hard drive capacity I need, but I can reach out to the software developer to ask. Our software should be updated as well to really get the machine running... It would be great if it can run photoshop and illustrator.

From: Erika Ellis <eellis@omegasystemscorp.com>
To: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-04-23 18:00:03
Subject: RE: Replacement Embroidery Workstation

Hi David,
I tried to call you back so I left a message on your cell.
Yes, we can add extra verbiage in our quotes. However, I will need that verbiage prior to sending it to quotes@thetnsgroup.com to spec out the machine and will need to direct them on what to include on the quote. This is out of our standard process so I will need to make them aware each time to include the verbiage you are providing, which is not a problem. This is not automated; it is manually so it may not be perfect each time.
In the past, Paul would work with the user and loop Dan in to make sure we spec out the right system, then it was sent to me. This is along the lines of Dan working with Nellie.
We will do our best to handle this in the best way for you. I welcome your thoughts. I will be out of the office tomorrow and returning early next week. We can discuss further on our weekly call next week if that is best.
I welcome your thoughts, Erika

Here's my original request:
Hello Team Omega:
Please assess Nellie's need, and initiate a procurement for review/approval. Thank you!
==
Hi, David. The PC I use for the embroidery machine is nearly dead. It’s no longer charging properly, and yesterday I couldn’t get it to turn on… this morning it at least is updating and on.
It hasn’t been maintained. It’s still trying to sign into dropbox, and I can’t remember when we made the switch to box, but before 2022…
It’s severely under capacity for what I need it to do… it’s basically a microsoft touchscreen ipad—it can’t crunch the numbers it has to do a lot of automated functions in the embroidery program. But it’s still useful for drawing things out manually.
It would be great to have a dedicated computer. I’m really not sure what hard drive capacity I need, but I can reach out to the software developer to ask. Our software should be updated as well to really get the machine running... It would be great if it can run photoshop and illustrator.
--

I don't see the original ask -
The process I had set up with Paul Kim was that all asks for new /
replacement machines would come to him, he would vet it with Omega and
you/Goodman, if necessary, he would submit the ticket for procurement,
inform me in our 1:1 that a request was in process, then the quote would
come through from Erika, Paul would affirm all the specs were correct, and
I would approve from a budget spending POV.

Good morning,

On Tuesday November 21 @ 5:15p along with my vendor I will be conducting an online generator test. This is when we turn off the electricity to the building and the electricity is restored to the building from the generator. As you know when the electricity is restored this can sometimes cause problems to sensitive equipment such as the servers due to the surge. I will be sending an email out to the Powerhouse Arts staff soon to tell them to turn off their computers 15 minutes prior to the start of the online generator test, shall I have them unplug them too ? Additionally, I think I should have a TNS tech on site during this time to check the UPS and in case something goes wrong as I plan to reopen the building at 7:00p since we are open during the week until 10:00p.

On Tuesday November 21 @ 5:15p along with my vendor I will be conducting an online generator test. This is when we turn off the electricity to the building and the electricity is restored to the building from the generator. As you know when the electricity is restored this can sometimes cause problems to sensitive equipment such as the servers due to the surge. I will be sending an email out to the Powerhouse Arts staff soon to tell them to turn off their computers 15 minutes prior to the start of the online generator test, shall I have them unplug them too ? Additionally, I think I should have a TNS tech on site during this time to check the UPS and in case something goes wrong as I plan to reopen the building at 7:00p since we are open during the week until 10:00p.

color: #9aa0a6 !important;
}
.grey-button-text:not([class^="x_"]),
.attachment-chip:not([class^="x_"]) a {
color: #bdc1c6 !important;
}
.accent-text:not([class^="x_"]),
.hairline-button-text:not([class^="x_"]) {
color: #8ab4f8 !important;
}
.primary-button:not([class^="x_"]) {
background-color: #8ab4f8 !important;
}
.primary-button-text:not([class^="x_"]) {
color: #202124 !important;
}
}
.encryption-icon:not([class^="x_"]) {
background-image: url('https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/i/googlematerialiconsfilled/encrypted/v3/gm_grey200-24dp/2x/gm_filled_encrypted_gm_grey200_24dp.png') !important;
}
}
.prevent-link a {
color: inherit !important;
text-decoration: none !important;
font-size: inherit !important;
font-family: inherit !important;
font-weight: inherit !important;
line-height: inherit !important;
}

John M. Fernandez
11/10/2023 12:15 PM-12:25 PM
Hi David,
We reviewed the setup instructions and part of the process appears to be allowing Arternal to access all Google services. Can you provide more detail on how the email integration feature will be used, as well as any other Arternal features you may be interested
in utilizing?
David Koosis
11/9/2023 10:46 AM-
Request
Configure Arternal with Third-Part App access on Powerhouse Google Workspace.
These are the directions from Arternal:
https://intercom.help/arternal/en/articles/5812133-linking-google-email-accounts
This is time sensitive, due by Tue Nov 14 -- earlier would be terrific. If that's not possible, please alert me. Thank you!
Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.
Additional Points of Contact
Powerhouse customer and point-of-contact for Arternal is: Megan Skidmore ( megan@powerhousearts.org )
Arternal point-of-contact (non-technical): Georgieanna Richer ( georgeianna@arternal.com )
Notes
Follow your standard protocol for these kinds of admin changes to Google Workspace, as far as any logging or permissions.
When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you

3. Access is available to users in the powerhouse.org domain, although we can change this to specific OUs if you would like to to restrict it further.

John M. Fernandez
11/10/2023 12:15 PM-12:25 PM
Hi David,
We reviewed the setup instructions and part of the process appears to be allowing Arternal to access all Google services. Can you provide more detail on how the email integration feature will be used, as well as any other Arternal features you may be interested
in utilizing?
David Koosis
11/9/2023 10:46 AM-
Request
Configure Arternal with Third-Part App access on Powerhouse Google Workspace.
These are the directions from Arternal:
https://intercom.help/arternal/en/articles/5812133-linking-google-email-accounts
This is time sensitive, due by Tue Nov 14 -- earlier would be terrific. If that's not possible, please alert me. Thank you!
Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.
Additional Points of Contact
Powerhouse customer and point-of-contact for Arternal is: Megan Skidmore ( megan@powerhousearts.org )
Arternal point-of-contact (non-technical): Georgieanna Richer ( georgeianna@arternal.com )
Notes
Follow your standard protocol for these kinds of admin changes to Google Workspace, as far as any logging or permissions.
When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you
=== EMAIL END ===

John Fernandez
11/14/2023 4:00 PM
David,
Arternal has been added to the the apps list under App Access Control
2. The OAuth scope is currently not listed. App access for google services is set to Limited for now but can be changed if necessary.
3. Access is available to users in the powerhouse.org domain, although we can change this to specific OUs if you would like to to restrict it further.
Let me know if you need more information.

John M. Fernandez
11/10/2023 12:15 PM-12:25 PM
Hi David,
We reviewed the setup instructions and part of the process appears to be allowing Arternal to access all Google services. Can you provide more detail on how the email integration feature will be used, as well as any other Arternal features you may be interested
in utilizing?
David Koosis
11/9/2023 10:46 AM-
Request
Configure Arternal with Third-Part App access on Powerhouse Google Workspace.
These are the directions from Arternal:
https://intercom.help/arternal/en/articles/5812133-linking-google-email-accounts
This is time sensitive, due by Tue Nov 14 -- earlier would be terrific. If that's not possible, please alert me. Thank you!
Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.
Additional Points of Contact
Powerhouse customer and point-of-contact for Arternal is: Megan Skidmore ( megan@powerhousearts.org )
Arternal point-of-contact (non-technical): Georgieanna Richer ( georgeianna@arternal.com )
Notes
Follow your standard protocol for these kinds of admin changes to Google Workspace, as far as any logging or permissions.
When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you
=== EMAIL END ===

3. Access is available to users in the powerhouse.org domain, although we can change this to specific OUs if you would like to to restrict it further.
Let me know if you need more information.
Summary:

David Koosis
11/9/2023 10:46 AM-
Request
Configure Arternal with Third-Part App access on Powerhouse Google Workspace.
These are the directions from Arternal:
https://intercom.help/arternal/en/articles/5812133-linking-google-email-accounts
This is time sensitive, due by Tue Nov 14 -- earlier would be terrific. If that's not possible, please alert me. Thank you!
Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.
Additional Points of Contact
Powerhouse customer and point-of-contact for Arternal is: Megan Skidmore ( megan@powerhousearts.org )
Arternal point-of-contact (non-technical): Georgieanna Richer ( georgeianna@arternal.com )
Notes
Follow your standard protocol for these kinds of admin changes to Google Workspace, as far as any logging or permissions.
When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you

Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.
Additional Points of Contact
Powerhouse customer and point-of-contact for Arternal is: Megan Skidmore ( megan@powerhousearts.org )
Arternal point-of-contact (non-technical): Georgieanna Richer ( georgeianna@arternal.com )
Notes
Follow your standard protocol for these kinds of admin changes to Google Workspace, as far as any logging or permissions.
When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you

Benjamin Molenaar, Mar 5, 2024, 9:56 PM EST
Hi David,
Thanks for your response. Here's the SAML attributes currently used in your connection:
Attribute SAML_SUBJECT
Attribute FirstName
Attribute LastName
Attribute member-of
While it would be possible to ingest the attributes you mentioned coming from Google, there would need to be something to map them to on our side. Box does not store information such as department or title in the User Profile, so I'm not sure what we would use this information for. We do have a field for phone.
Regarding user provisioning, the way we handle this is documented HERE. Please take a look at this doc and let me know if it's something you would like to enable. Keep in mind we can only automaically provision accounts from our side, not de-provision.
Let me know if you have any questions about the above.
Regards,
Ben
Technical Support Engineer I
Community and Knowledge Base: https://support.box.com

=== EMAIL START ===
From: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
To: Robert Nieves <rnieves@thetnsgroup.com>
Date: 2023-11-13 16:47:59
Subject: WiFi networking questions

Rob
Can you educate me about these general networking questions when we next
connect?
Email or phone call is fine.
1. Powerhouse is an unusual office structure with lots of metal and
3-foot thick concrete walls, so I imagine WiFi performance is different
from a typical corporate office. Do you have a sense, or have we ever done
a walkaround mapping, of the overall WiFi penetration around the whole
building? Pretty strong? Any dead spots?
2. I see some spots like at the front door where we've got two AP's
right nearby each other. I think that predates your tenure, but do you have
any idea if that was done for a particular reason?
3. Do we use 2.4 as well as 5 ghz, and can you educate me as to whether
that makes any meaningful difference in a space like Powerhouse?
Are the motion sensors and locks and so on riding WiFi? Could we
partition those small-payload long-distance things to 2.4?
4. Is Meraki mesh, and can you educate me whether that makes any
meaningful difference in a space like Powerhouse?
Thank you!
=== EMAIL END ===

From: Pamela Rapp
Sent: Monday, October 30, 2023 10:56 AM
To: David Koosis ; Robert Nieves ; Erika Ellis
Cc: Steven Battaglia
Subject: Meeting request - ongoing potentially network interruption related problems
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Hi Erica and Rob,
I wanted to ask whether it would be possible to get Rob, Dan Lucas, David and myself on the phone over these next two days?
Dan Lucas already has some knowledge of the Dante control network issue, but I am not sure whether or not he started a ticket.
Here is in a nutshell what is happening:
The transmitting and receiving devices communicate via a Dante system.
Currently we do not see all the transmitting devices on the network and we are unable to pass audio signal.
We are wondering whether there is a correlation between the "network incident" that occurred after the update of the Meraki routers and this problem?
We are also wondering whether the managed switches in the Audio racks are managed by TNS or not?
Also wondering whether there is any interconnection between these managed switches and other network equipment managed by TNS?
The background thought to all these questions is whether any ports might have gotten closed which require to be open for the Dante network to function?
The urgency of the situation is related to the fact that we have a new AV installer coming in on November 6 to do some punch list work on the system and we do not want to hand it to them in worse condition than it was handed over to us by the original installer.
Let me know when might be a good time for this.
Many thanks.
Pam
--
Pamela Rapp (she / her / hers)
Director of Event Production and Operations, Powerhouse Arts
Featured in the press: "Brooklyn’s Batcave Reborn as Gotham’s Art Factory" by Hilarie Sheets for The New York Times

That sounds perfect, David. Speaking from past venues, it is certainly possible that future issues will occur (especially when equipment starts aging) and it is going to be a time saver to have a process in place which everyone is familiar with. On Tue, Oct 31, 2023, 10:39 AM David Koosis wrote: Thanks Pamela! I have one relevant ticket into TNS regarding "whether the managed switches in the Audio racks are managed by TNS": Ticket 5152745 I understand the immediate priority: get the AV devices working with Dante before your new vendor arrives next Monday, Nov 6. I have an additional related goal I'd like to get started on in the same meeting: design a diagnostic protocol intended to quickly determine when a problem is related to, say, TNS managed network infrastructure vs something Dante related. My ambition is that after we debug the current issue, we may even be able to put together a few test scripts which we could use to diagnose, or perhaps monitor, alert, even generate a ticket, for similar issues in the future, What do you think? To: Pamela Rapp <pamela@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2023-10-31 10:39:35
Subject: Re: Meeting request - ongoing potentially network interruption
 related problems

Thanks Pamela!
I have one relevant ticket into TNS regarding "whether the managed switches
in the Audio racks are managed by TNS": Ticket 5152745
I understand the immediate priority: get the AV devices working with Dante
before your new vendor arrives next Monday, Nov 6.
I have an additional related goal I'd like to get started on in the same
meeting: design a diagnostic protocol intended to quickly determine when a
problem is related to, say, TNS managed network infrastructure vs something
Dante related. My ambition is that after we debug the current issue, we may
even be able to put together a few test scripts which we could use to
diagnose, or perhaps monitor, alert, even generate a ticket, for similar
issues in the future,
What do you think? Let's save a few minutes to discuss at our meeting.
/dk

From: Pamela Rapp >
Sent: Monday, October 30, 2023 10:56 AM
To: David Koosis >; Robert Nieves >; Erika Ellis >
Cc: Steven Battaglia >
Subject: Meeting request - ongoing potentially network interruption related problems
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Hi Erica and Rob,
I wanted to ask whether it would be possible to get Rob, Dan Lucas, David and myself on the phone over these next two days?
Dan Lucas already has some knowledge of the Dante control network issue, but I am not sure whether or not he started a ticket.
Here is in a nutshell what is happening:
The transmitting and receiving devices communicate via a Dante system.
Currently we do not see all the transmitting devices on the network and we are unable to pass audio signal.
We are wondering whether there is a correlation between the "network incident" that occurred after the update of the Meraki routers and this problem?
We are also wondering whether the managed switches in the Audio racks are managed by TNS or not?
Also wondering whether there is any interconnection between these managed switches and other network equipment managed by TNS?
The background thought to all these questions is whether any ports might have gotten closed which require to be open for the Dante network to function?
The urgency of the situation is related to the fact that we have a new AV installer coming in on November 6 to do some punch list work on the system and we do not want to hand it to them in worse condition than it was handed over to us by the original installer.
Let me know when might be a good time for this.
Many thanks.
Pam

From: Pamela Rapp
Sent: Monday, October 30, 2023 10:56 AM
To: David Koosis ; Robert Nieves ; Erika Ellis
Cc: Steven Battaglia
Subject: Meeting request - ongoing potentially network interruption related problems
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Hi Erica and Rob,
I wanted to ask whether it would be possible to get Rob, Dan Lucas, David and myself on the phone over these next two days?
Dan Lucas already has some knowledge of the Dante control network issue, but I am not sure whether or not he started a ticket.
Here is in a nutshell what is happening:
The transmitting and receiving devices communicate via a Dante system.
Currently we do not see all the transmitting devices on the network and we are unable to pass audio signal.
We are wondering whether there is a correlation between the "network incident" that occurred after the update of the Meraki routers and this problem?
We are also wondering whether the managed switches in the Audio racks are managed by TNS or not?
Also wondering whether there is any interconnection between these managed switches and other network equipment managed by TNS?
The background thought to all these questions is whether any ports might have gotten closed which require to be open for the Dante network to function?
The urgency of the situation is related to the fact that we have a new AV installer coming in on November 6 to do some punch list work on the system and we do not want to hand it to them in worse condition than it was handed over to us by the original installer.
Let me know when might be a good time for this.
Many thanks.
Pam

Subject: 11/21 Generator Test Prep
EXTERNAL EMAIL!!!
Rob:
Regarding 11/21 Powerhouse generator test, I know Steve gave the go-ahead to Erika regarding Mitch's request for you to be on-site.
Prior to the test, can you please confer with Mitch/Dean to get the test checklist and ensure that we include any relevant tech-specific items?
Are any of the following relevant?
- telecom or fiber failover protocols for which we need to coordinate with providers?
There are no Protocols currently in place. You have ISP handoff in the lower level MDF and on the roof. The power to the ISP equipment may be on a different circuit in the MDF on not on the APC on the Rack.
- Do we know if the static IPs on Pam's AV gear can handle a power bounce?
We have no insight into any AV or Security equipment. Those vendors should be notified as well.
- From past tests, do you anticipate any issues?
This will be the first time the test will be conducted to our knowledge prior to opening.
Do you know if Powerhouse has biz continuity or SOC audits that include power testing? Maybe we can kill two birds with one generator test.
We are unaware of any SOC audits pending.

On Mon, May 27, 2024, 6:21 AM Steven Battaglia wrote: — Best regards, Steven Sent from my iPhone - please excuse any typos Begin forwarded message: From: Zoom Date: May 25, 2024 at 2:02:45 PM GMT+1 To: steven@powerhousearts.org Subject: Action Required - Zoom Phone License Notification ﻿
Dear Valued Customer,
As an admin or owner of an account utilizing Zoom Phone, we are reaching out to notify you that we have
acknowledged the changes you have made to the Phone licenses on your subscription. Our engineering team has
identified that some of your users may still be on your old calling plan.
In an effort to ensure you do not lose important user profile information, we are allowing
you 6 calendar days from the date of change, to make any
updates and ensure all your users are on an active plan. If you do not make the changes within this period,
the user profiles associated with your originally assigned licenses will be lost. Please take advantage of
this 6 days grace period. At the end of
the 6 days, the user profiles for the new licenses on
your account in your Admin portal will have to be reconfigured in your Admin portal.
If you do not make these updates, 6 calendar days from the
date of change, your users may lose some of their Zoom Phone privileges and key functionalities.
If you need additional information, please reference our Support page.
=== EMAIL END ===

— Best regards, Steven Sent from my iPhone - please excuse any typos Begin forwarded message: From: Zoom Date: May 25, 2024 at 2:02:45 PM GMT+1 To: steven@powerhousearts.org Subject: Action Required - Zoom Phone License Notification ﻿
Dear Valued Customer,
As an admin or owner of an account utilizing Zoom Phone, we are reaching out to notify you that we have
acknowledged the changes you have made to the Phone licenses on your subscription. Our engineering team has
identified that some of your users may still be on your old calling plan.
In an effort to ensure you do not lose important user profile information, we are allowing
you 6 calendar days from the date of change, to make any
updates and ensure all your users are on an active plan. If you do not make the changes within this period,
the user profiles associated with your originally assigned licenses will be lost. Please take advantage of
this 6 days grace period. At the end of
the 6 days, the user profiles for the new licenses on
your account in your Admin portal will have to be reconfigured in your Admin portal.
If you do not make these updates, 6 calendar days from the
date of change, your users may lose some of their Zoom Phone privileges and key functionalities.
If you need additional information, please reference our Support page.
=== EMAIL END ===

Megan / Steven
Follow up on what I just sent, but excluding the vendors and including
Steven.
I want to be positive, problem solving, and forward looking, and at the
same time acknowledge this is not going as well as any of us want.
You want to send out a very important mailing today, and zkipster is not
configured as you need.
To fix this, I think we need someone to be responsible as administrative
owner of zkipster, responsible to make sure the system is running smoothly
and configured according to best practices. In our situation, I think Omega
(Dan) and I were assuming that Ellie or the zkipster onboarding team
configured the system, while Ellie and you, may have been assuming that the
network-related aspects were an "IT" issue. It's both. Someone needs to
understand how zkipster works, and to be responsible to ensure that the
networking configuration is as we need it, and also that the content that
goes out is produced in line with best practices for deliverability (ie, it
doesn't get flagged as spam).
TBH, my first instinct is still to say that Ellie should be that person,
because she's the marketing vendor with expertise using zkipster. I thought
she would be the one to advise you on how to use the tool and which best
practices to follow as far as composing and sending and email that is
spam-filter friendly. Does that make sense to you, or have I got it wrong?
Thank you for working through this with me. I'll stay on top of zkipster
and the DNS changes this morning and keep you informed.
/dk
I'm copying Steven because this relates to an important initiative (your
mailing) and to technology issues.

settings (DNS records) yesterday, which take a few minutes to a few days to
propagate around the internet.
I've been in touch with zkipster support last night and this morning to
monitor and see what they can do to speed up the process.
I see that our network team (Omega) made DNS changes related to zkipster a
month ago, following a request.
But those changes alone were not sufficient to enable zkipster "white
labelling." There are additional confirmation and configuration steps that
need to get done in zkipster, as the zkipster admin. (Note: only one user
can have admin rights on zkipster, and that's currently you, Megan; so we
are using your account with the credentials you shared.) These steps are
what we did last night.

and verify that things are configured to meet your requirements? We want
that person to assist with your first big mailing using zkipster.

and configuring our email to avoid spam filters and increase
deliverability, I gave you my input on best practices, but this is
zkipster's bread and butter; is there someone at zkipster who can scan or
test the invitation to provide feedback on our first big mailing using

Hi Megan and team,
Welcome to zkipster! We are excited to have you onboard on the Professional
Annual plan and look forward to working with you over the course of this
year.
*Onboarding*
Your plan includes one Q&A Session with your Customer Success Manager,
Jasmine, copied here to help you get the most out of the tools available in
zkipster. Jasmine will get in touch to set up the session with you.
*Resources for your team training:*
To make the most of your Q&A session, we recommend watching the product
tutorials below before the call:
*Welcome to zkipster | Product Overview* - Watch Video
- On-demand webinars on getting started with zkipster
- Our Help Center includes how-to guides, step-by-step articles, and
short tutorials
- Our Support Chat to get in touch with the team for quick or urgent
questions (via the small chat icon on the bottom right of your browser or
app).
Please let me know if you have any questions at all, and thank you for
choosing zkipster!
All the best,
Jess

would apply to emails from info@powerhousearts.org as well as all
employees (sam@powerhousearts.org) or special email addresses (
sales@powerhousearts.org, jobs@powerhousearts.org, etc).
