=== EMAIL START ===
From: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
To: Steven Battaglia <steven@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-02-21 10:50:10
Subject: new email security standards implemented for Powerhouse

*Steven & Team:*
Couple updates re email.
*Email Security - DKIM/DMARC/SPF*
Dan recently implemented email security standards on our behalf (thanks
team TNS!). As David G brought to my attention, the big guys -- like
Google -- are starting to enforce certain email security standards strictly
for any sort of bulk email, like newsletters. Failure to implement these
standards can result in newsletters bouncing, and, potentially,
powerhouse.org getting put on a list of untrusted email domains.
So, it's a big positive step forward.
Technically, the standards are implemented as changes to our DNS records,
which broadcast our credentials to the internet's email infrastructure, and
make it difficult for spammers to abuse the powerhousearts.org domain. Here's
the best "explain it like I'm 5 years old" explanation I've seen:
SPF: These are the servers I will send from. If it says it's from me, but
comes from somewhere else, it's likely fake
DKIM: This is my signature, if it's not on the email, it probably didn't
come from my server.
DMARC: If you get mail that doesn't match the above, here's what I want you
to do with it..
@Sam - as the sender of newsletters, you are most likely to be impacted by
these changes. Please alert me to any notice you may receive from Mailchimp
regarding DKIM/SPF/DMARC, or any changes in bounce rates. I'll also check
Mailchimp's public documentation for any statements regarding their
requirements. If anyone else at Powerhouse sends email to, say 100+
recipients, please forward this email.
*Powerhouse Branding*
Here's the fun part. Implementing these security standards fulfills most of
the requirements for implementing another standards, called BIMI, which
lets us present certified branding in email. This wouldcause our certified
brandmark to appear in several places, notably, email inboxes.
These are the additional steps we need to take:
1. Register our brandmark. (It looks like we already have
.)
2. Pay an annual fee of about $1,500 to a certificate authority for a
"Verified Mark Certificate." I'm checking to see if Entrust
or Digicert have nonprofit
discounts.
The payoff is that your brandmark shows up in recipient inboxes and a few
other contexts, like this:
[image: bimim.png]
I think it's a good investment, especially now, when it's a distinctive
thing that not everyone does.
Steve: I'll take it offline for discussion with you.
Thank you
/dk
=== EMAIL END ===

It's ok - I do it all the time. Yes, Karyn just joined as our VP Programs - this makes sense.
David, this is a bit backwards process wise, but at some point in the near-ish future, we do need to do an Adobe audit - lots of folks are requesting the full Adobe CC suite but likely don't need the full suite to complete their work (and I know several who have requested it for their own personal work). This one has always been hard to get a handle on. That being said, the expense isn't too great, so it can wait and I will approve these additional licenses. Also, I'd love to move people away from Acrobat and onto Preview as there's just an unnecessary expense for limited additional functionality.

Subject: Re: 10 Adobe CC Licenses

It's ok - I do it all the time. Yes, Karyn just joined as our VP Programs
- this makes sense.
David, this is a bit backwards process wise, but at some point in the
near-ish future, we do need to do an Adobe audit - lots of folks are
requesting the full Adobe CC suite but likely don't need the full suite to
complete their work (and I know several who have requested it for their own
personal work). This one has always been hard to get a handle on. That
being said, the expense isn't *too* great, so it can wait and I will
approve these additional licenses. Also, I'd love to move people away from
Acrobat and onto Preview as there's just an unnecessary expense for limited
additional functionality.

11/10/2023 12:15 PM-12:25 PM
Hi David,
We reviewed the setup instructions and part of the process appears to be allowing Arternal to access all Google services. Can you provide more detail on how the email integration feature will be used, as well as any other Arternal features you may be interested
in utilizing?
David Koosis
11/9/2023 10:46 AM-
Request
Configure Arternal with Third-Part App access on Powerhouse Google Workspace.
These are the directions from Arternal:
https://intercom.help/arternal/en/articles/5812133-linking-google-email-accounts
This is time sensitive, due by Tue Nov 14 -- earlier would be terrific. If that's not possible, please alert me. Thank you!
Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.
Additional Points of Contact
Powerhouse customer and point-of-contact for Arternal is: Megan Skidmore ( megan@powerhousearts.org )
Arternal point-of-contact (non-technical): Georgieanna Richer ( georgeianna@arternal.com )
Notes
Follow your standard protocol for these kinds of admin changes to Google Workspace, as far as any logging or permissions.
When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you

Background
Powerhouse has signed up with Arternal, a SaaS provider for art sales. To support integrated email (and some other capabilities?) Arternal requested access rights.

When you configure, please check if Arternal is requiring any "sensitive" or "restricted" Google API Oauth scopes, and whether access can be restricted to named Powerhouse accounts.
Thank you

To hunt down the issue we need to work directly with DocuSign technical support, because the issue is related to their emailing systems.
Are you able to get us a contact with your IT organization or DocuSign support rep?
Thanks
/dk

AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM THE TNS GROUP, AN OMEGA SYSTEMS COMPANY
***ACTION REQUIRED***
This is a friendly reminder about an upcoming update beginning the week of May 6th that impacts how you'll receive communications from us in the future.
Key takeaways:
All future communications will come from @ omegasystemscorp.com email addresses.
To ensure smooth delivery, please allowlist specific IP addresses (details included below) and keep a close eye on your spam folder.
Consider engaging with our emails (open and click links) to build trust with your inbox.
Full details and instructions were sent to you on 4/26 and are attached below for your reference.
Accounts,
As we proceed with integration and transition more systems and processes to Omega Systems, we want to share an update that will impact future communications like this one.
Beginning the week of May 6th, all legacy TNS corporate communications will be migrated to Omega Systems’ communication platforms. This includes:
All TNS-Omega integration updates
All marketing communications including customer newsletters, webinar invitations, etc.
TBR scheduling notifications & reminders
Other important news & updates including finance notifications, holiday closures, etc.
What does this mean for you?
To help ensure you don’t miss any future communications from the Omega Systems team, please review the following updates.
New Email Address: Corporate communications, including these integration updates, will no longer come from @ thetnsgroup.com email addresses and will come exclusively from @ omegasystemscorp.com .
Allowlist IP Addresses: Omega Systems uses Hubspot for all marketing and integration communications and has provided a list of all IPs that our emails from Hubspot may come from. If possible, please provide the following list to your IT team and request that they allowlist each in order to maximize your email deliverability rate:
139.180.17.0/24
141.193.184.128/25
141.193.184.32/27
141.193.184.64/26

Potential Spam Delivery: Of course, with any marketing communication system, there is a chance that emails might initially land in your spam folder. Please keep a close eye on your spam email and if you notice any Omega Systems communications, take immediate action to move them back to your inbox to ensure future delivery. It is also helpful to open and click links within our emails to help your inbox recognize our new address as trusted.
We are committed to a smooth transition and appreciate your understanding. As always, if you have any questions related to the above changes, please reach out to your account manager or contact our Service Desk with any technical assistance you might need.

Omega Systems, Technology Managed (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VWM0jG8gzfXQVYC8Yy7960XYW1PHNH55hYg9_N78Lwt-3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3nbW4lsw744T_qRtW5p2pRt7r6q3_W45F1hF4kpC0WW8FPdjy95Wlq6W7ld5L68x7xmpW77bb5v84_qz6W89ZvRw72-TNdW7KQf6W4yQSzxVnYQcd22DmNGW45Zx-q1ttJqNVVVbTR3yWWBDW61JL3X2rGhQBW1vTRxf4gMDKhW6_cY_G4xdvxFVhrC-l6Pn5SgW8ctJpT52qWWPW6RxN1b64VQ1cW6vnBvl3Y7BkjW3VqDr424CNXKW42ZfZs6C4h7DW26Wt5W4Nwk1jVvmczm1_wL-KW6YL_CD4cFmysW81j-y63RFBrmf6LrTWj04 )
| JULY 2024
NEW & NOTEWORTHY FROM OMEGA SYSTEMS
David,
Please take a few moments to review some of the content we’ve included in this month’s Omega Systems customer newsletter, and don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions or feedback.
In this issue:
- Trend Watch: Preparing for Windows 10 EOL
- Top 10 Risk Assessment Gaps + 10 Proactive Security Tips
- [Video Replay] Omega’s SOC Team Breaks Down Common Security Gaps
- Feature Spotlight: Smart Guard & EDR+
Thanks,
Erika
Trend Watch: Preparing for Windows 10 EOL
Our teams at Omega Systems are diligently reaching out to customers to begin preparing for Windows 10 end-of-life (EOL), which is approaching in 2025.
Utilizing EOL hardware and software can introduce significant concerns into your environment, which is why we want to ensure all Omega customers have properly upgraded their systems and infrastructure well in advance of the deadline. If you’re not familiar with EOL, the biggest repercussions you should be aware of include:
- Security risks due to lack of updates and patching;
- No technical support to correct bugs or issues; and
- Potential compatibility issues with other software/applications.
If you are still running Windows 10 on company workstations, you can expect to hear from your account manager in the coming weeks to discuss proactive transition plans.
Top 10 Security Assessment Gaps
The risk assessment process is a critical exercise used to identify potential weaknesses or vulnerabilities within your IT infrastructure, governance structure, or general security posture. Members of Omega’s Security Operations (SOC) team recently shared their unique perspective on risk assessments, revealing the 10 most common security gaps discovered during the assessment process – each of which can leave your organization vulnerable to cyber incidents.
- Gap #1: Lack of IT Security Governance
- Gap #2: No Tracking of Known Technology Risks
- Gap #3: Failure to Test Incident Response Plans/Conduct Tabletop Exercises
For the rest of the top 10 gaps and details on how to proactively address each before your next risk assessment, read our blog article (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VWM0jG8gzfXQVYC8Yy7960XYW1PHNH55hYg9_N78Lwt45m_5PW5BWr2F6lZ3lLW9jShD37-z08zW3P05Vj25YXgmW5l-bsk93LvxVVppBzq8XtQy-W3T9dxz93zz9SW7V6Wp76vGhjdW2lcpx73WGGw6N4MVG-cTbtyrW37ZJVV6cqlVpW2Fcfg27wSX4jW8_lB3n2cKs0zW2HJKL-3SmNfLW14C1h34dlQ2HW99f0MP80KCv8W1S52ng80SjkRW2Yy32x832HXXW7LzB9G3VGDG0W2K0H8D5cvx2FN8vfPwn-2Dk-N7Yd_8CP3X71W5gxJxf7FSqbFW39_QyJ2wp9f_W47Qk3G5QvGcvVC5X9Y6Cg6wwW2NLdK28H3BJgW5VSM4K27VY4nW8Srwny1JPDJbN2fzp_nr8WrTW7WXXs31sxhZqW7qJ3d32_ZfdgN39Zb846SgF7W8jLy-n1jgxW5W3-h4S96_DMq1W2r5qFl60c6v0f8yqJST04 ) .

Feature Spotlight: MDR & EDR
As Omega’s service portfolio continues to grow and evolve, we thought it might be helpful to share some of our favorite features from time to time. Because security is always on the brain, here are some cool features to check out within our MDR and EDR solutions.
Smart Guard (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VWM0jG8gzfXQVYC8Yy7960XYW1PHNH55hYg9_N78LwvT3prCCW95jsWP6lZ3nMW8JWvX27sJnJyW6kjy-Y30Yg1xN8tWwGvKvF-XW534GFY1HZkLRW2Ss__69hvlJkW6vjyc62xVCKZW2CZ_nF1VxZQcW5GS1Pc3RDkSlW1n4PCk1p4b3WW8lCwH01k_8dQW4NrBCz7zMS7nW4B6cJx2wncLNW4W0hq7887gRvW7tjJcj6PPvS4W28crp02byBq5W3001qV3MtlP0W5jvsLl8J3Cl2N95V8zFnHzLlW65lQxt2hVW39VTgY9088hLT_W1Z0Q6c4hrwBQW78pRRN48qWTQW3Ngdqy67SmC6N99_1WQmXxP1W45bSct4z70QHW61PbVG6MSys-W4t7GjH6JN8BQW8MLNPB5BjpwJW6p33kW39K73MW5tB9XC1fBNDmf6GHVCn04 )
Managed Detection & Response (MDR)
Traditional SIEM tools:
Log security events from firewalls; no visibility or integration with other tools or applications
Smart Guard MDR:
Uses a cloud-to-cloud API to collect logs from firewalls, email providers, SaaS applications & more (see a sample integration list here (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VWM0jG8gzfXQVYC8Yy7960XYW1PHNH55hYg9_N78LwsP5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3mBW1n3mL68by_Z0W6YdPZ_5KcrTzW41l_Wz6H50dPMNDdDnR413YW1nD63M63P01SW3GZ6Rq5Tbn3JW47DRv65cv1ktW7m7V-s2sbV8dW5lXTg92j0nkNW741QSM4PsYZqN6JGDDm2dy9jVtmFpV5tLJbYVVGbDr2kHgHNN8JqBF9tHFQvW2V7vzf2D6wXnW1QGn1c8kbVhhW74V7K01H_HKJW2cCxBQ9m2LJsW7jtWZz8RdmsnW86Xyr14jSb8gW2426jF8yKcxkW89TCjQ85TwkqW7pSNkX2Hm9n9W6Rv6B160-d-CW2z2N2D74N_YLW7qrhWz8VKBj_W4tWhmr10YwPnW4Kn_Cl3Kp3g6W8-vRw894xNhkW6vd2xG3mqFpmW2JgWv47ZgVh-W4HFTkS3rRkkRf1Q-kn-04 ) ) providing deeper security transparency & risk mitigation
EDR+ with AMTD (https://email.omegasystemscorp.com/e3t/Ctc/2O+113/d2MMPQ04/VWM0jG8gzfXQVYC8Yy7960XYW1PHNH55hYg9_N78Lwvz3prCCW8wLKSR6lZ3l_VNbZmk1XdDwnW3Nx0JY3ThhcHW2N--JM8kxdfFW6gcrxt2_vjflW7hpdL31HyBM_W79G0JD4b_qvqW5H0yRH2-3KctW1sqLBW3JCKtjW3cWq0c9fVrz3W5nVL0L2QBsMHW8RGgyz8n6Xd8W83WRYC8wHk6NW48qZmK3k4h33W7NlXyg9bctQxN9dqMTXlYBDpW8bK8mx5hXTKkV6rQ124XrtXHW8xyFLv73HV54W2XlHWK6Khsv0W3-mG9K7wTjQQW1Y6Sk86nXD5SV7h7n491FncLW4rm8kk75C8gdW8mRtM-3PJ7p5W1Fp2xz6--dnKVxYYHq61Lw8CN3d__SRmxN8hW7j0PqK7-Pzdyf1rgQKj04 )
Endpoint Detection & Response
Conventional EDR tools:
Use “known” signatures and behavioral patterns to identify potential threats (and thus only catch a percentage)
EDR + AMTD:
Detects and mitigates “unknown” threat signatures with next-gen technology that stops increasingly sophisticated and pervasive attacks

| JULY 2024
NEW & NOTEWORTHY FROM OMEGA SYSTEMS
David,
Please take a few moments to review some of the content we’ve included in this month’s Omega Systems customer newsletter, and don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions or feedback.
In this issue:
Trend Watch: Preparing for Windows 10 EOL
Top 10 Risk Assessment Gaps + 10 Proactive Security Tips
[Video Replay] Omega’s SOC Team Breaks Down Common Security Gaps
Feature Spotlight: Smart Guard & EDR+
Thanks,
Erika
Trend Watch: Preparing for Windows 10 EOL
Our teams at Omega Systems are diligently reaching out to customers to begin preparing for Windows 10 end-of-life (EOL), which is approaching in 2025.
Utilizing EOL hardware and software can introduce significant concerns into your environment, which is why we want to ensure all Omega customers have properly upgraded their systems and infrastructure well in advance of the deadline. If you’re not familiar with EOL, the biggest repercussions you should be aware of include:
Security risks due to lack of updates and patching;
No technical support to correct bugs or issues; and
Potential compatibility issues with other software/applications.
If you are still running Windows 10 on company workstations, you can expect to hear from your account manager in the coming weeks to discuss proactive transition plans.
Top 10 Security Assessment Gaps
The risk assessment process is a critical exercise used to identify potential weaknesses or vulnerabilities within your IT infrastructure, governance structure, or general security posture. Members of Omega’s Security Operations (SOC) team recently shared their unique perspective on risk assessments, revealing the 10 most common security gaps discovered during the assessment process – each of which can leave your organization vulnerable to cyber incidents.
Gap #1: Lack of IT Security Governance
Gap #2: No Tracking of Known Technology Risks
Gap #3: Failure to Test Incident Response Plans/Conduct Tabletop Exercises
For the rest of the top 10 gaps and details on how to proactively address each before your next risk assessment, read our blog article .
Video Replay: Risk Assessment Gaps & Best Practices
If you’d prefer to watch vs. read, check out the video replay from our webinar earlier this month. Maryne Robin and Kyle Phillips, two security and compliance consultants from Omega’s in-house SOC team, discussed the most common security gaps discovered during the cyber risk assessment process.
Watch On-Demand Video
Feature Spotlight: MDR & EDR
As Omega’s service portfolio continues to grow and evolve, we thought it might be helpful to share some of our favorite features from time to time. Because security is always on the brain, here are some cool features to check out within our MDR and EDR solutions.
Smart Guard
Managed Detection & Response (MDR)
Traditional SIEM tools:
Log security events from firewalls; no visibility or integration with other tools or applications
Smart Guard MDR:
Uses a cloud-to-cloud API to collect logs from firewalls, email providers, SaaS applications & more ( see a sample integration list here ) providing deeper security transparency & risk mitigation
EDR+ with AMTD
Endpoint Detection & Response
Conventional EDR tools:
Use “known” signatures and behavioral patterns to identify potential threats (and thus only catch a percentage)
EDR + AMTD:
Detects and mitigates “unknown” threat signatures with next-gen technology that stops increasingly sophisticated and pervasive attacks

}

}

Are you already familiar with Powerhouse's various building-management related systems and sensors? What technical access or integration does your system require? data level? application level? typical data flow characteristics? Steven and David,
Thank you for your emails, I appreciate it. With David speaking to Steve, we were able to make some changes in processes and protocol that will be beneficial.
In terms of the process for any outages, it goes to our Network Operations Center (NOC) first and it is escalated to a TAM, as needed. Steve and David discussed this on their call.
If there are any further issues/concerns, please let me know.
David, I will send today’s meeting notes no later than first thing in the morning due to back-to-back meetings.
Warm regards, Erika

[Omega-Systems-EDR-and-AMTD]
From: David Koosis >
Sent: Tuesday, May 28, 2024 1:20 PM
To: Erika Ellis >; Steven Battaglia >
Cc: Daniel Lucas >; Julia Margaret Lu >
Subject: Cogent outage / Omega response
CAUTION: This email originated from outside your organization. Exercise caution when opening attachments or clicking links, especially from unknown senders.
Overview
* Erika, Elvin (her supervisor) and I debriefed earlier today on the Cogent outage and our response.
* Meraki WiFi access points started throwing alerts about 5pm Monday. Presumably other alerts we put in place to monitor Powerhouse's internet connection also fired off. Omega determined that Cogent, our primary provider, suffered an outage which impacted many customers in our area.
* At the time of the Cogent outage, the automatic failover kicked in successfully, and Powerhouse switched to Brooklyn Fiber.
* However, there were shortcomings in communication. The status of the network, and the fact that we were up and running on our secondary almost immediately, was not clear, which led to confusion. This caused us to misinform employees, asking them to work remotely. When failover is setup, it should always failover to the 2nd ISP. In this case, we should have closed that loop and confirmed that the secondary line was up so there were no issues on the Powerhouse side. This was reviewed and discussed during our debrief.
Action Items
1. The security desk phone number is 718-354-8623. Please ask Elvin to add it to your response protocol in case the network team needs to check if power or WiFi is functioning off hours. We met with members of our Global team and our team will contact the security desk team for “Hands onsite” or other as needed.
2. I will coordinate internally to ensure security team is briefed. (@Erika Ellis - can you connect with Julia directly on #1 above, and to tell her how Security should alert Omega if they notice the WiFi is down off hours) @Julia – to reach the support desk for any issues, please contact:
· 212-967-5757, Option 2 or 203-316-0112, Option 2
· Support@thetnsgroup.com
· Call my cell at 203-981-8902 (to escalate/other)
1. Assess the communication breakdown that occurred and propose fix. (Why was it not clear to everyone that we were up and running on our secondary by Mon evening?) Elvin proposed some ideas about this. Ideally, I would have liked a call -- at any time 24/7 -- informing me that the network failed over to secondary and is working; and Omega is engaged with Cogent/Verizon and will update.
· David, you will continue to receive the alerts as the POC. Per our call, we informed our team to call you directly for any issues that impacts the building or an employee’s inability to work due to an outage, Wi-Fi down, etc. through proactive monitoring
Let's take a second to acknowledge the network failover worked as designed. That is excellent.
Thank you
/dk
--
David Koosis (he/him)
v Chief Technology Officer (consultant)
Powerhouse Arts / Tue-Thu
direct 646.481.4141

Overview
* Erika, Elvin (her supervisor) and I debriefed earlier today on the Cogent outage and our response.
* Meraki WiFi access points started throwing alerts about 5pm Monday. Presumably other alerts we put in place to monitor Powerhouse's internet connection also fired off. Omega determined that Cogent, our primary provider, suffered an outage which impacted many customers in our area.
* At the time of the Cogent outage, the automatic failover kicked in successfully, and Powerhouse switched to Brooklyn Fiber.
* However, there were shortcomings in communication. The status of the network, and the fact that we were up and running on our secondary almost immediately, was not clear, which led to confusion. This caused us to misinform employees, asking them to work remotely. When failover is setup, it should always failover to the 2nd ISP. In this case, we should have closed that loop and confirmed that the secondary line was up so there were no issues on the Powerhouse side. This was reviewed and discussed during our debrief.
Action Items
1. The security desk phone number is 718-354-8623. Please ask Elvin to add it to your response protocol in case the network team needs to check if power or WiFi is functioning off hours. We met with members of our Global team and our team will contact the security desk team for “Hands onsite” or other as needed.

1. Assess the communication breakdown that occurred and propose fix. (Why was it not clear to everyone that we were up and running on our secondary by Mon evening?) Elvin proposed some ideas about this. Ideally, I would have liked a call -- at any time 24/7 -- informing me that the network failed over to secondary and is working; and Omega is engaged with Cogent/Verizon and will update.

Subject: Cogent outage / Omega response

*Overview*
- Erika, Elvin (her supervisor) and I debriefed earlier today on the
Cogent outage and our response.
- Meraki WiFi access points started throwing alerts about 5pm Monday.
Presumably other alerts we put in place to monitor Powerhouse's internet
connection also fired off. Omega determined that Cogent, our primary
provider, suffered an outage which impacted many customers in our area.
- At the time of the Cogent outage, the automatic failover kicked in
successfully, and Powerhouse switched to Brooklyn Fiber.
- However, there were shortcomings in communication. The status of the
network, and the fact that we were up and running on our secondary almost
immediately, was not clear, which led to confusion. This caused us to
misinform employees, asking them to work remotely
*Action Items*
1. The security desk phone number is 718-354-8623. Please ask Elvin to
add it to your response protocol in case the network team needs to check if
power or WiFi is functioning off hours.
2. I will coordinate internally to ensure security team is briefed. (@Erika
Ellis - can you connect with Julia
directly on #1 above, and to tell her how Security should alert Omega if
they notice the WiFi is down off hours)
3. Assess the communication breakdown that occurred and propose fix.
(Why was it not clear to everyone that we were up and running on our
secondary by Mon evening?) Elvin proposed some ideas about this. Ideally, I
would have liked a call -- at any time 24/7 -- informing me that the
network failed over to secondary, and is working; and Omega is engaged with
Cogent/Verizon and will update.
Let's take a second to acknowledge the network failover worked as designed.
That is excellent.
Thank you
/dk

From: Ubejd Shaqiri <ubejdshaqiri@kodelabs.com>
To: vcto@powerhousearts.org
Date: 2024-01-04 15:11:28
Subject: Accepted: Technical walk thru of Kode Labs network requirements @ Thu
 2024-01-04 11am - 11:50am (EST) (vcto@powerhousearts.org)

Ubejd Shaqiri has accepted this invitation.
Technical walk thru of Kode Labs network requirements
Thursday 2024-01-04 ⋅ 11am – 11:50am
Eastern Time - New York
Location
https://bit.ly/dskzoom
https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Fdskzoom&sa=D&ust=1704813060000000&usg=AOvVaw194QKDHT2t2E0qihwdcZZk
Attachments
KODE Labs - Reverse Proxy Connectivity Approach.pdf https://drive.google.com/open?id=1FribD663Lm0FC9TzODZkS6-j4ERbRDPD&authuser=1
Notes - Technical walk thru of Kode Labs network requirements https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-hRba58k8Bs5JkSSDS1PI1tT9lXh2wXu6sv2j_7o8dY/edit
Upon kick-off of the project:1) Reverse Proxy Agent Installation- Our team will require 1 hour with your IT technician to install the reverse proxy server. This can be accomplished during the meeting. - The server requirements for hosting the reverse proxy agent are listed on the last page of the attached document.- The dependency is that this is hosted on a Windows or Linux server with access to the internet (Ports 443, TCP Port 7844, and UDP Port 7845)2) Aggregation Server (Niagara) Installation- Once the Reverse Proxy Agent is installed, we will need to install Niagara to operate as the aggregation server for the site. - This can be hosted on the same, or different, available server on the network that has a network connection to the reverse proxy agent (from Step 1) and the EnteliWEB server.- Our proposal includes performing the installation of the Aggregation Server and the discovery of all BACnet points on the network. - Server requirements for Niagara can be found here: Niagara Server RequirementsBoth steps are dependent upon having a local server(s) which can host both the Reverse Proxy Agent and the Aggregation Server software.
Organizer
vcto@powerhousearts.org
vcto@powerhousearts.org
Guests
vcto@powerhousearts.org - organizer
Sovran Berisha
rnieves@thetnsgroup.com
Ubejd Shaqiri
Nick Theoret

Technical walk thru of Kode Labs network requirements Ubejd Shaqiri has accepted this invitation. Attachments KODE Labs - Reverse Pr... Notes - Technical walk... Upon kick-off of the project: 1) Reverse Proxy Agent Installation - Our team will require 1 hour with your IT technician to install the reverse proxy server. This can be accomplished during the meeting. - The server requirements for hosting the reverse proxy agent are listed on the last page of the attached document. - The dependency is that this is hosted on a Windows or Linux server with access to the internet (Ports 443, TCP Port 7844, and UDP Port 7845) 2) Aggregation Server (Niagara) Installation - Once the Reverse Proxy Agent is installed, we will need to install Niagara to operate as the aggregation server for the site. - This can be hosted on the same, or different, available server on the network that has a network connection to the reverse proxy agent (from Step 1) and the EnteliWEB server. - Our proposal includes performing the installation of the Aggregation Server and the discovery of all BACnet points on the network. - Server requirements for Niagara can be found here: Niagara Server Requirements Both steps are dependent upon having a local server(s) which can host both the Reverse Proxy Agent and the Aggregation Server software. When Thursday 2024-01-04 ⋅ 11am – 11:50am (Eastern Time - New York) Location https://bit.ly/dskzoom View map Guests vcto@powerhousearts.org - organizer Sovran Berisha rnieves@thetnsgroup.com Ubejd Shaqiri Nick Theoret View all guest info Invitation from Google Calendar

Hi all,
Below is the agenda for tomorrow's meeting. We do have a hard stop at 5 pm tomorrow.
Please let me know if you have any questions, additions and/or concerns. Looking forward to our call.
Warm regards, Erika
Powerhouse Agenda
* S/W, H/W Reporting status
* Brightgauge Ticket and Inventory (Addigy) Reporting
* POM status for Door Aps
* OS Upgrades, specifically Macs in Print Shop that are out of compliance (O/S not upgraded and not getting security updates and low storage space)
* Status of Software updates
* Yarisbeth/HR submissions for builds
* Contacts for TNS
* Support, Account Manager, other
* Building
* Wyze Camera per Mitch request - requires hard wire or AP
* Service Ticket #5226123 - Mitch with Kode Labs
* Security concerns with additions to the network
* Network Questions
* Powerhouse is an unusual office structure with lots of metal and 3-foot-thick concrete walls, so I imagine Wi-Fi performance is different from a typical corporate office. Do you have a sense, or have we ever done a walkaround mapping, of the overall Wi-Fi penetration around the whole building? Pretty strong? Any dead spots?
* I see some spots like at the front door where we've got two AP's right nearby each other. I think that predates your tenure, but do you have any idea if that was done for a particular reason?
* Do we use 2.4 as well as 5 ghz, and can you educate me as to whether that makes any meaningful difference in a space like Powerhouse?
* Are the motion sensors and locks and so on riding WiFi? Could we partition those small-payload long-distance things to 2.4?
* Is Meraki mesh, and can you educate me whether that makes any meaningful difference in a space like Powerhouse?
* Tickets:
* Service Ticket #5232506 - Re: No Wifi at the Gatehouse
* Service Ticket #5201123 - Salesforce Login
* Ticket Process
* Escalation via AM
* Submit tickets prior to Dan going onsite so we can prioritize

Network Questions
Powerhouse is an unusual office structure with lots of metal and 3-foot-thick concrete walls, so I imagine Wi-Fi performance is different from a typical corporate office. Do you have a sense, or have we ever done a walkaround mapping, of the overall Wi-Fi penetration
around the whole building? Pretty strong? Any dead spots?
I see some spots like at the front door where we've got two AP's right nearby each other. I think that predates your tenure, but do you have any idea if that was done for a particular reason?

Hi Steven,
All is well and I hope you are all staying warm. Yes, this does apply to Powerhouse.
Per our testing, we do not anticipate any disruption to Powerhouse or any clients during this process. N-central, Omega’s Remote Monitoring Management (RMM) tool will be rolled out in the background. To date, we have not seen any interruptions or concerns in testing environments.
In our doing so, it will allow this tool to sit side by side of TNS’ RMM tool so we can ensure that RMM is working with N-Central prior to TNS removing our RMM tool (ConnectWise Automate).
Please let me know if you have any further questions or want to discuss.
Many thanks, Erika

From: Erika Ellis >
Date: Tue, Feb 13, 2024 at 10:00 AM
Subject: TNS-Omega Integration Update: Remote Monitoring Changes
To: >
[image]
AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM THE TNS GROUP, AN OMEGA SYSTEMS COMPANY
Steven,
As part of The TNS Group’s continued integration with Omega Systems, we have started the process of mapping out integrations for customer software and toolsets, including the migration of remote monitoring and management (RMM) platforms.
In the coming weeks, Omega will be transitioning TNS customers from Automate to N-Central for RMM services.
During this process, we will be deploying a new agent to your workstations and servers in conjunction with our existing agent to ensure all assets are accounted for during the migration. The existing agent will continue to provide monitoring, patching and remote support until a cutover date for your network is established. As part of the process, our migration team will be auditing your network to ensure all devices have been accounted for and transitioned properly to our new platform.
The N-Central RMM platform has several key features including patching, reporting and automation which will directly benefit you as an Omega customer. If you have access to your current RMM platform (Automate), we will provision access to your new RMM platform (N-Central) following the migration and schedule a personalized training session to share the new features with you.
You will also receive a communication in the near future regarding upcoming patch schedules and an overview of new alerts and reports which will be available to you as part of the N-Central platform.
Please keep an eye out for further communications, including a specific migration/cutover date. In the meantime, if you have any questions, please reach out to your account manager for more information.
Best Regards,
All of us at The TNS Group, an Omega Systems company
For 24x7 Customer Support:
Connecticut
(203) 316-0112
New York
(212) 967-5757
Massachusetts/RI

Hi Steven,
All is well and I hope you are all staying warm. Yes, this does apply to Powerhouse.
Per our testing, we do not anticipate any disruption to Powerhouse or any clients during this process. N-central, Omega’s Remote Monitoring Management (RMM) tool will be rolled out in the background. To date, we have not seen any interruptions or concerns in testing environments.
In our doing so, it will allow this tool to sit side by side of TNS’ RMM tool so we can ensure that RMM is working with N-Central prior to TNS removing our RMM tool (ConnectWise Automate).
Please let me know if you have any further questions or want to discuss.
Many thanks, Erika

From: Erika Ellis >
Date: Tue, Feb 13, 2024 at 10:00 AM
Subject: TNS-Omega Integration Update: Remote Monitoring Changes
To: >
[image]
AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM THE TNS GROUP, AN OMEGA SYSTEMS COMPANY
Steven,
As part of The TNS Group’s continued integration with Omega Systems, we have started the process of mapping out integrations for customer software and toolsets, including the migration of remote monitoring and management (RMM) platforms.
In the coming weeks, Omega will be transitioning TNS customers from Automate to N-Central for RMM services.
During this process, we will be deploying a new agent to your workstations and servers in conjunction with our existing agent to ensure all assets are accounted for during the migration. The existing agent will continue to provide monitoring, patching and remote support until a cutover date for your network is established. As part of the process, our migration team will be auditing your network to ensure all devices have been accounted for and transitioned properly to our new platform.
The N-Central RMM platform has several key features including patching, reporting and automation which will directly benefit you as an Omega customer. If you have access to your current RMM platform (Automate), we will provision access to your new RMM platform (N-Central) following the migration and schedule a personalized training session to share the new features with you.
You will also receive a communication in the near future regarding upcoming patch schedules and an overview of new alerts and reports which will be available to you as part of the N-Central platform.
Please keep an eye out for further communications, including a specific migration/cutover date. In the meantime, if you have any questions, please reach out to your account manager for more information.
Best Regards,
All of us at The TNS Group, an Omega Systems company
For 24x7 Customer Support:
Connecticut
(203) 316-0112
New York
(212) 967-5757
Massachusetts/RI

Subject: Re: Following Up: Powerhouse Arts x zkipster

Hi Megan,
Thanks for your call yesterday to confirm the details and next steps. As
discussed, please find a quote for the Professional level plan for
$3,771.45. You'll see I've applied our 15% non-profit discount to this
quote as well. For efficiency, I've also included an invoice for this plan.
Let me know if you have any questions or need adjustments made on either.
Attached please also find the complete vendor form and our W8BENE (we
provide this in place of the W9, as we are a Swiss-based company).
Just confirming here in writing that when you are ready, you can begin a
separate trial and testing period of the API using a zkipster sandbox
account. This will allow you to continue using zkipster for events in your
main account, without an impact from test API calls. If/when you are ready
to move forward with using the API to automate workflows, we will prorate
the upgrade costs according to the days remaining on your existing
subscription.
Let me know if there is anything else you need at the moment.
All the best,
Michala

understand how you currently organize your data and what event information
is relevant to send to and from zkipster. A few key questions to discuss
together would be:

data) and how will that data get into zkipster?
- What is your team structure in terms of owning steps in the process of
cultivating event data
- How quickly would you like the zkipster integration to be up and running?

we get in the discussion and answer any other initial questions you have
and schedule a follow up call next week, if needed. Talk soon!

From: Salesforce Support Response [customersupport@salesforce.com]
Sent: 3/4/2024 7:03 AM
To: vcto@powerhousearts.org
Cc: juliat@powerhousearts.org
Subject: RE: Can't create new opportunities in Salesforce [ ref:!00D300XsfG.!500Hx0RBUeL:ref ]
Hi Julia,
Good day!
Thank you for your patience. Hope this message finds you well.
After thorough investigation, and ruling out all the limitations in adding the field buttons. It appears that “New Opportunity” action needs to be added to the lighting page highlight panel in order to appear on the opportunity page.
I believe mentioned below workaround will result in achieving the expected results. Please let me if you face any difficulties from your end and let me know your availability for a screen share session on 03/04 or tomorrow, so that we can resolve it at the earliest.
Steps to achieve the workaround:
1. Open any opportunity record
2. Click on the clog Icon → Edit page
3. Select Highlight panel
4.Click on "Upgrade now" under "upgrade to dynamic actions" section on the right side panel.
5.Select Migrate and click on Next
6.Select the respective page layout and select Finish.
7.Click on Add Action and select "New Opportunity" and click Done
8. Now rearrange the order as needed and click on Save
If you have any questions or wish to share any information, please feel free to approach us via case comments or emails. We are committed to ensuring a prompt and satisfactory resolution for you.
Thanks & Regards,
Vamshi Rammadugu
Technical Support Engineer | Salesforce
Available hours: M - F, 9:00 am - 5:00 pm EST
From: David Koosis [vcto@powerhousearts.org]
Sent: 3/2/2024 1:37 PM

Cc: juliat@powerhousearts.org

Hello Vamshi
I've granted you full access to our salesforce instance under vcto@powerhousearts.org
The problem we're having is that Julia Tolo (copied) is unable to create Opportunities -- the option is not visible when she goes to a contact she has created.
Thank you for your assistance.

Hi Julia,
Thank you for the response.
I logged to your organization and tried to find the troubleshoot in resolving this issue.
However, as you don't have enough access to page layouts and lighting app builder edit page it is hindering me from investigating this issue further, could you please help us in granting the login as an admin with your salesforce admin's help.
Steps need to be performed by your admin to provide login access to salesforce support:
a. Click Avatar/Profile | Settings | My Personal Information | Grant Login Access.
b. Set the access expiration date for salesforce.com support (1 week)
c. Click Save
If you have any questions or wish to share any information, please feel free to approach us via case comments or emails. We are committed to ensuring a prompt and satisfactory resolution for you.

After thorough investigation, and ruling out all the limitations in adding the field buttons. It appears that “New Opportunity” action needs to be added to the lighting page highlight panel in order to appear on the opportunity page.
I believe mentioned below workaround will result in achieving the expected results. Please let me if you face any difficulties from your end and let me know your availability for a screen share session on 03/04 or tomorrow, so that we can resolve it at the earliest.
Steps to achieve the workaround:
1. Open any opportunity record
2. Click on the clog Icon → Edit page
3. Select Highlight panel
4.Click on "Upgrade now" under "upgrade to dynamic actions" section on the right side panel.
5.Select Migrate and click on Next
6.Select the respective page layout and select Finish.
7.Click on Add Action and select "New Opportunity" and click Done
8. Now rearrange the order as needed and click on Save

Good day!
Thank you for your patience. Hope this message finds you well.
After thorough investigation, and ruling out all the limitations in adding the field buttons. It appears that “New Opportunity” action needs to be added to the lighting page highlight panel in order to appear on the opportunity page.
I believe mentioned below workaround will result in achieving the expected results. Please let me if you face any difficulties from your end and let me know your availability for a screen share session on 03/04 or tomorrow, so that we can resolve it at the earliest.
Steps to achieve the workaround:
1. Open any opportunity record
2. Click on the clog Icon → Edit page
3. Select Highlight panel
4.Click on "Upgrade now" under "upgrade to dynamic actions" section on the right side panel.
5.Select Migrate and click on Next
6.Select the respective page layout and select Finish.
7.Click on Add Action and select "New Opportunity" and click Done
8. Now rearrange the order as needed and click on Save
If you have any questions or wish to share any information, please feel free to approach us via case comments or emails. We are committed to ensuring a prompt and satisfactory resolution for you.
Thanks & Regards,
Vamshi Rammadugu
Technical Support Engineer | Salesforce
Available hours: M - F, 9:00 am - 5:00 pm EST

Hi Julia,

I logged to your organization and tried to find the troubleshoot in resolving this issue.
However, as you don't have enough access to page layouts and lighting app builder edit page it is hindering me from investigating this issue further, could you please help us in granting the login as an admin with your salesforce admin's help.
Steps need to be performed by your admin to provide login access to salesforce support:
a. Click Avatar/Profile | Settings | My Personal Information | Grant Login Access.
b. Set the access expiration date for salesforce.com support (1 week)
c. Click Save

Hi Julia,
Good day!
Thank you for your patience. Hope this message finds you well.
After thorough investigation, and ruling out all the limitations in adding the field buttons. It appears that “New Opportunity” action needs to be added to the lighting page highlight panel in order to appear on the opportunity page.
I believe mentioned below workaround will result in achieving the expected results. Please let me if you face any difficulties from your end and let me know your availability for a screen share session on 03/04 or tomorrow, so that we can resolve it at the earliest.
Steps to achieve the workaround:
1. Open any opportunity record
2. Click on the clog Icon → Edit page
3. Select Highlight panel
4.Click on "Upgrade now" under "upgrade to dynamic actions" section on the right side panel.
5.Select Migrate and click on Next
6.Select the respective page layout and select Finish.
7.Click on Add Action and select "New Opportunity" and click Done
8. Now rearrange the order as needed and click on Save
If you have any questions or wish to share any information, please feel free to approach us via case comments or emails. We are committed to ensuring a prompt and satisfactory resolution for you.
Thanks & Regards,
Vamshi Rammadugu

On Mon, 4 Mar 2024 at 11:40, David Koosis wrote: That seems responsive. I'll be in tomorrow and happy to lend a hand. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Salesforce Support Response Date: Mon, Mar 4, 2024, 10:03 AM Subject: RE: Can't create new opportunities in Salesforce [ ref:!00D300XsfG.!500Hx0RBUeL:ref ] To: vcto@powerhousearts.org Cc: juliat@powerhousearts.org
Hi Julia,
Good day!
Thank you for your patience. Hope this message finds you well.
After thorough investigation, and ruling out all the limitations in adding the field buttons. It appears that “New Opportunity” action needs to be added to the lighting page highlight panel in order to appear on the opportunity page.
I believe mentioned below workaround will result in achieving the expected results. Please let me if you face any difficulties from your end and let me know your availability for a screen share session on 03/04 or tomorrow, so that we can resolve it at the earliest.
Steps to achieve the workaround:
1. Open any opportunity record
2. Click on the clog Icon → Edit page
3. Select Highlight panel
4.Click on "Upgrade now" under "upgrade to dynamic actions" section on the right side panel.
5.Select Migrate and click on Next
6.Select the respective page layout and select Finish.
7.Click on Add Action and select "New Opportunity" and click Done
8. Now rearrange the order as needed and click on Save
If you have any questions or wish to share any information, please feel free to approach us via case comments or emails. We are committed to ensuring a prompt and satisfactory resolution for you.
Thanks & Regards,
Vamshi Rammadugu
Technical Support Engineer | Salesforce
Available hours: M - F, 9:00 am - 5:00 pm EST
==========

After thorough investigation, and ruling out all the limitations in adding

added to the lighting page highlight panel in order to appear on the
opportunity page.
I believe mentioned below workaround will result in achieving the expected
results. Please let me if you face any difficulties from your end and let
me know your availability for a screen share session on 03/04 or tomorrow,
so that we can resolve it at the earliest.
*Steps to achieve the workaround:*
1. Open any opportunity record
2. Click on the clog Icon → Edit page
[image: Image_2024-03-04_09-56-10.png]

[image: Image_2024-03-04_09-58-58.png]

right side panel.
5.Select Migrate and click on Next
[image: Image_2024-03-04_09-59-32.png]
6.Select the respective page layout and select Finish.
7.Click on Add Action and select "New Opportunity" and click Done
[image: Image_2024-03-04_09-59-51.png]

I believe mentioned below workaround will result in achieving the expected results. Please let me if you face any difficulties from your end and let me know your availability for a screen share session on 03/04 or tomorrow, so that we can resolve it at the earliest.

1. Open any opportunity record
2. Click on the clog Icon → Edit page
3. Select Highlight panel
4.Click on "Upgrade now" under "upgrade to dynamic actions" section on the right side panel.
5.Select Migrate and click on Next
6.Select the respective page layout and select Finish.
7.Click on Add Action and select "New Opportunity" and click Done
8. Now rearrange the order as needed and click on Save

I trust this message finds you in good health. My name is Vamshi, and I have taken the ownership of your case: 46433046. I am your dedicated point of contact for the upcoming steps, and I am more than happy to assist you.
Upon a thorough review of the case details, I find that I may require additional clarification to fully understand your specific requirements. We see that the issue is in the production org. Could you please provide the login access to Salesforce Support on the Org which you needs the work around?
To grant login access, please follow the below steps
a. Click Avatar/Profile | Settings | My Personal Information | Grant Login Access.
b. Set the access expiration date for salesforce.com support (1 week)
c. Click Save
Schedule a Screen Sharing Session:
I propose arranging a Google meeting to conduct a screen sharing session. Kindly inform me of your availability so that we can schedule a session. This will allow me to comprehensively understand the issue and gather all necessary details to propose a suitable solution.
To aid you in the meantime, I have identified some related knowledge articles about the workaround. Please feel free to review them at your convenience, as they may contain valuable information:
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.lightning_app_builder_customize_lex_pages.htm&type=5

On Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 7:46 PM Julia Margaret Lu wrote: Good Afternoon Colleagues, Over the past few weeks there have been some conflicts with visitors at the gatehouse on why they are being detained when this didn't happen before. In the past the gatehouse security guards were not doing their jobs and they were just letting everybody through. Mitch and I have been cracking down on security to keep everyone and our facility safe. To reduce the conflicts at the gatehouse for visitors please see the security protocols for guests, vendors, and special deliveries: There are 2 ways for vehicular guests to gain access to Powerhouse Arts: 1. Email the security team in advance at group_security@powerhousearts.org and state the following : Name of the person Date and time expected Include parking accommodations (Garage or Forecourt) The security team will see this email and grant access to the visitor when they arrive. 2. Unannounced/unexpected visitors: If a guest shows up at the gatehouse the security protocol is to ask them for a contact person. The security team has a staff list with phone numbers for Powerhouse Arts, Workspace 11, Alpha Workshops, and Manhattan Graphics Center. The gatehouse security guard will call that person to verify if they should be granted access to the Powerhouse Arts building. Please share this protocol with your guests, vendors and for deliveries. Additionally, please provide a backup contact if you potentially might not be available and be mindful that if you do not answer your phone from the security team there could be a delay. If the security team isn't able to connect with the contact person then they will then be required to contact the engineering department so they can then find the contact person. As a reminder, visitors and visiting artists may request parking, but Ceramics members are limited to Forecourt parking only when loading and unloading. THANK YOU for your continued cooperation and dedication to keeping Powerhouse safe :) Please email Mitch and I directly if you have any questions/concerns. - Julia + Mitch -- Julia Margaret Lu (she/her) Operations Manager Powerhouse Arts Find a time to meet with Julia julia@powerhousearts.org cell (917) 304 9528 322 Third Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11215 www.powerhousearts.org
--

=== EMAIL START ===
From: Luther Davis <luther@powerhousearts.org>
To: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-08-01 22:40:50
Subject: Re: Vehicle Access at PHA: Visitors, Gatehouse, Parking

David, the context is that the new security measures means the gatehouse
staff have to reach the printshop. I cannot be the sole vibrating pocket on
my cell phone.
Our 4th floor shop phones do not ring simultaneously. They aren’t loud
enough to hear if the equipment is running. If you are at one end of the
shop and hear the phone you have to stop production and run to get the
phone. You may not reach it before it goes to voicemail.
Previously the security measures allowed our guest to enter the building or
forecourt and reach us when we had a delay in production via AEC or the
forecourt security. With this new system they are stuck at the gatehouse
until they can reach us by phone. For guests on foot this means they are
stuck in the rain or snow or sweltering heat. For trucks that means 1st St
is backed up until we can be reached.
Our shop phones aren’t adequate to this task which means we will have to
have a flow chart of personal mobile extensions to fill the gap.
On Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 10:19 PM David Koosis
wrote:
David, the context is that the new security measures means the gatehouse staff have to reach the printshop. I cannot be the sole vibrating pocket on my cell phone. Our 4th floor shop phones do not ring simultaneously. They aren’t loud enough to hear if the equipment is running. If you are at one end of the shop and hear the phone you have to stop production and run to get the phone. You may not reach it before it goes to voicemail. Previously the security measures allowed our guest to enter the building or forecourt and reach us when we had a delay in production via AEC or the forecourt security. With this new system they are stuck at the gatehouse until they can reach us by phone. For guests on foot this means they are stuck in the rain or snow or sweltering heat. For trucks that means 1st St is backed up until we can be reached. Our shop phones aren’t adequate to this task which means we will have to have a flow chart of personal mobile extensions to fill the gap. On Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 10:19 PM David Koosis wrote: Don't have all the context here, Luther, but generally what's the best way to alert you? Loud ring Flashing sign (like for hearing impaired alarms) Vibrating phone in pocket Lemme know if you have thoughts On Thu, Aug 1, 2024, 4:16 PM Luther Davis wrote: We have a second line that unfortunately has a different extension. Neither phone is loud enough to hear, at their highest level, when all the equipment is running. They ring just enough times so that if I can take off my PPE and sprint the length of the building I might be able to pick up before it goes to voice mail. The phone on the west/Gowanus side makes a nice little song that sounds charming but not a true ring like a phone. On Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 9:56 PM Julia Margaret Lu wrote: Hi TNS Group (Omega?) Is there an Omega email we should be addressing? Can you add a second phone to the 4th floor print shop (same number as the existing print shop phone) on the West side of the floor with the volume set to the highest setting so Luther can hear it over the machines? Let us know what you need from us to do so. Thanks! ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Julia Margaret Lu Date: Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 3:52 PM Subject: Re: Vehicle Access at PHA: Visitors, Gatehouse, Parking To: Luther Davis Cc: Mitch Roth Hi Luther, thanks for sharing your concerns while on vacation, and I'm sorry you can't hear the phone across the room. 1, we should add a second phone to the other end of the print shop so you can be alerted when visitors and deliveries have arrived. I'll push this to IT/Omega (fka TNS) 2, you can cc group_security when scheduling visits 3, you can also call the security desk to let them know you are expecting a visitor so that they are not turned away We don't want to make this more difficult for you! Flagging things like the phone being too far away are easily solved, and we should build tools/systems that make everything easier for your workflow. Julia On Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 3:40 PM Luther Davis wrote: What happens when they go up 2nd St? I have concerns because… 1. This now requires an extra 600 to 700 emails a year for the printshop 2. A telephone call means someone needs to stop fabricating, wash their hands or take off their PPE to answer a phone and they have to do it in the incredibly short amount of time that our phone system rings. Before I left Mitch tried to call the printshop repeatedly but we couldn’t hear him over the machines. He never reached me or the printshop staff and our delivery agent had to call tour customer and they had to send and email to reach us. I appreciate you trying to get the gate house to do their job. However I feel this approach is flawed and now has me running the full length of the build to reach a phone that I can barely hear and that I will always have to have my cellphone on me or stand by it while it’s being charged. If this is going to work I will need a permanent fix to the flawed our phone system. Yes I am on vacation and that’s how much I care about this issue. L On Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 8:46 PM Julia Margaret Lu wrote: Good Afternoon Colleagues, Over the past few weeks there have been some conflicts with visitors at the gatehouse on why they are being detained when this didn't happen before. Mitch and I have been cracking down on security to keep everyone and our facility safe. To reduce the conflicts at the gatehouse for visitors please see the security protocols for guests, vendors, and special deliveries: There are 2 ways for vehicular guests to gain access to Powerhouse Arts: 1. Email the security team in advance at group_security@powerhousearts.org and state the following : Name of the person Date and time expected Include parking accommodations (Garage or Forecourt) The security team will see this email and grant access to the visitor when they arrive. 2. Unannounced/unexpected visitors: If a guest shows up at the gatehouse the security protocol is to ask them for a contact person. The security team has a staff list with phone numbers for Powerhouse Arts, Workspace 11, Alpha Workshops, and Manhattan Graphics Center. The gatehouse security guard will call that person to verify if they should be granted access to the Powerhouse Arts building. Please share this protocol with your guests, vendors and for deliveries. Additionally, please provide a backup contact if you potentially might not be available and be mindful that if you do not answer your phone from the security team there could be a delay. If the security team isn't able to connect with the contact person then they will then be required to contact the engineering department so they can then find the contact person. As a reminder, visitors and visiting artists may request parking, but Ceramics members are limited to Forecourt parking only when loading and unloading. From: Luther Davis <luther@powerhousearts.org>
To: Julia Margaret Lu <julia@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-08-01 22:16:19
Subject: Re: Vehicle Access at PHA: Visitors, Gatehouse, Parking

We have a second line that unfortunately has a different extension. Neither
phone is loud enough to hear, at their highest level, when all the
equipment is running. They ring just enough times so that if I can take
off my PPE and sprint the length of the building I might be able to pick up
before it goes to voice mail. The phone on the west/Gowanus side makes a
nice little song that sounds charming but not a true ring like a phone.
On Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 9:56 PM Julia Margaret Lu
wrote:
We have a second line that unfortunately has a different extension. Neither phone is loud enough to hear, at their highest level, when all the equipment is running. They ring just enough times so that if I can take off my PPE and sprint the length of the building I might be able to pick up before it goes to voice mail. The phone on the west/Gowanus side makes a nice little song that sounds charming but not a true ring like a phone. On Thu, Aug 1, 2024 at 9:56 PM Julia Margaret Lu wrote: Hi TNS Group (Omega?) Is there an Omega email we should be addressing? Can you add a second phone to the 4th floor print shop (same number as the existing print shop phone) on the West side of the floor with the volume set to the highest setting so Luther can hear it over the machines? Let us know what you need from us to do so. Before I left Mitch tried to call the printshop repeatedly but we couldn’t hear him over the machines. To reduce the conflicts at the gatehouse for visitors please see the security protocols for guests, vendors, and special deliveries: There are 2 ways for vehicular guests to gain access to Powerhouse Arts: 1. Email the security team in advance at group_security@powerhousearts.org and state the following : Name of the person Date and time expected Include parking accommodations (Garage or Forecourt) The security team will see this email and grant access to the visitor when they arrive. 2. Unannounced/unexpected visitors: If a guest shows up at the gatehouse the security protocol is to ask them for a contact person. The security team has a staff list with phone numbers for Powerhouse Arts, Workspace 11, Alpha Workshops, and Manhattan Graphics Center. The gatehouse security guard will call that person to verify if they should be granted access to the Powerhouse Arts building. Please share this protocol with your guests, vendors and for deliveries. Additionally, please provide a backup contact if you potentially might not be available and be mindful that if you do not answer your phone from the security team there could be a delay. If the security team isn't able to connect with the contact person then they will then be required to contact the engineering department so they can then find the contact person. As a reminder, visitors and visiting artists may request parking, but Ceramics members are limited to Forecourt parking only when loading and unloading. The security team has a staff list with phone numbers for Powerhouse Arts, Workspace 11, Alpha Workshops, and Manhattan Graphics Center. === EMAIL START ===
From: Julia Margaret Lu <julia@powerhousearts.org>
To: Powerhouse Community <group_powerhouse-community@powerhousearts.org>, 
	group_security <group_security@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-08-01 14:45:49
Subject: Vehicle Access at PHA: Visitors, Gatehouse, Parking

Good Afternoon Colleagues,
Over the past few weeks there have been some conflicts with visitors at the
gatehouse on why they are being detained when this didn't happen before. In
the past the gatehouse security guards were not doing their jobs and they
were just letting everybody through. Mitch and I have been cracking down on
security to keep everyone and our facility safe. To reduce the conflicts at
the gatehouse for visitors please see the security protocols for guests,
vendors, and special deliveries:
There are 2 ways for vehicular guests to gain access to Powerhouse Arts:
1. *Email the security team in advance* at
group_security@powerhousearts.org and
state the following :
Name of the person
Date and time expected
Include parking accommodations (Garage or Forecourt)
The security team will see this email and grant access
to the visitor when they arrive.
2. *Unannounced/unexpected visitors:* If a guest shows up at the gatehouse
the security protocol is to ask them for a contact person. The security
team has a staff list with phone numbers for Powerhouse Arts, Workspace 11,
Alpha Workshops, and Manhattan Graphics Center. The gatehouse security
guard will *call that person* to verify if they should be granted access to
the Powerhouse Arts building.
Please share this protocol with your guests, vendors and for deliveries.
Additionally, please provide a backup contact if you potentially might not
be available and be mindful that if you do not answer your phone from the
security team there could be a delay. If the security team isn't able to
connect with the contact person then they will then be required to contact
the engineering department so they can then find the contact person.
As a reminder, visitors and visiting artists may request parking, but
Ceramics members are limited to Forecourt parking only when loading and
unloading.
THANK YOU for your continued cooperation and dedication to keeping
Powerhouse safe :) Please email Mitch and I directly if you have any
questions/concerns.
- Julia + Mitch
--

Powerhouse Arts

Email the security team in advance at group_security@powerhousearts.org and state the following : Name of the person Date and time expected Include parking accommodations (Garage or Forecourt) The security team will see this email and grant access to the visitor when they arrive. 2. Unannounced/unexpected visitors: If a guest shows up at the gatehouse the security protocol is to ask them for a contact person. The security team has a staff list with phone numbers for Powerhouse Arts, Workspace 11, Alpha Workshops, and Manhattan Graphics Center. The gatehouse security guard will call that person to verify if they should be granted access to the Powerhouse Arts building. Please share this protocol with your guests, vendors and for deliveries. Additionally, please provide a backup contact if you potentially might not be available and be mindful that if you do not answer your phone from the security team there could be a delay. === EMAIL START ===
From: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
To: Mitch Roth <mitch@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-03-10 21:52:16
Subject: sending DMS alerts to facilities team

Hello Mitch!
I know Rudy's OOO for a couple days, and I'll be OOO Monday, so I thought
it may be helpful to summarize where we are with BMS alerts. I'm copying
Dan so he'll know some additional technical details.
Here's the bottom line: BMS critical alerts are now generating emails to
mitch@powerhousearts.org. When you give the word, we can generate emails to
facilitiesengineers@powerhousearts.org. I know the vendor talked about
setting up SMS alerts. If they're not able to deliver on it timely, we can
do it from our side; let me know. As an alternative, we're sending BMS
alerts to a slack channel, #alerts-facilities, which you and your team can
get on now.
Here's some nitty gritty detail:
1. We looked at the BMS system and see that sending alerts is like other
systems we've both used: you need to
1. set up the outgoing email server that the BMS will use to send
email alerts;
2. configure the equipment alarms and put them into groups (like
Critical, Informational);
3. set alerting actions for each groups (like send an email alert for
any Critical alarms).
2. The vendor set up the SMTP (outgoing email) server incorrectly.
Daniel corrected the port number and security protocol setting, and now the
server works. The BMS system has the proper network connections to send
email. The BMS system uses google.smtp.com to send emails FROM the
address bms@powerhousearts.org.
3. As a test we subscribed a new user "status-alerts@powerhousearts.org"
to ALL email alerts, and we subscribed "status-alerts@powerhouserarts.org
and "mitch@powerhousearts.org" to CRITICAL alerts. Alerts are
successfully flowing through. We haven't seen any CRITICAL alerts. That can
be either because there have not been any critical equipment alarms, or
because we have not flagged equipment alarms as CRITICAL, so they don't
fire off an alert.
4.
5.
Here's what's up:
1.
=== EMAIL END ===

Thanks, Eugene. That's disappointing, but I guess not surprising. So, I understand that the only well-supported option for our wireless door readers is ID Cards as we currently use. Out of curiosity, do you have a favorite option if we were building today? On Fri, Jan 26, 2024 at 11:27 AM Eugene Tsukanov wrote:
David and Mitch,
I’ve investigated options for the mobile credentials for the Schlage hardwired locks & Wireless locks.
For the wireless locks, there is no Bluetooth credential capability for these locks installed . There are retrofit kits available that are out there but then it would require
every door lock to be removed, retrofit kit installed, door to be deleted & readded to the system. It is very labor intensive and can become incredibly costly. They are NFC compatible but the technology to use is still in BETA and not available for use yet
to the public due to Apple involvement.
For the hardwired Schlage readers, I believe (if I’m not mistaken), that they are MTB-15 readers which are mobile credential compatible. I believe a few readers are still on site and can confirm on the box.
It’s a yearly reoccurring costs based on the amount of credentials you want to purchase. You would need to revoke the credentials as the “temporary” staff leave the premise. Then you can recycle the credential to someone else. Just keep
this in the back of your minds if you ever decide to go this route.
Keep us posted.

=== EMAIL START ===
From: Eugene Tsukanov <etsukanov@pom-tec.com>
To: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-01-26 16:27:39
Subject: RE: Walkthrough 1/23/2024 Powerhouse Arts

David and Mitch,
I’ve investigated options for the mobile credentials for the Schlage hardwired locks & Wireless locks.
For the wireless locks, there is no Bluetooth credential capability for these locks installed. There are retrofit kits available that are out there but then it would require every door lock to be removed, retrofit kit installed, door to be deleted & readded to the system. It is very labor intensive and can become incredibly costly. They are NFC compatible but the technology to use is still in BETA and not available for use yet to the public due to Apple involvement.
For the hardwired Schlage readers, I believe (if I’m not mistaken), that they are MTB-15 readers which are mobile credential compatible. I believe a few readers are still on site and can confirm on the box.
It’s a yearly reoccurring costs based on the amount of credentials you want to purchase. You would need to revoke the credentials as the “temporary” staff leave the premise. Then you can recycle the credential to someone else. Just keep this in the back of your minds if you ever decide to go this route.
Keep us posted.
I’ve tried to attach Security Center 5.9 to this email if interested in going through all the features of the system to make it more appealing.
I'm using Adobe Acrobat.
Here's the EN.Security Center User Guide 5.9.zip for you to view.
Best Regards
Eugene Tsukanov| Project Engineer

Hi Mitch,
Thank you & David for meeting with myself & John today. I’d like to recap out visit today in this email so we are all on the same page.
Card issues/not being returned:
There seems to be an issue with cardholders returning their cards at the end of the day so you are looking for a reasonable & cost effective solution for temporary guests. I will go over this with John on what we find and present the ideas to you. More so, I think issuing a temporary mobile credential may be the route to go but we will see. Give us some time to look into this and will provide feedback on this.
Namely/Genetec integration:
I had mentioned that there is a tool internal to Genetec but needs to be properly configured to map the 2 entities to be work properly. Id leave this for Genetec to do through their professional services if we decide to go this route. Reason being is because there is an existing database already In the system and would hate if the integration would overwrite what is already in the system. I’ve attached the document from them on this tool.
Wireless lock issue delay:
We may be looking at a distance issue/building structure for that one door to the left of the lobby. Possible solution/test would be to splice a cable, remove gatway and put it directly next to the door and see if this fixes the issue.
Mitch Punch List items:
Powerhouse to finish before we return
E109 door still being worked on.
124A by metal loading & receiving, still missing electrified lock
Hallway on 1st fl by freight elevator- strike installed, no pathway to it.
Hydro car (X1) camera not working: This was corrected today.
Y2 Passenger elevator camera not working: The 2N converter connections had melted internally from possible spike in current. Today, we had noticed that the previously configured cat6 cable, was putting out POE, again when the prior was setup for ETHERNET only. How did we know that? The 2N converter takes only one source of power, so when it detects 120V & power from the POE switch in the 5th floor, it will stay off. It is a very good possibility that a configuration change was made, and both POE & power from the outlet, simultaneously have been giving this 2N converter power for some time now, which had MELTED the converter. The manufacturer will not cover this under warranty. Please see image below:
[Image]
Since the Y2 elevator is deemed the more important elevator, we took the converter from X1 and put it at Y2 to get it back online. IT, needs to configure the PORT to put out ONLY Ethernet and to make sure it is in the correct vlan. I was with Alex at the 5th fl IDF and labeled the patch cord for Y2. It was designated to be plugged into the bottom most switch. Please have IT, configure a port to be on security VLAN(10.0.9.XXX), and to NOT put out POE for this port. Now it is unplugged from switch & unplugged from Y2 converter.
A new converter will be needed to be installed and installed but, in the meantime, IT can manage to correct this very simply. Once configured, you can plug it into the designated port AND in the Y2 elevator controller to the 2n converter. It will come back online immediately.
Front door LED to stay green:
Could not understand why it doesn’t stay green when unlocked. It goes green when you swipe at the reader but that’s about it.
Typically a card reader used 6 conductors, not 4, to have the green LED function. There was 18/4 ran to all the doors so this is more than likely why it wont response to stay green when on an unlock schedule. It wont affect functionality besides just a LED light. Would need to find additional conductors next to the door to get this function to work properly.
License Plate Reader
They are all functioning besides the “entrance LPR on the gatehouse”. LPRs are not designed to show up on the monitoring for videos, its own separate entity. They are working 24/7 and capturing license plates. I had shown Alex on what needs to be done in order to access the cameras. You simply go onto security desk, hit the “READS”, and run reports for specific LPRs. You can adjust the date & time when looking for specific plates.
Here Is todays reads for example:
One camera IS OUT. Undetermined what it is. The camera was installed over a year ago and anything could be a reason for it to not work. These are way beyond warranty repairs and/or free replacements. Its possible that mother nature could be the fault for the camera being defective but regardless of the reason, the camera is not covered under Genetec warranty anymore. We can provide a proposal to include replacing of this camera, if need be. Otherwise, the remaining of the cameras are ALL working properly.
Best Regards
Eugene Tsukanov| Project Engineer

﻿
Hi Eugene:
Copying in Dan, who is our network tech onsite Weekly.
Can you confirm re the 2N converter: does it care if POE is present or not?
I don't know its purpose, but looking at it, and seeing that it's a $300+ item, I would have guessed that it would accept POE or non-POE ethernet, and handle it reasonably.
Also, since all our ethernet is powered by default, it seems likely (Dan may know) that the ethernet going to the burnt converter has always been POE, and the ethernet going to the functioning converter is also POE, which -- if it's true -- would make me think POE is not an issue.
If the converter can handle both POE and non-POE, that would relieve us from the error-prone administrative requirement of ensuring that we keep a port non-powered and keep specific cables in those specific ports.
Thank you for looking into it and educating me.
/dk
Y2 Passenger elevator camera not working: The 2N converter connections had melted internally from possible spike in current. Today, we had noticed that the previously configured cat6 cable, was putting out POE, again when the prior was setup for ETHERNET only. How did we know that? The 2N converter takes only one source of power, so when it detects 120V & power from the POE switch in the 5th floor, it will stay off. It is a very good possibility that a configuration change was made, and both POE & power from the outlet, simultaneously have been giving this 2N converter power for some time now, which had MELTED the converter. The manufacturer will not cover this under warranty. Please see image below:
Since the Y2 elevator is deemed the more important elevator, we took the converter from X1 and put it at Y2 to get it back online. IT, needs to configure the PORT to put out ONLY Ethernet and to make sure it is in the correct vlan. I was with Alex at the 5th fl IDF and labeled the patch cord for Y2. It was designated to be plugged into the bottom most switch. Please have IT, configure a port to be on security VLAN(10.0.9.XXX), and to NOT put out POE for this port. Now it is unplugged from switch & unplugged from Y2 converter.
A new converter will be needed to be installed and installed but, in the meantime, IT can manage to correct this very simply. Once configured, you can plug it into the designated port AND in the Y2 elevator controller to the 2n converter. It will come back online immediately.
