From: Eugene Tsukanov
Date: Tue, Jan 23, 2024 at 4:25 PM
Subject: Walkthrough 1/23/2024 Powerhouse Arts
To: David Koosis , Mitch Roth
Cc: John Coll
Hi Mitch,
Thank you & David for meeting with myself & John today. I’d like to recap
out visit today in this email so we are all on the same page.
*Card issues/not being returned:*
There seems to be an issue with cardholders returning their cards at the
end of the day so you are looking for a reasonable & cost effective
solution for temporary guests. I will go over this with John on what we
find and present the ideas to you. More so, I think issuing a temporary
mobile credential may be the route to go but we will see. Give us some time
to look into this and will provide feedback on this.
*Namely/Genetec integration:*
I had mentioned that there is a tool internal to Genetec but needs to be
properly configured to map the 2 entities to be work properly. Id leave
this for Genetec to do through their professional services if we decide to
go this route. Reason being is because there is an existing database
already In the system and would hate if the integration would overwrite
what is already in the system. I’ve attached the document from them on this
tool.
*Wireless lock issue delay:*
We may be looking at a distance issue/building structure for that one door
to the left of the lobby. Possible solution/test would be to splice a
cable, remove gatway and put it directly next to the door and see if this
fixes the issue.
*Mitch Punch List items:*
*Powerhouse to finish before we return*
*E109 door still being worked on. *
*124A by metal loading & receiving, still missing electrified lock*
*Hallway on 1st fl by freight elevator- strike installed, no pathway to it.*
*Hydro car (X1) camera not working:* This was corrected today.
*Y2 Passenger elevator camera not working: *The 2N converter connections
had melted internally from possible spike in current. Today, we had noticed
that the previously configured cat6 cable, was putting out POE, again when
the prior was setup for ETHERNET only. How did we know that? The 2N
converter takes only one source of power, so when it detects 120V & power
from the POE switch in the 5th floor, it will stay off. It is a very good
possibility that a configuration change was made, and both POE & power from
the outlet, simultaneously have been giving this 2N converter power for
some time now, which had MELTED the converter. The manufacturer will not
cover this under warranty. Please see image below:
[image: Image]
Since the Y2 elevator is deemed the more important elevator, we took the
converter from X1 and put it at Y2 to get it back online. IT, needs to
configure the PORT to put out ONLY Ethernet and to make sure it is in the
correct vlan. I was with Alex at the 5th fl IDF and labeled the patch cord
for Y2. It was designated to be plugged into the bottom most switch. Please
have IT, configure a port to be on security VLAN(10.0.9.XXX), and to NOT
put out POE for this port. Now it is unplugged from switch & unplugged from
Y2 converter.
A new converter will be needed to be installed and installed but, in the
meantime, IT can manage to correct this very simply. Once configured, you
can plug it into the designated port AND in the Y2 elevator controller to
the 2n converter. It will come back online immediately.
*Front door LED to stay green:*
Could not understand why it doesn’t stay green when unlocked. It goes green
when you swipe at the reader but that’s about it.
Typically a card reader used 6 conductors, not 4, to have the green LED
function. There was 18/4 ran to all the doors so this is more than likely
why it wont response to stay green when on an unlock schedule. It wont
affect functionality besides just a LED light. Would need to find
additional conductors next to the door to get this function to work
properly.
*License Plate Reader*
They are all functioning besides the “entrance LPR on the gatehouse”. LPRs
are not designed to show up on the monitoring for videos, its own separate
entity. They are working 24/7 and capturing license plates. I had shown
Alex on what needs to be done in order to access the cameras. You simply go
onto security desk, hit the “READS”, and run reports for specific LPRs. You
can adjust the date & time when looking for specific plates.
Here Is todays reads for example:
*One camera IS OUT. Undetermined what it is.* The camera was installed over
a year ago and anything could be a reason for it to not work. These are way
beyond warranty repairs and/or free replacements. Its possible that mother
nature could be the fault for the camera being defective but regardless of
the reason, the camera is not covered under Genetec warranty anymore. We
can provide a proposal to include replacing of this camera, if need be.
Otherwise, the remaining of the cameras are ALL working properly.
*Best Regards*
*Eugene Tsukanov*| Project Engineer
*POM Technologies*
*330 W 38th St., Suite 611, New York, NY 10018*
*T **212-688-2767* *F **212-764-5625* *C** 917-423-5232*
ETsukanov@pom-tec.com
www.pom-tec.com

From: Eugene Tsukanov <etsukanov@pom-tec.com>
To: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>, Mitch Roth
	<mitch@powerhousearts.org>
Date: 2024-01-23 21:24:53
Subject: Walkthrough 1/23/2024 Powerhouse Arts

Hi Mitch,
Thank you & David for meeting with myself & John today. I'd like to recap out visit today in this email so we are all on the same page.
Card issues/not being returned:
There seems to be an issue with cardholders returning their cards at the end of the day so you are looking for a reasonable & cost effective solution for temporary guests. I will go over this with John on what we find and present the ideas to you. More so, I think issuing a temporary mobile credential may be the route to go but we will see. Give us some time to look into this and will provide feedback on this.
Namely/Genetec integration:
I had mentioned that there is a tool internal to Genetec but needs to be properly configured to map the 2 entities to be work properly. Id leave this for Genetec to do through their professional services if we decide to go this route. Reason being is because there is an existing database already In the system and would hate if the integration would overwrite what is already in the system. I've attached the document from them on this tool.
Wireless lock issue delay:
We may be looking at a distance issue/building structure for that one door to the left of the lobby. Possible solution/test would be to splice a cable, remove gatway and put it directly next to the door and see if this fixes the issue.
Mitch Punch List items:
Powerhouse to finish before we return
E109 door still being worked on.
124A by metal loading & receiving, still missing electrified lock
Hallway on 1st fl by freight elevator- strike installed, no pathway to it.
Hydro car (X1) camera not working: This was corrected today.
Y2 Passenger elevator camera not working: The 2N converter connections had melted internally from possible spike in current. Today, we had noticed that the previously configured cat6 cable, was putting out POE, again when the prior was setup for ETHERNET only. How did we know that? The 2N converter takes only one source of power, so when it detects 120V & power from the POE switch in the 5th floor, it will stay off. It is a very good possibility that a configuration change was made, and both POE & power from the outlet, simultaneously have been giving this 2N converter power for some time now, which had MELTED the converter. The manufacturer will not cover this under warranty. Please see image below:
[Image]
Since the Y2 elevator is deemed the more important elevator, we took the converter from X1 and put it at Y2 to get it back online. IT, needs to configure the PORT to put out ONLY Ethernet and to make sure it is in the correct vlan. I was with Alex at the 5th fl IDF and labeled the patch cord for Y2. It was designated to be plugged into the bottom most switch. Please have IT, configure a port to be on security VLAN(10.0.9.XXX), and to NOT put out POE for this port. Now it is unplugged from switch & unplugged from Y2 converter.
A new converter will be needed to be installed and installed but, in the meantime, IT can manage to correct this very simply. Once configured, you can plug it into the designated port AND in the Y2 elevator controller to the 2n converter. It will come back online immediately.
Front door LED to stay green:
Could not understand why it doesn't stay green when unlocked. It goes green when you swipe at the reader but that's about it.
Typically a card reader used 6 conductors, not 4, to have the green LED function. There was 18/4 ran to all the doors so this is more than likely why it wont response to stay green when on an unlock schedule. It wont affect functionality besides just a LED light. Would need to find additional conductors next to the door to get this function to work properly.
License Plate Reader
They are all functioning besides the "entrance LPR on the gatehouse". LPRs are not designed to show up on the monitoring for videos, its own separate entity. They are working 24/7 and capturing license plates. I had shown Alex on what needs to be done in order to access the cameras. You simply go onto security desk, hit the "READS", and run reports for specific LPRs. You can adjust the date & time when looking for specific plates.
Here Is todays reads for example:
One camera IS OUT. Undetermined what it is. The camera was installed over a year ago and anything could be a reason for it to not work. These are way beyond warranty repairs and/or free replacements. Its possible that mother nature could be the fault for the camera being defective but regardless of the reason, the camera is not covered under Genetec warranty anymore. We can provide a proposal to include replacing of this camera, if need be. Otherwise, the remaining of the cameras are ALL working properly.

to you. More so, I think issuing a temporary mobile credential may be the route to go but we will see. Give us some time to look into this and will provide feedback on this.

being is because there is an existing database already In the system and would hate if the integration would overwrite what is already in the system. I’ve attached the document from them on this tool.

From: David Koosis <vcto@powerhousearts.org>
To: Daniel Lucas <DLucas@thetnsgroup.com>
Date: 2024-01-04 14:50:58
Subject: Re: 

*1) Reverse Proxy Agent Installation*
- Our team will require 1 hour with your IT technician to install the
reverse proxy server. This can be accomplished during the meeting.
- The server requirements for hosting the reverse proxy agent are listed on
the last page of the attached document.
- The dependency is that this is hosted on a Windows or Linux server with
access to the internet (Ports 443, TCP Port 7844, and UDP Port 7845)
*2) Aggregation Server (Niagara) Installation*
- Once the Reverse Proxy Agent is installed, we will need to install
Niagara to operate as the aggregation server for the site.
- This can be hosted on the same, or different, available server on the
network that has a network connection to the reverse proxy agent (from Step
1) and the EnteliWEB server.
- Our proposal includes performing the installation of the Aggregation
Server and the discovery of all BACnet points on the network.
- Server requirements for Niagara can be found here: Niagara Server
Requirements
Both steps are dependent upon having a loc

From: Robert Nieves <rnieves@thetnsgroup.com>
To: Erika Ellis <EEllis@thetnsgroup.com>, David Koosis
	<vcto@powerhousearts.org>, "The TNS Group, Support Team"
	<Support@thetnsgroup.com>
Date: 2024-01-12 00:48:46
Subject: RE: Ticket#5354335/Powerhouse/Re: network hiccup? -- has been updated

Hello David,
We have several methods of monitoring your ISP and Network equipment.
PRTG is our monitoring software for your ISP.
We have probes that will continuously ping the ISP IP’s. Should an ISP go down, a ticket is automatically generated and handle by our team. These come in as code red and are handled promptly. POC’s are always notified in these scenarios.
As you will see from the Graphs below, there were no packet loss on 1/9 and 1/10, thus no alert was sent to us.
[A screenshot of a computer Description automatically generated]
[A screenshot of a computer Description automatically generated]
For the internal network, we also have alerts generated from the Meraki systems should internal wifi or switches go offline.
This also showed to be stable during the outage indicated. Also with your two ISPs you would have failover, should the primary ISP go down the secondary would kick in.
We can try to do some more in depth analysis to try and pinpoint the issues with you devices at the time of the network delay.
Would you be able to provide the mac address or IP of the devices in question. I can try to see which APs those were connected to and see if there were any issues with the APs as well.
Rob Nieves
rnieves@thetnsgroup.com

This ticket has been updated by Dan Lucas
Dan Lucas
1/10/2024 4:58 PM
Hello David
After look into this outage it looks like all of devices remained online when the internet for cogent had a blip.
This why there is no alert for an isp link being down, to ensure all is well I reinstalled the PRTG probes that are connected to the switch at power house I will continue to wait to hear back from cogent to see why their internet went down.
Thanks
Daniel Lucas

Request:
Put in place an alert or tripwire so that the tech team is able to alert users to outages, rather than the other way around.*
Adding some data points:
Jan 9
- 2:24PM Luther reported being unable to get to Box
- 2:35PM Megan reported "the wifi is out"
- 2:39PM Jenn Choi reported problems getting online
In this time frame Steve came to me and reported that he and others in a meeting in the main conference room lost WiFi.
When I checked, I saw WiFi signal but no internet access, and within a minute it came back online.
It felt like an ISP outage / power outage on a key device / DNS issue.
Hi All:
FYI: it seems as if WiFi on PH Internal went offline for a minute within the past 10 minutes.
Can you take look and let me know if you see anything?

This email has been scanned for spam and viruses by Proofpoint Essentials. Click here to report this email as spam.
Hello David,
We have several methods of monitoring your ISP and Network equipment.
PRTG is our monitoring software for your ISP.
We have probes that will continuously ping the ISP IP’s. Should an ISP go down, a ticket is automatically generated and handle by our team. These come in as code red and are handled promptly. POC’s are always notified in these scenarios.
As you will see from the Graphs below, there were no packet loss on 1/9 and 1/10, thus no alert was sent to us.
For the internal network, we also have alerts generated from the Meraki systems should internal wifi or switches go offline.
This also showed to be stable during the outage indicated. Also with your two ISPs you would have failover, should the primary ISP go down the secondary would kick in.
We can try to do some more in depth analysis to try and pinpoint the issues with you devices at the time of the network delay.
Would you be able to provide the mac address or IP of the devices in question. I can try to see which APs those were connected to and see if there were any issues with the APs as well.
Rob Nieves
rnieves@thetnsgroup.com
The TNS Group is proud to be part of the Omega Systems family. Learn
more here .
From: Erika Ellis
Sent: Thursday, January 11, 2024 10:45 AM
To: David Koosis ; The TNS Group, Support Team ; Robert Nieves

Thank you, Dan!
Hi David,
Steve and Rob were reviewing this when you sent the ticket in. Rob is going through the ticket/issues so he can provide a detailed response. He will get back to you by the end of the day today (Rob is copied here).
For any network concerns, our support team leads will escalate to engineering so they can review all facets of the situation in further detail. Yes, we have monitoring in place for the network and Internet. This is also on our agenda
for next week to explain or monitoring so we can answer any questions.
Thank you, Erika

For any network concerns, our support team leads will escalate to engineering so they can review all facets of the situation in further detail. Yes, we have monitoring in place for the network and Internet. This is also on our agenda for next week to explain or monitoring so we can answer any questions.
Thank you, Erika
Erika Ellis
O: 212-967-5757 option 2
EEllis@thetnsgroup.com

Adding some data points:
Jan 9
- 2:24PM Luther reported being unable to get to Box
- 2:35PM Megan reported "the wifi is out"
- 2:39PM Jenn Choi reported problems getting online
In this time frame Steve came to me and reported that he and others in a meeting in the main conference room lost WiFi.
When I checked, I saw WiFi signal but no internet access, and within a minute it came back online.
It felt like an ISP outage / power outage on a key device / DNS issue.
Hi All:
FYI: it seems as if WiFi on PH Internal went offline for a minute within the past 10 minutes.
Can you take look and let me know if you see anything?
